title: Hyperbolic Arctangent Function (ATANH)
description: This function calculates the hyperbolic arctangent of a given real number input, X, using the formula ATANH(X) = 0.5 * LN((1 + X) / (1 - X)). The function returns a real number corresponding to the hyperbolic arctangent of the input value.
name: ATANH

input.name: X
input.description: A real number input for which the hyperbolic arctangent is to be calculated.

return_value.description: The hyperbolic arctangent of the input value X.

title: Convert DATE and TOD to Structured Date Time (SDT)
description: This function converts a DATE and a Time-of-Day (TOD) into a structured date time format (SDT). It extracts the year, month, day, weekday, milliseconds, seconds, minutes, and hours from the given DATE and TOD inputs and packs them into the SDT structure.
name: DT2_TO_SDT

input.name: DI
input.description: Input variable of type DATE representing the date to convert.

input.name: TI
input.description: Input variable of type TOD representing the time of day to convert.

output.name: SDT
output.description: Output structure containing the converted date and time components.

fields.name: YEAR
fields.description: The year extracted from the DATE.

fields.name: MONTH
fields.description: The month extracted from the DATE.

fields.name: DAY
fields.description: The day of the month extracted from the DATE.

fields.name: WEEKDAY
fields.description: The weekday corresponding to the DATE (0 = Sunday, 1 = Monday, etc.).

fields.name: MS
fields.description: The milliseconds component extracted from the TOD.

fields.name: SECOND
fields.description: The seconds component extracted from the TOD.

fields.name: MINUTE
fields.description: The minutes component extracted from the TOD.

fields.name: HOUR
fields.description: The hours component extracted from the TOD.

return_value.description: Returns the structured date time containing all the extracted date and time information.

fields.name: YEAR
fields.description: The year of the structured date time.

fields.name: MONTH
fields.description: The month of the structured date time.

fields.name: DAY
fields.description: The day of the structured date time.

fields.name: WEEKDAY
fields.description: The weekday of the structured date time.

fields.name: MS
fields.description: The milliseconds of the structured date time.

fields.name: SECOND
fields.description: The seconds of the structured date time.

fields.name: MINUTE
fields.description: The minutes of the structured date time.

fields.name: HOUR
fields.description: The hours of the structured date time.

title: Convert Day to Time
description: This function converts a given number of days (as a real number) into a time representation, specifically returning the result in TIME format. The conversion is performed by multiplying the input days by the number of milliseconds in a day (86400000) and then converting the resultant value to TIME type.
name: DAY_TO_TIME

input.name: IN
input.description: The input value representing a duration in days that needs to be converted into time.

output.name: TIME
output.description: The output value representing the equivalent time format after conversion from the input days.

return_value.description: The TIME value that represents the input duration in days converted to time.

title: Calculate Day of Year
description: This function calculates the day of the year from a given date. It converts the input date into an unsigned integer format, computes the day of the year by performing division and modulus operations, and adjusts the value based on specific criteria.
name: DAY_OF_YEAR

input.name: IDATE
input.description: The input date from which the day of the year needs to be calculated.

return_value.description: The calculated day of the year as an integer value.

title: Byte to Gray Code Conversion
description: This function converts an 8-bit byte input into its corresponding Gray code representation. The conversion is performed using the XOR operation between the input byte and the right-shifted version of itself.
name: BYTE_TO_GRAY

input.name: IN
input.description: An 8-bit byte that needs to be converted to Gray code.

output.name: BYTE_TO_GRAY
output.description: The resulting Gray code representation of the input byte.

return_value.description: The Gray code equivalent of the input byte.

title: Delete Characters from String
description: This function takes an input string and removes specific characters defined in another string. The process continues until all occurrences of the specified characters are removed from the input string.
name: DEL_CHARS

input.name: IN
input.description: The input string from which characters will be deleted.

input.name: CX
input.description: A string containing the characters to be deleted from the input string.

output.name: DEL_CHARS
output.description: The modified string after the specified characters have been deleted.

return_value.description: The resulting string after all specified characters have been removed.

title: Click Counter Function Block
description: This function block is designed to count the number of falling edges of the input signal 'IN' according to a specified time interval 'TC'. It triggers the output 'Q' to be active for one cycle once the count reaches the value 'N'. The block must handle the rising edge and falling edge of the input correctly, maintaining the count across cycles.
name: CLICK_CNT

input.name: IN
input.description: A boolean input signal that indicates when an event occurs.

input.name: N
input.description: An integer that specifies the number of falling edges that should be counted before setting the output Q.

input.name: TC
input.description: A time parameter that defines the time interval for which the input signal is observed.

output.name: Q
output.description: A boolean output that is activated for one cycle when the defined count of falling edges is reached.

title: Floor Function Conversion
description: This function takes a real number as input and converts it to a DINT (double integer) by flooring the real number. If the conversion leads to a higher value than the input, it decrements the resultant DINT by 1 to ensure it represents the largest integer less than or equal to the provided real number.
name: FLOOR2

input.name: X
input.description: A real number which will be converted to a DINT by flooring.

return_value.description: The floored integer value derived from the input real number.

title: Coth Function Calculation
description: This function computes the hyperbolic cotangent of a given real number. It returns specific values based on the input range: for inputs greater than 20.0, it returns 1.0; for inputs less than -20.0, it returns -1.0; otherwise, it calculates the cotangent based on the formula 1.0 + 2.0 / (EXP(X * 2.0) - 1.0).
name: COTH

input.name: X
input.description: The real number input for which the hyperbolic cotangent will be calculated.

output.name: COTH
output.description: The calculated hyperbolic cotangent value based on the input X.

return_value.description: Returns the computed hyperbolic cotangent value.

title: Check if a Byte is a Valid Hex Character
description: This function takes a byte as input and checks if it corresponds to a valid hexadecimal character. Valid hexadecimal characters are 0-9, A-F, and a-f. The function should return TRUE if the input byte represents a valid hex character, and FALSE otherwise.
name: ISC_HEX

input.name: IN
input.description: The input byte to be checked if it is a valid hexadecimal character.

return_value.description: Returns TRUE if the input byte is a valid hexadecimal character, FALSE otherwise.

title: Calculate Day of Date
description: This function calculates the day of the date from a provided date input. The calculation is performed by converting the date to a DWORD format and then dividing by the number of seconds in a day (86400). The output is returned as a DINT, which allows for a larger range of date values.
name: DAY_OF_DATE

input.name: idate
input.description: The date for which the day of the date is to be calculated.

output.name: DAY_OF_DATE
output.description: The calculated day of the date as a DINT value, which accommodates a range of 49710 days.

return_value.description: The computed day of the date returned as a DINT value.

title: FF_D2E Function Block
description: This function block implements a flip-flop mechanism that responds to input signals and controls its output based on clock and reset signals. When the reset signal is activated, the outputs are set to false. On the rising edge of the clock signal, the outputs are assigned the values of the input signals D0 and D1.
name: FF_D2E

input.name: D0
input.description: Boolean input signal to determine the state of output Q0.

input.name: D1
input.description: Boolean input signal to determine the state of output Q1.

input.name: CLK
input.description: Clock input signal that triggers the state change on the flip-flop.

input.name: RST
input.description: Reset input signal that sets the output values to false when activated.

output.name: Q0
output.description: Output signal representing the state determined by input D0.

output.name: Q1
output.description: Output signal representing the state determined by input D1.

title: Delay Function Block
description: This function block implements a delay mechanism that holds a buffer of input values. It takes a real input value and delays its output based on a specified number of cycles. The buffer is reset under certain conditions.
name: DELAY

input.name: IN
input.description: The real number input value to be processed by the delay block.

input.name: N
input.description: The number of cycles to delay the input. This value is limited to a maximum of 32.

input.name: RST
input.description: A boolean flag to reset the block. If true, the buffer will be reset.

output.name: OUT
output.description: The output value from the delay block, which is the delayed version of the input.

title: Increment/Decrement Counter Function Block
description: This function block implements a counter that can be incremented or decremented based on the input signals. It uses two channels (CHa, CHb) to determine the counting direction and an optional reset signal (RST) to set the counter back to zero.
name: INC_DEC

input.name: CHa
input.description: Input signal for channel A. Determines if an increment or decrement pulse is generated.

input.name: CHb
input.description: Input signal for channel B. Determines if an increment or decrement pulse is generated.

input.name: RST
input.description: Reset signal. When active, resets the counter to zero.

output.name: dir
output.description: Output indicating the direction of counting. TRUE for increment, FALSE for decrement.

output.name: cnt
output.description: Output showing the current value of the counter.

title: Set R2 Parameters
description: This function is responsible for setting the parameters of the R2 entity. It takes a single real number input and initializes the first parameter RX to this value while setting the second parameter R1 to a constant value of 0.0.
name: R2_SET

input.name: X
input.description: Input parameter representing a real number value to set RX.

return_value.description: Returns the modified R2 entity which includes RX set to the input value and R1 set to 0.0.

title: Control Character String Checker
description: This function checks if a given string consists solely of control characters. It returns TRUE if the string is valid (greater than zero in length), and FALSE if any character in the string is not a control character.
name: IS_CTRL

input.name: STR
input.description: The input string to be checked for control characters.

return_value.description: The function returns TRUE if the string consists only of control characters, otherwise FALSE.

title: Complementary Error Function Calculation
description: This function calculates the complementary error function (ERFC) based on the input value X. The function utilizes the standard error function (ERF) and returns the result as a real number.
name: ERFC

input.name: X
input.description: The input value for which the complementary error function is to be calculated.

return_value.description: The value of the complementary error function computed from the input X.

title: Filter Block
description: The FILTER_W function block is designed to implement a filtering algorithm that processes an input value (X) over a specified time interval (T). It initializes on the first call, maintains state across calls, and adjusts the output (Y) based on the input and time elapsed.
name: FILTER_W

input.name: X
input.description: Input value to be filtered.

input.name: T
input.description: Time interval for filtering.

output.name: Y
output.description: Filtered output value.

title: Convert Local Time to UTC
description: This function converts a given local time to Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) based on the provided time zone offset and considers Daylight Saving Time (DST) if applicable.
name: LTIME_TO_UTC

input.name: LOCAL_TIME
input.description: The local time to be converted to UTC.

input.name: DST
input.description: A boolean flag indicating if Daylight Saving Time should be considered.

input.name: TIME_ZONE_OFFSET
input.description: The offset of the local time from UTC in minutes.

return_value.description: The converted UTC time.

title: Ramp Function Block
description: This function block implements a ramping behavior that adjusts an output value towards a target input value based on specified ramp-up and ramp-down rates, while tracking the busy state and direction of ramping.
name: FT_RMP

input.name: Rmp
input.description: Control flag to enable or disable ramping behavior.

input.name: in
input.description: Target input value to which the output will ramp.

input.name: KR
input.description: Ramp-up rate; determines how quickly the output will increase towards the input value.

input.name: KF
input.description: Ramp-down rate; determines how quickly the output will decrease towards the input value.

output.name: out
output.description: Current output value being ramped, based on the input value.

output.name: busy
output.description: Indicates whether the output is currently in the process of ramping.

output.name: UD
output.description: Direction flag indicating whether the output is ramping up (TRUE) or down (FALSE).

title: String Cleaning Function
description: This function cleans a given input string by removing characters that are not found in a specified allowed character set. The function scans through each character of the input string and constructs a new string containing only the valid characters.
name: CLEAN

input.name: IN
input.description: The input string that needs to be cleaned.

input.name: CX
input.description: A string containing the allowed characters. Only characters found in this string will remain in the output.

output.name: CLEAN
output.description: The cleaned string, containing only allowed characters.

return_value.description: The final cleaned version of the input string.

title: Complex Division Function
description: This function performs division of two complex numbers X and Y. The result is a complex number returned by the function, where each component of the complex number is calculated based on the real and imaginary parts of the input complex numbers.
name: CDIV

input.name: X
input.description: The first complex number to be divided, represented by its real and imaginary components.

input.name: Y
input.description: The second complex number, which is the divisor in the division operation.

return_value.description: The result of the division of complex number X by complex number Y.

fields.name: re
fields.description: The real part of the result of the complex division.

fields.name: im
fields.description: The imaginary part of the result of the complex division.

title: Scheduler Function Block
description: This function block acts as a scheduler that utilizes input events and counts to control output signals. The block evaluates certain conditions based on inputs and current cycle count to determine the state of the outputs.
name: SCHEDULER_2

input.name: E0
input.description: Event input signal 0 that affects output Q0.

input.name: E1
input.description: Event input signal 1 that affects output Q1.

input.name: E2
input.description: Event input signal 2 that affects output Q2.

input.name: E3
input.description: Event input signal 3 that affects output Q3.

input.name: C0
input.description: Cycle count threshold for input E0.

input.name: C1
input.description: Cycle count threshold for input E1.

input.name: C2
input.description: Cycle count threshold for input E2.

input.name: C3
input.description: Cycle count threshold for input E3.

input.name: O0
input.description: Offset value for input signal E0.

input.name: O1
input.description: Offset value for input signal E1.

input.name: O2
input.description: Offset value for input signal E2.

input.name: O3
input.description: Offset value for input signal E3.

output.name: Q0
output.description: Output signal 0 indicating if the condition for E0 is met.

output.name: Q1
output.description: Output signal 1 indicating if the condition for E1 is met.

output.name: Q2
output.description: Output signal 2 indicating if the condition for E2 is met.

output.name: Q3
output.description: Output signal 3 indicating if the condition for E3 is met.

title: Check Real Number
description: This function checks the IEEE754 representation of a real number and returns a corresponding byte value indicating the status of the number: normalized, denormalized, positive infinity, negative infinity, or NaN.
name: CHK_REAL

input.name: X
input.description: The real number to be checked.

return_value.description: Returns a byte indicating the status of the real number according to IEEE754 standards.

title: Complex Exponential Function
description: This function calculates the complex exponential of a given complex number. The exponential of a complex number is computed using its real and imaginary parts, where the result is a complex number with real and imaginary components derived from the exponential and trigonometric functions.
name: CEXP

input.name: X
input.description: The input complex number for which the exponential is to be calculated.

output.name: CEXP
output.description: The resulting complex number after computing the exponential of the input.

return_value.description: Returns the computed complex exponential value.

fields.name: re
fields.description: The real part of the computed complex exponential.

fields.name: im
fields.description: The imaginary part of the computed complex exponential.

title: Complex Subtraction Function
description: This function performs subtraction between two complex numbers X and Y, returning the result as a complex number. The real part of the result is obtained by subtracting the real parts of X and Y, and the imaginary part is obtained by subtracting the imaginary parts of X and Y.
name: CSUB

input.name: X
input.description: The first complex number from which the second complex number will be subtracted.

input.name: Y
input.description: The second complex number which will be subtracted from the first complex number.

return_value.description: The complex result obtained by subtracting Y from X.

fields.name: re
fields.description: The real part of the result.

fields.name: im
fields.description: The imaginary part of the result.

title: Real-Time Clock Management Function Block
description: This function block, RTC_MS, is responsible for managing the real-time clock by updating the clock value based on the given parameters and maintaining a count of milliseconds since the last update. The block initializes the clock when the SET input is true or after a power-up, and it increments the clock based on the elapsed time measured in milliseconds.
name: RTC_MS

input.name: SET
input.description: A boolean flag to initiate the clock setting process.

input.name: SDT
input.description: The current date and time to set the clock to.

input.name: SMS
input.description: The initial count of milliseconds to set.

output.name: XDT
output.description: The updated date and time after processing.

output.name: XMS
output.description: The updated count of milliseconds since the last clock update.

title: Dead Zone Function Block
description: This function block applies a dead zone to the input signal. If the absolute value of the input 'X' exceeds the threshold 'L', the output 'Y' is set to 'X'. If 'Y' is positive, 'Y' is set to 'L'; otherwise, 'Y' is set to '-L'.
name: DEAD_ZONE2

input.name: X
input.description: The input value that is processed by the dead zone logic.

input.name: L
input.description: The dead zone threshold value. If the absolute value of 'X' is less than or equal to 'L', 'Y' will be set to either 'L' or '-L'.

output.name: Y
output.description: The output value after applying the dead zone logic based on the input 'X' and threshold 'L'.

title: Status to ESR Data Converter
description: This function converts a status byte into an ESR data structure based on the provided inputs. The function classifies the status into types and populates the ESR data with the corresponding parameters.
name: STATUS_TO_ESR

input.name: status
input.description: A byte representing the status value which determines the type of ESR data.

input.name: adress
input.description: A string of up to 10 characters representing the address associated with the ESR data.

input.name: DT_in
input.description: A date and time input that represents the timestamp to be stored in the ESR data.

input.name: TS
input.description: A time input that indicates the time to be included in the ESR data.

output.name: esr_data
output.description: The output ESR data structure filled based on the input parameters and logic applied within the function.

fields.name: typ
fields.description: The type classification of the ESR data, determined by the status value.

fields.name: adress
fields.description: The address associated with the ESR data.

fields.name: DS
fields.description: The date and time input retained in the ESR data.

fields.name: TS
fields.description: The time input retained in the ESR data.

fields.name: data
fields.description: An array storing the status input at index 0.

return_value.description: This function does not return a value directly, but modifies the output variable 'esr_data' instead.

title: String to DateTime Conversion
description: This function converts a formatted string representation of date and time into a DateTime (DT) type. It extracts year, month, day, hour, minute, and second from the input string based on the provided format.
name: FSTRING_TO_DT

input.name: SDT
input.description: Input variable for the source data text which contains the date and time as a string.

input.name: FMT
input.description: Input variable for the format that specifies how to interpret the source data text.

output.name: FSTRING_TO_DT
output.description: The resulting DateTime value extracted from the provided string based on the specified format.

return_value.description: The return value is the DateTime constructed from the parsed string.

title: Sun Position Calculation
description: This function block calculates the position of the sun given the geographic coordinates (latitude and longitude) and the current UTC time. The output includes the solar zenith angle (B), the solar altitude angle (H), and the hour angle (HR).
name: SUN_POS

input.name: latitude
input.description: Latitude of the geographical position.

input.name: longitude
input.description: Longitude of the geographical position.

input.name: utc
input.description: World time in UTC.

output.name: B
output.description: Solar zenith angle in degrees.

output.name: H
output.description: Solar altitude angle in degrees.

output.name: HR
output.description: Hour angle in degrees.

title: Minimum and Maximum Value Calculation
description: This function block calculates the minimum and maximum values from a stream of input data. It resets the calculated values when requested and initializes them based on the first input received.
name: FT_MIN_MAX

input.name: in
input.description: The input value for which the minimum or maximum is to be calculated.

input.name: rst
input.description: A reset flag that, when true, resets the minimum and maximum values.

output.name: mx
output.description: The current maximum value calculated.

output.name: mn
output.description: The current minimum value calculated.

title: Determine Month of a Given Date
description: This function calculates the month of the year based on the provided date. It considers whether the year is a leap year to accurately determine the month from the day of the year represented by the input date.
name: MONTH_OF_DATE

input.name: IDATE
input.description: The date for which the month needs to be determined.

output.name: MONTH_OF_DATE
output.description: The month of the year corresponding to the given date, as an integer value.

return_value.description: Returns the calculated month of the year based on the input date.

title: Factorial Calculation Function
description: This function calculates the factorial of a given integer X. If X is between 0 and 12 inclusive, it retrieves the factorial from a predefined array. If X is outside this range, it returns -1. The function handles edge cases such as negative numbers and ensures proper performance.
name: FACT

input.name: X
input.description: The integer input for which the factorial is to be calculated.

output.name: FACT
output.description: Returns the factorial of the input integer X, or -1 if the input is out of valid range.

return_value.description: The factorial of the integer X or -1 if X is out of the acceptable range.

title: Find Number in String
description: This function searches for the first occurrence of a numeric character (0-9) or a decimal point (.) in a given string, starting from a specified position. If a numeric character is found, it returns the index of that character; if no such character is found, it returns 0.
name: FIND_NUM

input.name: str
input.description: The string to be searched for numeric characters.

input.name: pos
input.description: The starting position from which to begin the search for numeric characters.

output.name: FIND_NUM
output.description: The index of the first numeric character found in the string; returns 0 if no numeric character is found.

return_value.description: Returns the index of the first numeric character or 0 if none is found.

title: Counting Block
description: The COUNT_BR block is designed to implement a counting mechanism that can be controlled through various input parameters including set, increment, decrement, and reset functionalities. It keeps track of a count value that can be modified based on the provided input signals and configurable step and maximum values.
name: COUNT_BR

input.name: SET
input.description: A boolean input that, when true, sets the count to the input value.

input.name: IN
input.description: A byte input representing the value to reset to when SET is activated.

input.name: UP
input.description: A boolean input indicating an increment request for the count.

input.name: DN
input.description: A boolean input indicating a decrement request for the count.

input.name: STEP
input.description: A byte parameter that defines the step size for increments and decrements. Defaults to 1.

input.name: MX
input.description: A byte parameter that sets the maximum limit for the count. Defaults to 255.

input.name: RST
input.description: A boolean input that, when true, resets the count to zero.

output.name: CNT
output.description: The current count value after processing the inputs.

title: 16-Element Stack Function Block
description: This function block implements a stack data structure with a fixed capacity of 16 elements. It supports reading from and writing to the stack, along with reset functionality. The stack operates in a first-in-last-out (FILO) manner, and the block provides status indicators for the emptiness and fullness of the stack.
name: STACK_16

input.name: Din
input.description: The data input to be written to the stack.

input.name: E
input.description: Enable input, which must be TRUE for read or write operations to occur. Defaults to TRUE.

input.name: RD
input.description: Read signal, which when TRUE and stack is not empty, triggers the reading of the top element from the stack.

input.name: WD
input.description: Write signal, which when TRUE and stack is not full, triggers the writing of the input data to the stack.

input.name: RST
input.description: Reset signal, when TRUE resets the stack to its initial state.

output.name: Dout
output.description: The data output that provides the most recently read value from the stack.

output.name: EMPTY
output.description: Indicates if the stack is empty. TRUE if the stack is empty.

output.name: FULL
output.description: Indicates if the stack is full. TRUE if the stack is full.

title: Check if a 3D Vector is Null
description: This function checks whether the input 3D vector is a null vector (i.e., all its components are zero). It returns a boolean value indicating the result of this check.
name: V3_NUL

input.name: A
input.description: A 3D vector whose components will be checked to determine if it is a null vector.

return_value.description: Returns TRUE if the vector A is a null vector (all components are zero); otherwise, returns FALSE.

title: Check Even Number
description: This function checks whether a given integer input is an even number. It returns TRUE if the number is even, and FALSE if it is odd.
name: EVEN

input.name: in
input.description: Input variable that represents the integer to be checked for evenness.

return_value.description: The boolean result indicating if the input number is even (TRUE) or odd (FALSE).

title: Driver Control Function Block
description: This function block, DRIVER_4, handles the control of multiple driver instances based on input signals. It toggles modes, manages timeouts, and establishes output states for four outputs (Q0 to Q3) based on the respective inputs and reset signals.
name: DRIVER_4

input.name: Toggle_Mode
input.description: A boolean value indicating the mode of operation to toggle.

input.name: Timeout
input.description: A time duration which sets the timeout for the drivers.

input.name: SET
input.description: A boolean signal to set the driver functionality.

input.name: IN0
input.description: Input signal for the first driver instance.

input.name: IN1
input.description: Input signal for the second driver instance.

input.name: IN2
input.description: Input signal for the third driver instance.

input.name: IN3
input.description: Input signal for the fourth driver instance.

input.name: RST
input.description: Reset signal to clear the driver states.

output.name: Q0
output.description: Output state of the first driver instance.

output.name: Q1
output.description: Output state of the second driver instance.

output.name: Q2
output.description: Output state of the third driver instance.

output.name: Q3
output.description: Output state of the fourth driver instance.

title: Shift Right Operation
description: This function performs a logical right shift operation on a given DWORD input. The function takes an input value and a shift amount, and it shifts the input to the right by the specified number of bits, filling the leftmost bits with zeros. The operation utilizes a temporary constant for internal calculations.
name: SHR1

input.name: IN
input.description: The input DWORD value to be shifted.

input.name: N
input.description: The number of bits to shift the input value to the right.

return_value.description: The result of the logical right shift operation on the input value.

title: Array Absolute Value Calculation
description: This function iterates through an array of real numbers and replaces each element with its absolute value. The input is a pointer to the array and its size. The function should return TRUE upon successful execution.
name: _ARRAY_ABS

input.name: pt
input.description: A pointer to the array of real numbers whose absolute values need to be calculated.

input.name: size
input.description: The number of elements in the array.

return_value.description: Returns TRUE if the absolute values were successfully calculated.

title: Holiday Calculation
description: This FUNCTION_BLOCK calculates whether a given date is a holiday and provides the name of the holiday in the specified language. The block takes into consideration fixed date holidays, holidays based on Easter, and weekends based on user-defined parameters.
name: HOLIDAY

input.name: DATE_IN
input.description: The date to check for a holiday.

input.name: LANGU
input.description: The language code to determine the holiday name.

input.name: FRIDAY
input.description: Indicates whether Friday should be considered as a weekend.

input.name: SATURDAY
input.description: Indicates whether Saturday should be considered as a weekend.

input.name: SUNDAY
input.description: Indicates whether Sunday should be considered as a weekend.

output.name: Y
output.description: Indicates whether the date is a holiday.

output.name: NAME
output.description: The name of the holiday, if any, corresponding to the given date.

in/out.name: HOLIDAYS
in/out.description: An array containing holiday data to be checked against the input date.

title: Conversion from SDT to DT
description: This function takes an input of type SDT (Structured Date Time) and converts it into a DT (Date Time) format. The conversion utilizes specific fields from the SDT structure such as year, month, day, hour, minute, and second to generate the corresponding DT value.
name: SDT_TO_DT

input.name: DTI
input.description: Input parameter of type SDT that holds the structured date time information.

return_value.description: The resulting date time value in DT format after conversion from the SDT input.

title: Extract Bit from DWORD
description: This function determines whether the specific bit in a DWORD variable is set. Given a DWORD input and a specified bit position, the function will return TRUE if the bit is set and FALSE otherwise.
name: BIT_OF_DWORD

input.name: in
input.description: The DWORD input value from which the bit is extracted.

input.name: N
input.description: The position of the bit to check in the DWORD input.

output.name: BIT_OF_DWORD
output.description: A boolean value indicating if the specified bit is set in the input DWORD.

return_value.description: Returns TRUE if the specified bit is set, otherwise FALSE.

title: 8-channel Digital Output Controller
description: This FUNCTION_BLOCK is designed to control 8 digital output channels based on a 3-bit input address and a data signal. The block takes a data input (D) and three address inputs (A0, A1, A2) which together determine which of the eight outputs (Q0 to Q7) will receive the value of D.
name: DEC_8

input.name: D
input.description: The input data signal that will be assigned to one of the output channels based on the address.

input.name: A0
input.description: The least significant bit of the address that specifies which channel to control.

input.name: A1
input.description: The middle bit of the address that specifies which channel to control.

input.name: A2
input.description: The most significant bit of the address that specifies which channel to control.

output.name: Q0
output.description: Output channel 0, which receives the value of D if the address is 0.

output.name: Q1
output.description: Output channel 1, which receives the value of D if the address is 1.

output.name: Q2
output.description: Output channel 2, which receives the value of D if the address is 2.

output.name: Q3
output.description: Output channel 3, which receives the value of D if the address is 3.

output.name: Q4
output.description: Output channel 4, which receives the value of D if the address is 4.

output.name: Q5
output.description: Output channel 5, which receives the value of D if the address is 5.

output.name: Q6
output.description: Output channel 6, which receives the value of D if the address is 6.

output.name: Q7
output.description: Output channel 7, which receives the value of D if the address is 7.

title: Convert Structured Date Time to Date
description: This function converts a structured date time (SDT) into a standard date format. The input consists of a structured data type containing year, month, and day. The function returns the corresponding date.
name: SDT_TO_DATE

input.name: DTI
input.description: The structured date time input that contains the year, month, and day.

return_value.description: The resulting date generated from the structured date time.

title: Ramp Control Block
description: This function block controls a ramping output based on the direction and timing parameters. It takes into account the input direction, enable signal, and a timing reference to update the ramp output accordingly.
name: _RMP_B

input.name: DIR
input.description: Indicates the direction of the ramp. 'true' means ramping up.

input.name: E
input.description: Enable signal for the ramp control. Defaults to TRUE.

input.name: TR
input.description: Timing reference to control the ramping duration.

output.name: RMP
output.description: Output value representing the current state of the ramp.

title: Check Parity
description: This function computes the parity of a given DWORD input. It processes the bits of the input by checking their values and combines the results to determine if the overall parity is even or odd, adjusting the outcome based on the input parameter 'p'.
name: CHECK_PARITY

input.name: in
input.description: A DWORD input whose parity is to be checked.

input.name: p
input.description: A boolean parameter that is used to adjust the final parity result.

return_value.description: The computed parity result, where TRUE indicates odd parity and FALSE indicates even parity.

title: Band Operation Function
description: This function performs a band operation on two BYTE inputs, X and B. It returns a BYTE result based on the comparison of these inputs. If X is less than B, the result is 0. If X exceeds the maximum allowable value after subtracting B from 255, the result is capped at 255. Otherwise, the function returns X.
name: BAND_B

input.name: X
input.description: The first input value for the band operation.

input.name: B
input.description: The second input value for the band operation.

return_value.description: The result of the band operation based on the input values.

title: Minute Extraction from DateTime
description: This function is designed to extract the minute component from a DateTime input. It takes a DateTime value and computes the minute by converting it to DWORD format, applying a modulo operation to isolate the seconds, and then dividing by 60 to get the minute.
name: MINUTE_OF_DT

input.name: XDT
input.description: The DateTime value from which the minute is to be extracted.

return_value.description: The extracted minute value from the given DateTime.

title: Calculate Temperature from Resistance
description: This function calculates the temperature in degrees Celsius based on the resistance input. It uses the resistance value and a reference resistance to determine the temperature either directly via a quadratic formula or through successive approximation if the quadratic equation does not yield a valid result.
name: TEMP_PT

input.name: Res
input.description: The resistance value to be used for temperature calculation.

input.name: R0
input.description: The reference resistance value used for comparison.

output.name: TEMP_PT
output.description: The calculated temperature in degrees Celsius based on the input resistance.

return_value.description: Returns the computed temperature value.

title: Calculate Year-End Date from Year Integer
description: This function takes an integer year as input and calculates the corresponding year-end date. The calculation is based on a specific formula that involves converting the year into a DWORD and manipulating it to derive the date representation.
name: YEAR_END

input.name: y
input.description: The input variable representing the year as an integer.

return_value.description: The calculated year-end date corresponding to the input year.

title: Calibration Block
description: This function block is responsible for calibrating input values based on specific conditions and scaling factors. It calculates an output value based on the calibration operations decided by the input control signals and the offsets and scales defined.
name: CALIBRATE

input.name: X
input.description: Input value that will be calibrated.

input.name: CO
input.description: Control signal to adjust the offset.

input.name: CS
input.description: Control signal to adjust the scale.

input.name: Y_Offset
input.description: Constant value for offset adjustment.

input.name: Y_Scale
input.description: Constant value for scale adjustment.

output.name: Y
output.description: Calibrated output value based on the input and calibration parameters.

title: Clock N Function Block
description: This function block generates a clock signal based on a specified period defined by the input parameter N. The output Q provides a boolean representation of the clock state, transitioning based on the specified time interval.
name: CLK_N

input.name: N
input.description: An integer that specifies the number of milliseconds for the clock period.

output.name: Q
output.description: A boolean output that represents the current state of the clock.

title: Manual Control Function Block
description: This function block enables manual control of outputs based on input boolean signals and operational states, including the control of four discrete outputs and a status indicator. The function block transitions between manual and automatic modes, managing state changes on inputs and controlling the output based on the position index.
name: MANUAL_4

input.name: I0
input.description: Input boolean signal 0.

input.name: I1
input.description: Input boolean signal 1.

input.name: I2
input.description: Input boolean signal 2.

input.name: I3
input.description: Input boolean signal 3.

input.name: MAN
input.description: Manual control signal; when true, switches to manual mode.

input.name: STP
input.description: Stop signal; when true, triggers state change.

input.name: M0
input.description: Manual mode output 0.

input.name: M1
input.description: Manual mode output 1.

input.name: M2
input.description: Manual mode output 2.

input.name: M3
input.description: Manual mode output 3.

output.name: Q0
output.description: Output boolean signal 0.

output.name: Q1
output.description: Output boolean signal 1.

output.name: Q2
output.description: Output boolean signal 2.

output.name: Q3
output.description: Output boolean signal 3.

output.name: STATUS
output.description: Status indicator reflecting current operation mode and state.

title: Calculate Argument of Complex Number
description: This function computes the argument (angle) of a complex number represented in polar form using the ATAN2 function, which takes into account the signs of both real and imaginary parts to determine the correct quadrant of the angle.
name: CARG

input.name: X
input.description: A complex number for which the argument needs to be calculated.

return_value.description: The calculated argument (angle in radians) of the complex number X.

title: Calculate Day of Month
description: This function calculates the day of the month based on a given date by determining the day of the year and accounting for leap years. It adjusts the day of the month based on predefined offsets for each month.
name: DAY_OF_MONTH

input.name: IDATE
input.description: The input date for which the day of the month is to be calculated.

return_value.description: The calculated day of the month based on the input date, adjusted for leap years and month offsets.

title: Generator for Ramp Modulated Pulse (RMP)
description: The GEN_RMP function block generates a ramp-modulated pulse output based on specified time and amplitude parameters. It calculates the output in real-time, adjusting the output based on the input settings for pulse time, amplitude, offset, and duty cycle.
name: GEN_RMP

input.name: PT
input.description: Pulse time duration for the generation of the ramp-modulated pulse.

input.name: AM
input.description: Amplitude of the ramp signal.

input.name: OS
input.description: Offset added to the ramp signal.

input.name: DL
input.description: Duty cycle of the pulse signal, represented as a fraction between 0 and 1.

output.name: Q
output.description: Boolean flag indicating if the current output is less than the previous output.

output.name: OUT
output.description: Calculated output value of the ramp signal.

title: Ceil2 Function
description: The Ceil2 function takes a real number as input and computes its ceiling value as an integer. The function converts the real number to an integer and checks if the conversion resulted in a value less than the original input, in which case it increments the resultant integer by one to ensure it correctly represents the ceiling.
name: CEIL2

input.name: X
input.description: The real number input for which the ceiling needs to be computed.

output.name: CEIL2
output.description: The computed ceiling value of the input real number, represented as an integer.

return_value.description: Returns the ceiling of the input real number as an integer.

title: Character Name Generation
description: This function generates a character name string based on the input BYTE value. If the input is not zero, it constructs a search string by converting the BYTE to a string, appending special characters, and searching through predefined character names to retrieve the appropriate name. If the input is zero, the output is an empty string.
name: CHARNAME

input.name: C
input.description: A BYTE value used to determine the character name.

output.name: CHARNAME
output.description: The resulting character name string constructed from the input BYTE.

return_value.description: The character name generated from the BYTE input.

title: CYCLE_4 Function Block
description: This function block implements a cycling state machine that transitions through states based on timer inputs. It utilizes external boolean and integer inputs to control the state changes and the cycling behavior, along with internal variables to manage timing and state transitions.
name: CYCLE_4

input.name: E
input.description: Enable flag that allows the state machine to operate.

input.name: T0
input.description: Duration for waiting in state 0.

input.name: T1
input.description: Duration for waiting in state 1.

input.name: T2
input.description: Duration for waiting in state 2.

input.name: T3
input.description: Duration for waiting in state 3.

input.name: S0
input.description: Control signal to reset the state machine to state 0.

input.name: SX
input.description: Input for directly controlling the state when greater than 0.

input.name: SL
input.description: Status flag to indicate that the state should be forced based on SX.

output.name: STATE
output.description: Current state of the state machine.

title: Calculate Greatest Common Divisor (GCD)
description: This function calculates the greatest common divisor (GCD) of two integers A and B. The function handles cases where either A or B is zero and performs bit manipulation to compute the GCD efficiently.
name: GCD

input.name: A
input.description: The first integer for which the GCD is to be calculated.

input.name: B
input.description: The second integer for which the GCD is to be calculated.

output.name: GCD
output.description: The greatest common divisor of A and B.

return_value.description: The calculated GCD value that is returned by the function.

title: Complex Hyperbolic Cotangent Function
description: This function calculates the complex hyperbolic cotangent of a given complex number. The input is a complex number X, and the output is a complex number representing the result.
name: CTANH

input.name: X
input.description: A complex number for which the hyperbolic cotangent is to be calculated.

output.name: CTANH
output.description: The complex hyperbolic cotangent of the input complex number X.

fields.name: re
fields.description: The real part of the complex hyperbolic cotangent.

fields.name: im
fields.description: The imaginary part of the complex hyperbolic cotangent.

return_value.description: Returns the result of the complex hyperbolic cotangent as a complex number.

fields.name: re
fields.description: The real part of the resulting complex number.

fields.name: im
fields.description: The imaginary part of the resulting complex number.

title: Buffer Clear Function
description: This function clears a specified buffer in memory by setting the bytes to zero. It uses efficient 32-bit accesses to enhance performance. The function takes a pointer to a BYTE and the size of the buffer as inputs.
name: _BUFFER_CLEAR

input.name: PT
input.description: A pointer indicating the start of the buffer to be cleared.

input.name: SIZE
input.description: The size of the buffer in bytes that needs to be cleared.

return_value.description: Returns TRUE if the buffer was successfully cleared.

title: Find Control Character in String
description: This function identifies the position of the first control character (ASCII values less than 32 or equal to 127) in a given string starting from a specified position. If no control character is found, it returns 0.
name: FIND_CTRL

input.name: str
input.description: The string in which to search for control characters.

input.name: pos
input.description: The position in the string from which to start the search.

return_value.description: The position of the first control character found in the string. Returns 0 if no control character is found.

title: Vector Dot Product Calculation
description: This function calculates the dot product of two 3-dimensional vectors, A and B. The result is a scalar value representing the sum of the products of their corresponding components.
name: V3_DPRO

input.name: A
input.description: The first 3-dimensional vector used in the dot product calculation.

input.name: B
input.description: The second 3-dimensional vector used in the dot product calculation.

return_value.description: The resulting dot product of vectors A and B.

title: 4-channel Driver Function Block
description: This function block implements a 4-channel driver that counts the input edges and controls outputs based on the count. It has a reset feature and uses a timeout mechanism to manage output states.
name: DRIVER_4C

input.name: IN
input.description: Input signal indicating a trigger event.

input.name: RST
input.description: Reset signal to reset the counter.

input.name: Timeout
input.description: Timeout duration for automatic reset of the output when active.

input.name: SX
input.description: An array of byte values used to generate output signals, initialized with specific values.

output.name: SN
output.description: Current count of the input edges.

output.name: Q0
output.description: Output signal corresponding to the first channel.

output.name: Q1
output.description: Output signal corresponding to the second channel.

output.name: Q2
output.description: Output signal corresponding to the third channel.

output.name: Q3
output.description: Output signal corresponding to the fourth channel.

title: Sequential Control Block for Multiple Inputs
description: This function block implements a sequential control logic that processes multiple boolean inputs in a specific order with wait and delay times. The block starts the sequence when the 'start' input is activated and can be reset with the 'rst' input. It provides outputs to indicate the status of each step in the sequence as well as overall status information.
name: SEQUENCE_4

input.name: in0
input.description: Boolean input control for step 0.

input.name: in1
input.description: Boolean input control for step 1.

input.name: in2
input.description: Boolean input control for step 2.

input.name: in3
input.description: Boolean input control for step 3.

input.name: start
input.description: Start signal to initiate the sequence.

input.name: rst
input.description: Reset signal to reset the sequence and outputs.

input.name: wait0
input.description: Wait time for step 0.

input.name: delay0
input.description: Delay time after step 0.

input.name: wait1
input.description: Wait time for step 1.

input.name: delay1
input.description: Delay time after step 1.

input.name: wait2
input.description: Wait time for step 2.

input.name: delay2
input.description: Delay time after step 2.

input.name: wait3
input.description: Wait time for step 3.

input.name: delay3
input.description: Delay time after step 3.

input.name: stop_on_error
input.description: Flag to stop the sequence on the first error detected.

output.name: Q0
output.description: Output for step 0.

output.name: Q1
output.description: Output for step 1.

output.name: Q2
output.description: Output for step 2.

output.name: Q3
output.description: Output for step 3.

output.name: QX
output.description: Combined output status indicating active steps.

output.name: run
output.description: Indicates whether the sequence is currently running.

output.name: step
output.description: Current step in the sequence, initialized to -1 indicating no active step.

output.name: status
output.description: Status of the sequence execution.

title: Scale B8 Function
description: This function scales eight BYTE input values using specified minimum and maximum values, a scaling factor K, and an offset O, producing a REAL output value. The function calculates a weighted sum based on the input values and their defined ranges, applies normalization, and then scales and offsets the result.
name: SCALE_B8

input.name: in1
input.description: First input value to be scaled.

input.name: in2
input.description: Second input value to be scaled.

input.name: in3
input.description: Third input value to be scaled.

input.name: in4
input.description: Fourth input value to be scaled.

input.name: in5
input.description: Fifth input value to be scaled.

input.name: in6
input.description: Sixth input value to be scaled.

input.name: in7
input.description: Seventh input value to be scaled.

input.name: in8
input.description: Eighth input value to be scaled.

input.name: K
input.description: Scaling factor applied to the normalized sum.

input.name: O
input.description: Offset added to the scaled result.

input.name: in1_min
input.description: Minimum value for the first input.

input.name: in1_max
input.description: Maximum value for the first input. Defaults to 1000.0.

input.name: in2_min
input.description: Minimum value for the second input.

input.name: in2_max
input.description: Maximum value for the second input. Defaults to 1000.0.

input.name: in3_min
input.description: Minimum value for the third input.

input.name: in3_max
input.description: Maximum value for the third input. Defaults to 1000.0.

input.name: in4_min
input.description: Minimum value for the fourth input.

input.name: in4_max
input.description: Maximum value for the fourth input. Defaults to 1000.0.

input.name: in5_min
input.description: Minimum value for the fifth input.

input.name: in5_max
input.description: Maximum value for the fifth input. Defaults to 1000.0.

input.name: in6_min
input.description: Minimum value for the sixth input.

input.name: in6_max
input.description: Maximum value for the sixth input. Defaults to 1000.0.

input.name: in7_min
input.description: Minimum value for the seventh input.

input.name: in7_max
input.description: Maximum value for the seventh input. Defaults to 1000.0.

input.name: in8_min
input.description: Minimum value for the eighth input.

input.name: in8_max
input.description: Maximum value for the eighth input. Defaults to 1000.0.

output.name: SCALE_B8
output.description: The scaled output value resulting from the scaling operation.

return_value.description: The resulting scaled value after applying the function's calculations.

title: Check if Array is Sorted
description: This function checks whether a given array of REAL numbers is sorted in ascending order. The function takes a pointer to the array and its size as inputs and returns a boolean value indicating whether the array is sorted.
name: IS_SORTED

input.name: pt
input.description: A pointer to an array containing REAL numbers.

input.name: size
input.description: The size of the array, specifying the number of elements in the pointer array.

return_value.description: Returns TRUE if the array is sorted in ascending order, otherwise returns FALSE.

title: Count Set Bits in a DWORD
description: This function takes a DWORD input and counts the number of set bits (1s) in its binary representation. It iteratively checks each bit by using a bitwise shift operation until all bits have been processed.
name: BIT_COUNT

input.name: IN
input.description: A DWORD value for which the set bits are to be counted.

return_value.description: The total count of set bits (1s) in the input DWORD.

title: Byte to Bits Conversion
description: This function block converts a single BYTE input into eight separate BOOL outputs. Each BOOL output represents one bit of the input BYTE.
name: BYTE_TO_BITS

input.name: IN
input.description: A single BYTE input that will be converted to individual bits.

output.name: B0
output.description: Output representing the least significant bit (bit 0) of the input BYTE.

output.name: B1
output.description: Output representing the second least significant bit (bit 1) of the input BYTE.

output.name: B2
output.description: Output representing the third least significant bit (bit 2) of the input BYTE.

output.name: B3
output.description: Output representing the fourth least significant bit (bit 3) of the input BYTE.

output.name: B4
output.description: Output representing the fifth least significant bit (bit 4) of the input BYTE.

output.name: B5
output.description: Output representing the sixth least significant bit (bit 5) of the input BYTE.

output.name: B6
output.description: Output representing the seventh least significant bit (bit 6) of the input BYTE.

output.name: B7
output.description: Output representing the most significant bit (bit 7) of the input BYTE.

title: Error Function Calculation
description: This function computes the error function (ERF) for a given real number input. The implementation includes a mathematical transformation to derive the ERF value using the input variable X.
name: ERF

input.name: X
input.description: A real number input for which the error function is to be calculated.

return_value.description: The calculated value of the error function for the input X.

title: Timer Counting using System Timer
description: This function block retrieves the current system timer value and calculates the elapsed time since the last read. It initializes a timer count (TC) to zero on the first execution and updates it with the difference between the current timer and the last recorded timer value on subsequent executions.
name: TC_US

output.name: TC
output.description: The elapsed time in microseconds since the last update.

title: Offset Calculation Function
description: This function calculates an offset value based on the input parameters. The function will return a value based on an initial input 'X', and will apply additional offsets if the corresponding boolean parameters are true. If the 'D' parameter is true, the function will return a default value instead of the calculated value.
name: OFFSET

input.name: X
input.description: The initial value to which offsets may be applied.

input.name: O1
input.description: A boolean indicating whether to add 'Offset_1' to the result.

input.name: O2
input.description: A boolean indicating whether to add 'Offset_2' to the result.

input.name: O3
input.description: A boolean indicating whether to add 'Offset_3' to the result.

input.name: O4
input.description: A boolean indicating whether to add 'Offset_4' to the result.

input.name: D
input.description: A boolean flag that, if true, will cause the function to return the 'default' value instead of the calculated offset value.

input.name: Offset_1
input.description: The offset value to add if 'O1' is true.

input.name: Offset_2
input.description: The offset value to add if 'O2' is true.

input.name: Offset_3
input.description: The offset value to add if 'O3' is true.

input.name: Offset_4
input.description: The offset value to add if 'O4' is true.

input.name: default
input.description: The default value that will be returned if 'D' is true.

output.name: OFFSET
output.description: The resulting offset value after applying the initial value and any additional offsets, or the default value if 'D' is true.

return_value.description: Returns the final offset value calculated based on the specified conditions.

title: Array Average Calculation
description: This function calculates the average of an array of REAL values, given a pointer to the array and its size. The average is computed by iterating through the provided array elements up to a certain point and dividing the total sum by the count of elements.
name: ARRAY_AVG

input.name: pt
input.description: A pointer to the array of REAL numbers for which the average is to be calculated.

input.name: size
input.description: The number of elements in the array indicated by the pointer.

output.name: ARRAY_AVG
output.description: The computed average of the REAL numbers in the array.

return_value.description: The average value of the elements in the array.

title: PID Controller with Derivative Action
description: This FUNCTION_BLOCK implements a PID (Proportional-Integral-Derivative) controller with an additional derivative action. The block calculates the controller output based on input parameters and applies limits to ensure output stays within specified bounds. The reset functionality allows for reinitialization of the controller state.
name: FT_PIDWL

input.name: IN
input.description: The input value to the PID controller.

input.name: KP
input.description: The proportional gain, default value is 1.0.

input.name: TN
input.description: The time constant for the integral term, default value is 1.0.

input.name: TV
input.description: The time constant for the derivative term, default value is 1.0.

input.name: LIM_L
input.description: Lower limit for the output, default value is -1E+38.

input.name: LIM_H
input.description: Upper limit for the output, default value is 1E+38.

input.name: RST
input.description: Boolean flag to reset the controller state.

output.name: Y
output.description: The output value of the PID controller after processing.

output.name: LIM
output.description: Indicates whether the output has been limited.

title: Moving Average Filter
description: This function block implements a moving average filter that computes the average of the last N values. It initializes a buffer to store these values and updates the average based on the incoming data X. The output Y represents the current value of the moving average.
name: FILTER_MAV_DW

input.name: X
input.description: The input data value to be filtered.

input.name: N
input.description: The number of samples to consider for the moving average. It is limited to a maximum of 32.

input.name: RST
input.description: A reset signal that, when TRUE, reinitializes the buffer and the output.

output.name: Y
output.description: The output value representing the current moving average.

title: Calculate RES_NI for temperature and resistance
description: This function calculates the resistance (RES_NI) based on the input temperature (T) and reference resistance (R0) using a polynomial function. The coefficients A, B, and C are predefined constants that are used in the calculation.
name: RES_NI

input.name: T
input.description: The input temperature in degrees Celsius at which the resistance is calculated.

input.name: R0
input.description: The reference resistance at 0C.

output.name: RES_NI
output.description: The calculated resistance value based on the input temperature and reference resistance.

return_value.description: The calculated resistance value (RES_NI) returned from the function.

title: Control Set Parameters for PID and PI Controllers

description: This function calculates the harmonic average of a given array of real numbers. It takes as input a pointer to the array and its size.
