description: This function takes eight individual boolean inputs (B0 to B7) and converts them into a single byte value. The boolean inputs represent bits in the byte, with B0 being the least significant bit (LSB) and B7 being the most significant bit (MSB). The function combines these boolean values into a byte by shifting and logical OR operations.
name: BYTE_OF_BIT

input.name: B0
input.description: The least significant bit of the byte.

input.name: B1
input.description: The second least significant bit of the byte.

input.name: B2
input.description: The third least significant bit of the byte.

input.name: B3
input.description: The fourth bit of the byte.

input.name: B4
input.description: The fifth bit of the byte.

input.name: B5
input.description: The sixth bit of the byte.

input.name: B6
input.description: The seventh bit of the byte.

input.name: B7
input.description: The most significant bit of the byte.

output.name: Byte_of_bit
output.description: The resulting byte composed of the input boolean values.

return_value.description: The final byte representation of the boolean inputs.

title: Control Set 1 Configuration
description: This FUNCTION_BLOCK is designed to configure control parameters for PI and PID controllers based on the given gains and time constants. It calculates proportional, integral, and derivative gains based on the user-defined input parameters and the selected control mode.
name: CONTROL_SET1

input.name: Kt
input.description: The gain factor that affects the control outputs.

input.name: Tt
input.description: The time constant used for calculating integral and derivative parameters.

input.name: PI
input.description: Boolean flag to indicate if a PI controller is used.

input.name: PID
input.description: Boolean flag to indicate if a PID controller is used.

input.name: P_K
input.description: Proportional gain for the basic control (default = 0.5).

input.name: PI_K
input.description: Proportional gain for the PI controller (default = 0.45).

input.name: PI_TN
input.description: Time constant for the integral part of the PI controller (default = 0.83).

input.name: PID_K
input.description: Proportional gain for the PID controller (default = 0.6).

input.name: PID_TN
input.description: Time constant for the integral part of the PID controller (default = 0.5).

input.name: PID_TV
input.description: Time constant for the derivative part of the PID controller (default = 0.125).

output.name: KP
output.description: Calculated proportional gain based on the selected controller.

output.name: TN
output.description: Calculated time constant for the integral component.

output.name: TV
output.description: Calculated time constant for the derivative component.

output.name: KI
output.description: Calculated integral gain based on KP and TN.

output.name: KD
output.description: Calculated derivative gain based on KP and TV.

title: FILL Function
description: This function generates a string based on a given byte value and an integer limit. It converts the byte into a string representation and appends it to the output string repeatedly based on the provided limit.
name: FILL

input.name: C
input.description: A byte value to be converted to a string.

input.name: L
input.description: An integer specifying how many times the character should be appended, limited to a maximum of 80 characters.

return_value.description: The resulting concatenated string after processing the input byte and limit.

title: Calculate Array Trend
description: This function computes the trend of a given array of real numbers by evaluating the sum of its elements based on the specified size. It calculates the sum of the first half of the array and conditionally adjusts the sum based on whether the size is even or odd before returning the average trend value.
name: ARRAY_TREND

input.name: pt
input.description: Pointer to the array of real numbers whose trend needs to be calculated.

input.name: size
input.description: The total number of elements in the array.

output.name: ARRAY_TREND
output.description: The calculated trend value of the array, which is the average based on the input size.

return_value.description: Average trend of the array values.

title: Cauchy Function Calculation
description: This function computes the value of the Cauchy distribution for given parameters. It takes in three real numbers: X, T, and U, and returns the computed Cauchy value as a real number.
name: CAUCHY

input.name: X
input.description: The first parameter of the Cauchy function.

input.name: T
input.description: The second parameter, which alters the position of the distribution.

input.name: U
input.description: The scale parameter for the Cauchy distribution.

return_value.description: The computed value of the Cauchy function based on the provided input parameters.

title: Add Item to List
description: This function adds an item to a list by first converting a separation character to a string and then concatenating it with the input string. The function checks if adding the new string will exceed the defined maximum length of the list. If it does, it returns false; otherwise, it appends the item to the list and returns true.
name: LIST_ADD

input.name: SEP
input.description: The separation character that will be converted to a string and prefixed to the input string.

input.name: INS
input.description: The input string that is to be added to the list.

in/out.name: LIST
in/out.description: The list to which the input string will be added. It is modified in place.

return_value.description: A boolean value indicating the success of the addition operation to the list.

title: Check Uppercase Character
description: This function checks whether the provided byte value corresponds to an uppercase ASCII character. If the system is configured to recognize extended ASCII characters, it also allows for certain values that fall outside the standard ASCII range.
name: ISC_UPPER

input.name: IN
input.description: The byte value to be checked for uppercase character status.

output.name: ISC_UPPER
output.description: Returns TRUE if the input byte corresponds to an uppercase ASCII character; otherwise, FALSE.

return_value.description: The result indicating whether the input byte is an uppercase letter, based on ASCII definitions.

title: TP_1 Timer Function Block
description: This function block implements a timer circuit. It triggers an output Q to TRUE for a specified duration (PT) when the input IN is TRUE, and it resets Q to FALSE when RST is activated or the duration has elapsed. The state of the input IN is also stored to prevent retriggering during the timing period.
name: TP_1

input.name: IN
input.description: Boolean input that starts the timing operation when set to TRUE.

input.name: PT
input.description: Duration for which the output Q remains TRUE after IN is activated.

input.name: RST
input.description: Boolean input that resets the output Q to FALSE when set to TRUE.

output.name: Q
output.description: Boolean output that indicates the status of the timer; TRUE when timing is active, otherwise FALSE.

title: Vector 3 Reversal Function
description: This function takes a 3D vector as input and returns a new vector that is the negation of the input vector. Each component of the vector is changed to its opposite sign.
name: V3_REV

input.name: A
input.description: The input vector whose components are to be reversed.

return_value.description: The output vector which is the negation of the input vector A.

fields.name: X
fields.description: The X component of the output vector, which is the negative of the X component of input vector A.

fields.name: Y
fields.description: The Y component of the output vector, which is the negative of the Y component of input vector A.

fields.name: Z
fields.description: The Z component of the output vector, which is the negative of the Z component of input vector A.

title: Calculate Area of Triangle
description: This function calculates the area of a triangle based on two methods: either using the lengths of all three sides or using one side and the included angle. If the angle A is 0, the area is calculated using Heron's formula. Otherwise, it uses the formula with side lengths S1 and S2 and the included angle A.
name: TRIANGLE_A

input.name: S1
input.description: Length of the first side of the triangle.

input.name: A
input.description: Included angle in degrees. If A is 0, Heron's formula is used.

input.name: S2
input.description: Length of the second side of the triangle.

input.name: S3
input.description: Length of the third side of the triangle.

return_value.description: The calculated area of the triangle.

title: Boolean Logic Function Block
description: This function block takes two boolean inputs, D and A, and produces two boolean outputs, Q0 and Q1. The output Q0 is the result of a logical AND operation between input D and the negation of input A, while Q1 is the result of a logical AND operation between input D and input A.
name: DEC_2

input.name: D
input.description: Boolean input that influences both outputs.

input.name: A
input.description: Boolean input that determines the value of Q1 along with D.

output.name: Q0
output.description: Boolean output representing the result of D AND NOT A.

output.name: Q1
output.description: Boolean output representing the result of D AND A.

title: Buffer Uppercase Conversion
description: This function takes a pointer to an array of bytes and converts each byte to its uppercase equivalent. It iterates through the array up to a specified size and modifies the elements in place.
name: _BUFFER_UPPERCASE

input.name: PT
input.description: A pointer to an array of bytes that will be converted to uppercase.

input.name: SIZE
input.description: The number of bytes in the array to be converted.

return_value.description: Indicates whether the uppercase conversion was successful.

title: Complex Logarithm Calculation
description: This function computes the complex logarithm of a given complex number. It takes a complex number as input and returns its logarithmic representation in terms of its real and imaginary parts.
name: CLOG

input.name: X
input.description: A complex number represented by its real and imaginary parts.

return_value.description: The complex logarithm of the input number, represented in its real and imaginary parts.

fields.name: re
fields.description: The real part of the complex logarithm.

fields.name: im
fields.description: The imaginary part of the complex logarithm.

title: Gaussian Function
description: This function calculates the value of the Gaussian (normal distribution) function based on the input parameters X, U, and SI. It computes the exponential component and normalizes it using the standard deviation.
name: GAUSS

input.name: X
input.description: The value at which to evaluate the Gaussian function.

input.name: U
input.description: The mean (average) of the distribution.

input.name: SI
input.description: The standard deviation of the distribution.

return_value.description: The computed value of the Gaussian function at the specified point X.

title: Scale a Value
description: This function scales a given value X from an input range defined by I_LO and I_HI to an output range defined by O_LO and O_HI. The function accounts for cases where the input range is zero (I_LO = I_HI) by returning O_LO. If the input value X is outside the defined input range, it is limited to the nearest boundary using the LIMIT function.
name: SCALE_R

input.name: X
input.description: The value to be scaled.

input.name: I_LO
input.description: The lower bound of the input range.

input.name: I_HI
input.description: The upper bound of the input range.

input.name: O_LO
input.description: The lower bound of the output range.

input.name: O_HI
input.description: The upper bound of the output range.

output.name: SCALE_R
output.description: The scaled output value corresponding to the input value X.

return_value.description: The final scaled value based on the input parameters.

title: Difference Check Function
description: This function checks if the absolute difference between two real number inputs exceeds a specified threshold. It returns a boolean value indicating the result of the comparison.
name: DIFFER

input.name: in1
input.description: The first real number input for the difference calculation.

input.name: in2
input.description: The second real number input for the difference calculation.

input.name: X
input.description: The threshold value. The function checks if the absolute difference exceeds this value.

return_value.description: Returns TRUE if the absolute difference between in1 and in2 is greater than X; otherwise, returns FALSE.

title: 2-to-1 Multiplexer Function
description: This function implements a 2-to-1 multiplexer. It takes two data inputs and a single selection input to output one of the two data inputs based on the selection input's value.
name: MUX_2

input.name: D0
input.description: The first data input to the multiplexer.

input.name: D1
input.description: The second data input to the multiplexer.

input.name: A0
input.description: The selection input that determines which data input to output.

return_value.description: The output of the multiplexer, which is either D0 or D1 based on the value of A0.

title: Linear Function Calculation
description: This function calculates the linear equation value based on the input parameters, representing a mathematical function of the form y = Ax + B.
name: F_LIN

input.name: X
input.description: The independent variable for the linear equation.

input.name: A
input.description: The coefficient representing the slope of the linear function.

input.name: B
input.description: The constant term that represents the y-intercept of the linear function.

return_value.description: The result of the linear function calculation, which is the value of A * X + B.

title: Square Wave Generator
description: This function block generates a square wave signal based on the specified input time period. The output toggles between TRUE and FALSE based on the elapsed time, producing a square wave signal at half the frequency determined by the input time.
name: GEN_SQ

input.name: PT
input.description: The period of the square wave signal, defining the time interval for toggling the output.

output.name: Q
output.description: Output signal that represents the state of the square wave, toggling between TRUE and FALSE.

title: Override Calculation Function
description: This function calculates an override value based on the input parameters. The override value is determined by comparing three input values and their corresponding enable flags. If a flag is enabled, the associated value is considered for the override. The function returns the highest absolute value among the inputs that have their enable flags set to true.
name: OVERRIDE

input.name: X1
input.description: The first input value used in the override calculation.

input.name: X2
input.description: The second input value used in the override calculation.

input.name: X3
input.description: The third input value used in the override calculation.

input.name: E1
input.description: Enable flag for the first input value.

input.name: E2
input.description: Enable flag for the second input value.

input.name: E3
input.description: Enable flag for the third input value.

return_value.description: The calculated override value based on the input parameters.

title: PIN Code Verification
description: This function block verifies a PIN code entered by the user. It checks the entered byte against the expected PIN stored as a string and confirms if the correct sequence is entered, outputting a boolean result indicating success.
name: PIN_CODE

input.name: CB
input.description: The byte value representing the current code input by the user.

input.name: E
input.description: A boolean flag indicating whether the input verification should be processed.

input.name: PIN
input.description: The PIN code string that the user needs to match, up to 8 characters long.

output.name: TP
output.description: A boolean output indicating whether the proper PIN code has been detected (TRUE) or not (FALSE).

title: Check Date Period
description: This function determines whether a specified date (dx) falls within a given period defined by two other dates (d1 and d2). It takes into consideration the nuances of leap years and the transition across a new year.
name: PERIOD

input.name: d1
input.description: The start date of the period.

input.name: dx
input.description: The date to check if it falls within the period.

input.name: d2
input.description: The end date of the period.

output.name: PERIOD
output.description: A boolean value indicating if the date dx is within the period defined by d1 and d2.

return_value.description: The result of whether dx is within the period between d1 and d2.

title: Parsing Input Data and Generating Output Parameters
description: This FUNCTION_BLOCK named 'PARSET2' processes various input parameters related to a set of real numbers and time. It initializes a parameter set and adjusts its internal state based on the input conditions defined by thresholds (L1, L2, L3) to produce multiple output parameters (P1, P2, P3, P4). The goal is to correctly calculate and assign values to the output parameters based on these conditions.
name: PARSET2

input.name: X
input.description: Input variable representing a real number.

input.name: X01
input.description: Input variable representing a real number for the parameter set.

input.name: X02
input.description: Input variable representing a real number for the parameter set.

input.name: X03
input.description: Input variable representing a real number for the parameter set.

input.name: X04
input.description: Input variable representing a real number for the parameter set.

input.name: X11
input.description: Input variable representing a real number for the parameter set.

input.name: X12
input.description: Input variable representing a real number for the parameter set.

input.name: X13
input.description: Input variable representing a real number for the parameter set.

input.name: X14
input.description: Input variable representing a real number for the parameter set.

input.name: X21
input.description: Input variable representing a real number for the parameter set.

input.name: X22
input.description: Input variable representing a real number for the parameter set.

input.name: X23
input.description: Input variable representing a real number for the parameter set.

input.name: X24
input.description: Input variable representing a real number for the parameter set.

input.name: X31
input.description: Input variable representing a real number for the parameter set.

input.name: X32
input.description: Input variable representing a real number for the parameter set.

input.name: X33
input.description: Input variable representing a real number for the parameter set.

input.name: X34
input.description: Input variable representing a real number for the parameter set.

input.name: L1
input.description: Threshold value for condition checking.

input.name: L2
input.description: Threshold value for condition checking.

input.name: L3
input.description: Threshold value for condition checking.

input.name: TC
input.description: Time parameter used for initialization of parameter set.

output.name: P1
output.description: Output variable representing the first calculated parameter.

output.name: P2
output.description: Output variable representing the second calculated parameter.

output.name: P3
output.description: Output variable representing the third calculated parameter.

output.name: P4
output.description: Output variable representing the fourth calculated parameter.

title: Pulse Generator Function Block
description: This function block generates a pulse signal based on time parameters and an enable input. When enabled, it alternates the output based on the specified pulse time (PTL) and hold time (PTH). The function block should reset the output to false when the enable input (ENQ) is not true.
name: GEN_PULSE

input.name: ENQ
input.description: Enable input for the pulse generator, should be set to TRUE to generate pulses.

input.name: PTH
input.description: Time duration for which the output should be held in the 'high' state.

input.name: PTL
input.description: Time duration for which the output should be in the 'low' state before switching back to 'high'.

output.name: Q
output.description: Output pulse signal, toggles between TRUE and FALSE based on the elapsed time.

title: Celsius to Kelvin Conversion
description: This function converts a temperature value from Celsius to Kelvin. The input is the temperature in Celsius, and the function subtracts the physical temperature constant T0 to compute the result in Kelvin.
name: C_TO_K

input.name: Celsius
input.description: The temperature in degrees Celsius that needs to be converted to Kelvin.

return_value.description: The converted temperature value in Kelvin, calculated by adjusting the Celsius input.

title: Calculate Array Variance
description: This function calculates the variance of a given array of real numbers. It first computes the arithmetic average of the array elements and then uses that average to compute the variance.
name: ARRAY_VAR

input.name: pt
input.description: Pointer to an array of real numbers whose variance will be calculated.

input.name: size
input.description: The size of the array, indicating the number of elements present within the array.

output.name: ARRAY_VAR
output.description: The calculated variance of the real numbers in the array.

return_value.description: Returns the computed variance of the array of real numbers.

title: Pulse Width Modulation Generator
description: This function block generates a pulse width modulation (PWM) signal based on specified high and low timing values. It allows for selection between two sets of timing values and provides outputs for the status of the PWM and the elapsed timing for high and low states.
name: GEN_PW2

input.name: ENQ
input.description: Enable signal to start the timing operation.

input.name: TH1
input.description: Time duration for the high state in the first timing configuration.

input.name: TL1
input.description: Time duration for the low state in the first timing configuration.

input.name: TH2
input.description: Time duration for the high state in the second timing configuration.

input.name: TL2
input.description: Time duration for the low state in the second timing configuration.

input.name: TS
input.description: Selects between the first or second timing configuration.

output.name: Q
output.description: Output signal indicating the state of the PWM (TRUE for high, FALSE for low).

output.name: TH
output.description: Elapsed time in the high state since the last transition.

output.name: TL
output.description: Elapsed time in the low state since the last transition.

title: Hysteresis Function Block
description: This function block implements a hysteresis control mechanism with two output boolean states (Q1 and Q2) based on input values and defined thresholds. The block performs checks against two threshold values, val1 and val2, adjusted by a hysteresis margin to determine and set the states of the outputs.
name: HYST_3

input.name: in
input.description: The input value which is compared against the threshold values.

input.name: hyst
input.description: The hysteresis value that defines the margin for threshold comparison.

input.name: val1
input.description: The first threshold value used in determining the output Q1.

input.name: val2
input.description: The second threshold value used in determining the output Q2.

output.name: Q1
output.description: Output boolean value indicating the state of the first control based on comparisons with val1.

output.name: Q2
output.description: Output boolean value indicating the state of the second control based on comparisons with val2.

title: Calculate Parity
description: This function calculates the parity of a given DWORD input. It determines whether the number of set bits (1s) in the binary representation of the input is even or odd, returning TRUE for odd parity and FALSE for even parity.
name: PARITY

input.name: in
input.description: The DWORD input value for which the parity is to be calculated.

output.name: PARITY
output.description: The result indicating the parity of the input value, TRUE if the number of set bits is odd, otherwise FALSE.

return_value.description: Returns the parity result of the input value.

title: Time Conversion and Correction Function
description: This function calculates the time in a DWORD format while accommodating a time range of -24 days to +24 days. It ensures that the timer wraps around correctly and does not reset to 0 during overflow. A debug mode is included to modify the timer's value based on specific conditions.
name: T_PLC_MS

input.name: debug
input.description: Flag to enable debug mode for detailed processing.

input.name: N
input.description: Shift value used for adjusting the timer.

input.name: offset
input.description: Additive offset to adjust the timer value.

output.name: T_PLC_MS
output.description: Resulting timer value in DWORD format after conversion and correction.

return_value.description: Final timer value in DWORD format.

title: Convert Process Time to Frequency
description: This function converts a given process time in TIME format to a frequency in REAL format by calculating the reciprocal multiplier of the time value.
name: PT_TO_F

input.name: PT
input.description: The input process time that needs to be converted to frequency.

return_value.description: The frequency value calculated from the process time.

title: Matrix Function Block
description: This function block processes boolean input signals to generate a corresponding code based on the changes detected in input lines. It manages the state of the outputs based on the comparison of current input states and previous states, handling a release condition to reset the code when necessary.
name: MATRIX

input.name: x1
input.description: First input boolean signal.

input.name: x2
input.description: Second input boolean signal.

input.name: x3
input.description: Third input boolean signal.

input.name: x4
input.description: Fourth input boolean signal.

input.name: x5
input.description: Fifth input boolean signal.

input.name: Release
input.description: A constant input signal indicating whether to release the generated code.

output.name: code
output.description: The generated code based on the input changes.

output.name: TP
output.description: A flag indicating whether a change has been detected.

output.name: y1
output.description: Output signal derived from the processed code (default TRUE).

output.name: y2
output.description: Second output signal derived from the processed code.

output.name: y3
output.description: Third output signal derived from the processed code.

output.name: y4
output.description: Fourth output signal derived from the processed code.

title: Array Spread Calculation
description: This function calculates the spread of values in an array of REAL numbers by determining the difference between the maximum and minimum values. The input to the function includes a pointer to the array and the size of the array, and the function returns the spread as a REAL number.
name: ARRAY_SPR

input.name: pt
input.description: Pointer to the array of REAL numbers.

input.name: size
input.description: The number of elements in the array.

return_value.description: The difference between the maximum and minimum values in the array.

title: First-Order Transfer Function Implementation
description: This function block implements a first-order transfer function characterized by time constant T and scaling factor K. It processes an input signal and outputs a signal that is the result of applying the transfer function to the input.
name: FT_IMP

input.name: in
input.description: The input signal to the transfer function.

input.name: T
input.description: The time constant of the transfer function.

input.name: K
input.description: The scaling factor applied to the output, default is 1.0.

output.name: out
output.description: The output signal after applying the transfer function.

title: Character Code Retrieval
description: This function retrieves the character code of a given string input. If the input string has a length of one, it returns the code directly. For longer strings, it constructs a search string to find the corresponding character code from a predefined character names set.
name: CHARCODE

input.name: STR
input.description: A string input with a maximum length of 10 characters whose character code needs to be retrieved.

output.name: CHARCODE
output.description: The character code of the input string returned as a byte.

return_value.description: Returns the character code of the input string as a byte.

title: Range Checking Function
description: This function checks if a given input value falls within a specified range defined by low and high bounds. It returns a boolean value indicating whether the input is within the range or not.
name: WINDOW2

input.name: LOW
input.description: The lower bound of the range.

input.name: IN
input.description: The input value to be checked against the range.

input.name: HIGH
input.description: The upper bound of the range.

return_value.description: Returns TRUE if the input value is within the specified range (inclusive), otherwise returns FALSE.

title: Check if String is Numeric
description: This function checks whether the input string consists solely of numeric characters. It iterates through each character of the input string and verifies if it is a number. If any character is found to be non-numeric, the function returns false. If all characters are numeric and the string length is greater than zero, it returns true.
name: IS_NUM

input.name: str
input.description: Input variable of type STRING with specified length which needs to be checked for numeric characters.

return_value.description: Returns true if the input string consists only of numeric characters and has a length greater than zero; otherwise, returns false.

title: Calculate Work Week from Date
description: This function calculates the work week number corresponding to the given input date. It takes into consideration the ISO8601 standard for week numbering, accounting for leap years and the first weekday of the year.
name: WORK_WEEK

input.name: idate
input.description: The input date from which the work week number is to be calculated.

return_value.description: The work week number for the given date according to ISO8601 standards.

title: 8-Stage Shift Register with Control Inputs
description: This function block implements an 8-stage shift register operation with the capability to set/reset its states based on control inputs. It supports data input from two different sources, allowing the user to either shift data through the register or load new values upon a rising edge of the clock signal.
name: SHR_8UDE

input.name: SET
input.description: Input to set the state of the shift register.

input.name: D0
input.description: Input data for the first stage of the shift register.

input.name: D7
input.description: Input data for the last stage of the shift register.

input.name: CLK
input.description: Clock input signal that triggers the shifting of the register.

input.name: DN
input.description: Control input to determine the direction of data shifting.

input.name: RST
input.description: Input to reset all registers to a known state.

output.name: Q0
output.description: Current output state of the first stage of the shift register.

output.name: Q1
output.description: Current output state of the second stage of the shift register.

output.name: Q2
output.description: Current output state of the third stage of the shift register.

output.name: Q3
output.description: Current output state of the fourth stage of the shift register.

output.name: Q4
output.description: Current output state of the fifth stage of the shift register.

output.name: Q5
output.description: Current output state of the sixth stage of the shift register.

output.name: Q6
output.description: Current output state of the seventh stage of the shift register.

output.name: Q7
output.description: Current output state of the eighth stage of the shift register.

title: Check If Byte Is Numeric
description: This function checks if the input byte is a numeric character by verifying if it falls within the ASCII range for numeric characters (48 to 57). The function returns true if the input is a numeric character and false otherwise.
name: ISC_NUM

input.name: IN
input.description: The input byte to be checked.

return_value.description: Returns true if the input byte is within the ASCII range for numeric characters, otherwise returns false.

title: Convert DWORD to String with Length Limitation
description: This function takes a DWORD input and converts it to a string, ensuring that the output string does not exceed a specified maximum length (N). It restricts the output to a maximum of 20 characters.
name: DWORD_TO_STRF

input.name: IN
input.description: The DWORD value to be converted to a string.

input.name: N
input.description: The maximum length of the resulting string, which should be limited to a maximum of 20.

return_value.description: The resulting string representation of the DWORD input, limited to the specified length N.

title: Date Addition Function
description: This function adds a specified number of days, weeks, months, and years to a given date and returns the resulting date. It correctly handles month and year transitions.
name: DATE_ADD

input.name: IDATE
input.description: The initial date to which the adjustments will be made.

input.name: D
input.description: The number of days to add to the initial date.

input.name: W
input.description: The number of weeks to add to the initial date.

input.name: M
input.description: The number of months to add to the initial date.

input.name: Y
input.description: The number of years to add to the initial date.

return_value.description: The resulting date after the specified additions.

title: Check if Input is Alphabetic
description: This function checks if the provided input byte represents an alphabet character. It considers both standard ASCII and extended ASCII characters depending on the setup configuration. Based on the provided byte, it determines if it falls within the ranges for uppercase and lowercase alphabetic characters.
name: ISC_ALPHA

input.name: IN
input.description: The input byte to be checked to see if it represents an alphabet character.

output.name: ISC_ALPHA
output.description: Returns true if the input byte is an alphabet character, otherwise returns false.

return_value.description: The boolean result indicating if the input is an alphabetic character.

title: PWM Control Function Block
description: This function block, CTRL_PWM, is designed to control Pulse Width Modulation (PWM) signals based on the provided inputs. It calculates the PWM duty cycle using either a control input or a manual input depending on the manual override status.
name: CTRL_PWM

input.name: CI
input.description: The control input value used for PWM calculation.

input.name: MAN_IN
input.description: The manual input value that can override the control input when MANUAL is true.

input.name: MANUAL
input.description: A boolean flag indicating whether to use MAN_IN (true) or CI (false) for the PWM calculation.

input.name: F
input.description: The frequency used for PWM signal generation.

output.name: Q
output.description: The output status indicating whether the PWM signal is active.

title: List Cleaning Function
description: This function cleans a provided list by removing consecutive separators and ensuring that the list is properly terminated. The cleaning ensures that there are no empty elements at the end of the list and handles the removal of redundant separator characters.
name: LIST_CLEAN

input.name: SEP
input.description: The separator character used to determine element boundaries in the list.

in/out.name: LIST
in/out.description: The list of strings that will be cleaned. The function modifies this list in-place.

return_value.description: Indicates the success of the cleaning operation. The function returns TRUE upon successful completion.

title: Ticker Function Block
description: The TICKER function block generates a ticker display from a given text at specified time intervals. It takes in a character count and a time delay and outputs a portion of text based on these inputs, updating incrementally as time progresses.
name: TICKER

input.name: N
input.description: The starting index of the ticker text to display.

input.name: PT
input.description: The time period for which the delay is set before the next ticker update.

output.name: Display
output.description: The portion of text to be displayed in the ticker.

in/out.name: Text
in/out.description: The full text that is processed to create the ticker display.

title: Array Addition Function
description: This function adds a specified value to each element of a given array. The function takes a pointer to an array of real numbers, the size of the array, and the value to be added. It updates the array in place and returns a boolean value indicating successful execution.
name: _ARRAY_ADD

input.name: pt
input.description: A pointer to the array of real numbers that will be modified.

input.name: size
input.description: The size of the array to determine how many elements will be processed.

input.name: X
input.description: The real number value to be added to each element of the array.

return_value.description: A boolean value indicating the success of the operation.

title: Control Input Function
description: This function calculates the process error by determining the difference between the set point and actual value while accounting for noise through a dead zone mechanism.
name: CTRL_IN

input.name: SET_POINT
input.description: The desired target value that the system aims to achieve.

input.name: ACTUAL
input.description: The current value of the system that is being evaluated.

input.name: NOISE
input.description: The acceptable range of fluctuation around the set point which will be considered as 'noise'.

return_value.description: The calculated process error after applying the dead zone function.

title: Parameter Set Function Block
description: This function block is designed to facilitate the initialization and management of a set of parameters based on input signals. It selects a set of parameters to be ramped up to their target values over a specified timeframe, allowing smooth transitions between different configurations.
name: PARSET

input.name: A0
input.description: Boolean input to select the first set of parameters.

input.name: A1
input.description: Boolean input to select the second set of parameters.

input.name: X01
input.description: The first parameter of set 0.

input.name: X02
input.description: The second parameter of set 0.

input.name: X03
input.description: The third parameter of set 0.

input.name: X04
input.description: The fourth parameter of set 0.

input.name: X11
input.description: The first parameter of set 1.

input.name: X12
input.description: The second parameter of set 1.

input.name: X13
input.description: The third parameter of set 1.

input.name: X14
input.description: The fourth parameter of set 1.

input.name: X21
input.description: The first parameter of set 2.

input.name: X22
input.description: The second parameter of set 2.

input.name: X23
input.description: The third parameter of set 2.

input.name: X24
input.description: The fourth parameter of set 2.

input.name: X31
input.description: The first parameter of set 3.

input.name: X32
input.description: The second parameter of set 3.

input.name: X33
input.description: The third parameter of set 3.

input.name: X34
input.description: The fourth parameter of set 3.

input.name: TC
input.description: Time duration for the ramping process.

output.name: P1
output.description: Output parameter corresponding to the first selected set value.

output.name: P2
output.description: Output parameter corresponding to the second selected set value.

output.name: P3
output.description: Output parameter corresponding to the third selected set value.

output.name: P4
output.description: Output parameter corresponding to the fourth selected set value.

title: Comparison Function
description: This function, CMP, compares two real numbers X and Y with a precision determined by an integer N. It calculates the absolute difference between X and Y and checks if it is less than a computed threshold. The threshold is based on the logarithmic value of the absolute value of X adjusted by the integer N.
name: CMP

input.name: X
input.description: The first real number to be compared.

input.name: Y
input.description: The second real number to be compared.

input.name: N
input.description: An integer that determines the precision for the comparison.

output.name: CMP
output.description: The result of the comparison; TRUE if the absolute difference between X and Y is less than the computed threshold, FALSE otherwise.

return_value.description: The Boolean result indicating if X and Y are considered equal within the defined precision.

title: Calculate Temperature Adjustment
description: This function computes a temperature adjustment based on input resistance and temperature values. The function uses a mathematical formula to derive the adjusted temperature. It has been enhanced over multiple revisions to accommodate varying target temperatures (TS) and to ensure stability against errors from square root calculations involving negative results.
name: TEMP_SI

input.name: Res
input.description: The resistance value input for the temperature calculation.

input.name: RS
input.description: The reference resistance used in the formula.

input.name: TS
input.description: The target temperature that influences the adjustment calculation.

return_value.description: The computed adjusted temperature based on the inputs provided.

title: Timing Measurement Function Block (M_TX)
description: This function block measures timing intervals based on input signals and produces various timing outputs. It takes an input signal that can change state and computes the time between rising and falling edges, as well as provides information about duty cycle and frequency. The function block can be reset with an external reset signal and limits the maximum timing duration.
name: M_TX

input.name: in
input.description: The input signal to be monitored for edges (rising and falling).

input.name: tmax
input.description: The maximum allowed timing duration; after this duration, the block will reset the measurements.

input.name: rst
input.description: Reset signal to initialize the measurement outputs.

output.name: TH
output.description: The duration of the high state (rising edge) in time.

output.name: TL
output.description: The duration of the low state (falling edge) in time.

output.name: DC
output.description: The duty cycle computed as the ratio of the high time to the total period.

output.name: F
output.description: The frequency calculated based on the high and low durations.

output.name: ET
output.description: Elapsed time since the last rising edge.

title: Convert Octal String to DWORD
description: This function converts an octal string representation into a DWORD (double word) integer value. The input is a string of octal digits, and the output is the corresponding DWORD value.
name: OCT_TO_DWORD

input.name: OCT
input.description: A string of octal digits that needs to be converted to a DWORD.

return_value.description: The converted DWORD value representing the octal input string.

title: Time-based Value Storage and Retrieval
description: This FUNCTION_BLOCK implements a time-based mechanism for storing and retrieving real input values over a specified period. It accepts a real input value and a time duration, stores a maximum of 64 values, and provides the most recent stored value based on the elapsed time.
name: FT_TN64

input.name: in
input.description: The real input value to be stored.

input.name: T
input.description: The duration that determines how frequently the input values are stored.

output.name: out
output.description: The most recent stored input value.

output.name: trig
output.description: Boolean trigger indicating that a new value has been stored.

title: Count Character in String
description: This function counts the occurrences of a specified character within a string of a defined length. It takes a string input and a character, then iterates through the string to tally how many times the character appears.
name: COUNT_CHAR

input.name: str
input.description: Input variable of type STRING with the specified length.

input.name: chr
input.description: Input variable of type BYTE representing the character to count.

return_value.description: Returns the count of occurrences of the specified character in the string.

title: Complex Arc Cosine Function
description: This function computes the complex arc cosine of a given complex number and returns the result as a complex number. The output complex number consists of its real and imaginary parts, calculated based on the input complex number.
name: CACOS

input.name: X
input.description: The input complex number for which the arc cosine is to be calculated.

output.name: CACOS
output.description: The arc cosine of the input complex number, represented as a complex number.

return_value.description: The computed arc cosine value of the input complex number as a complex number.

fields.name: re
fields.description: The real part of the calculated arc cosine.

fields.name: im
fields.description: The imaginary part of the calculated arc cosine.

title: Calculate Resistance at Non-Temperature Coefficient (NTC)
description: This function calculates the resistance based on the temperature (T), a reference resistance (RN), and a constant (B) for the NTC thermistor. The calculation is performed using the exponential function to account for the temperature dependence of the resistance.
name: RES_NTC

input.name: T
input.description: The temperature in degrees Celsius.

input.name: RN
input.description: The reference resistance at a specified temperature.

input.name: B
input.description: The material characteristic constant for the NTC thermistor.

return_value.description: The calculated resistance value based on the provided inputs.

title: Decimal to Byte Conversion
description: This function converts a decimal number given as a string to its corresponding byte value. The input string can be up to 10 characters long and represents a non-negative integer. The function iteratively reads each character of the string, validates it, and converts it to a byte representation.
name: DEC_TO_BYTE

input.name: DEC
input.description: A string representation of a decimal number to be converted to byte.

return_value.description: The byte representation of the input decimal string.

title: 3D Vector Addition
description: This function performs the addition of two 3-dimensional vectors. Given two input vectors A and B, the function computes the resultant vector by adding the corresponding components (X, Y, Z) of the input vectors.
name: V3_ADD

input.name: A
input.description: The first input vector for the addition operation.

fields.name: X
fields.description: The X component of the vector A.

fields.name: Y
fields.description: The Y component of the vector A.

fields.name: Z
fields.description: The Z component of the vector A.

input.name: B
input.description: The second input vector for the addition operation.

fields.name: X
fields.description: The X component of the vector B.

fields.name: Y
fields.description: The Y component of the vector B.

fields.name: Z
fields.description: The Z component of the vector B.

output.name: V3_ADD
output.description: The resultant vector from the addition of vectors A and B.

fields.name: X
fields.description: The X component of the resultant vector.

fields.name: Y
fields.description: The Y component of the resultant vector.

fields.name: Z
fields.description: The Z component of the resultant vector.

return_value.description: The function does not return a value, but modifies the output parameter V3_ADD.

title: List Next Function Block
description: This function block processes a list represented as a string, extracting elements until a specified separator is encountered or the end of the list is reached. It resets the position based on the reset input and outputs the parsed values along with a flag indicating whether the list was empty or fully processed.
name: LIST_NEXT

input.name: SEP
input.description: The separator byte used to delimit items in the list.

input.name: RST
input.description: A boolean flag to reset the position in the list to the beginning.

output.name: LEL
output.description: The output string containing the next list element extracted from the input list.

output.name: NUL
output.description: A boolean flag indicating whether the list is empty or fully processed.

in/out.name: LIST
in/out.description: The input string representing the entire list to be processed.

title: Extracting a Byte from a DWORD
description: This function takes a DWORD input and a BYTE index to extract a specific byte from the DWORD. The BYTE value is determined by shifting the DWORD and converting it to BYTE format. The function is designed for efficient performance improvements across revisions.
name: BYTE_OF_DWORD

input.name: in
input.description: The DWORD value from which a byte will be extracted.

input.name: N
input.description: The index of the byte to extract from the DWORD, multiplied by 8 to account for bit shifts.

output.name: BYTE_OF_DWORD
output.description: The extracted byte from the specified position of the input DWORD.

return_value.description: The resulting byte obtained from the extraction process.

title: Addition of Two Real2 Values
description: The function 'R2_ADD2' is designed to perform the addition of two input parameters of type 'REAL2'. It takes two 'REAL2' structures as input, adds their respective members, and returns a 'REAL2' structure containing the sum.
name: R2_ADD2

input.name: X
input.description: The first 'REAL2' structure that contains the first set of values to be added.

input.name: Y
input.description: The second 'REAL2' structure that contains the second set of values to be added.

return_value.description: The 'REAL2' structure that contains the result of the addition of 'X' and 'Y'.

fields.name: R1
fields.description: The first real part of the 'REAL2' structure which is the sum of 'X.R1' and 'Y.R1'.

fields.name: RX
fields.description: The second real part of the 'REAL2' structure which is the sum of 'X.RX' and 'Y.RX'.

title: Integer Truncation Function
description: This function takes a real number as input and truncates it to its nearest integer value, following specific rounding rules based on whether the input is positive or negative. The function adjusts the truncated value based on whether it is greater than or less than the original input.
name: D_TRUNC

input.name: X
input.description: The real number to be truncated to an integer.

return_value.description: The truncated integer value of the input real number.

title: Array Shuffle Function
description: This function shuffles an array of real numbers in a random order. It takes a pointer to an array of real numbers and the size of the array as input, and it performs in-place swapping of elements to randomize their order.
name: _ARRAY_SHUFFLE

input.name: pt
input.description: A pointer to the array of real numbers that needs to be shuffled.

input.name: size
input.description: The size of the array, determining how many elements will be shuffled.

return_value.description: Returns TRUE if the array was shuffled successfully.

title: Convert Geographic Coordinates to Decimal Degrees
description: This function takes geographic coordinates in degrees, minutes, and seconds and converts them into decimal degrees format. The degrees, minutes, and seconds are input as separate parameters.
name: GEO_TO_DEG

input.name: D
input.description: The degree component of the geographic coordinate

input.name: M
input.description: The minute component of the geographic coordinate

input.name: SEC
input.description: The second component of the geographic coordinate

return_value.description: The resulting decimal degrees calculated from the input geographic coordinates

title: Temperature Calculation Function
description: This function computes the temperature based on two input parameters, Res and R0, by applying a mathematical formula. The output is a real number representing the calculated temperature.
name: TEMP_NI

input.name: Res
input.description: The resistance value measured.

input.name: R0
input.description: The reference resistance value for the calculation.

return_value.description: The calculated temperature derived from the formula using Res and R0.

title: Calculate Array Median
description: This function calculates the median of a given array of real numbers. It takes a pointer to the array and the size of the array as inputs. The median is determined based on whether the size of the array is even or odd after sorting the array.
name: _ARRAY_MEDIAN

input.name: pt
input.description: A pointer to an array of real numbers whose median is to be calculated.

input.name: size
input.description: The number of elements in the array pointed to by pt.

return_value.description: The median value of the array.

title: R2_MUL Function
description: This function takes a REAL2 structure and a REAL value as input, and multiplies the components of the REAL2 structure by the REAL value, returning a new REAL2 structure with the results.
name: R2_MUL

input.name: X
input.description: Input structure containing two REAL components RX and R1 to be multiplied.

input.name: Y
input.description: A REAL value to multiply with the components of the structure X.

return_value.description: The new REAL2 structure resulting from multiplying the components of X by Y.

fields.name: RX
fields.description: The result of multiplying the RX component of X by Y.

fields.name: R1
fields.description: The result of multiplying the R1 component of X by Y.

title: Range to Byte Conversion
description: This function takes a real number input and converts it to a byte based on a specified range defined by low and high limits. The resulting byte value represents the position of the input X within the scaled range from low to high.
name: RANGE_TO_BYTE

input.name: X
input.description: The real number input that is to be converted to a byte.

input.name: low
input.description: The lower bound of the range.

input.name: high
input.description: The upper bound of the range.

return_value.description: The resulting byte value after the conversion from the real number based on the defined range.

title: Integer Floor Function
description: This function calculates the floor value of a given real number by converting it to an integer. If the converted integer value is greater than the original real number, it reduces the integer value by one to ensure correct flooring behavior.
name: FLOOR

input.name: X
input.description: The real number input for which the floor value needs to be calculated.

return_value.description: The integer floor value of the input real number X.

title: Modulo Operation Function
description: This function calculates the modulo of a real number by another real number. If the divisor is zero, the function returns zero. Otherwise, it computes the modulo using the formula: in - DINT_TO_REAL(FLOOR2(in / divi)) * divi.
name: MODR

input.name: IN
input.description: The number to be divided.

input.name: DIVI
input.description: The divisor used for the modulo operation.

output.name: MODR
output.description: The result of the modulo operation.

return_value.description: The modulo result, which is either the computed modulo or zero if DIVI is zero.

title: Clock Pulse Generator
description: This function block generates a clock pulse output based on a specified time interval. The time interval can be configured at runtime, and the output pulse is generated whenever the elapsed time since the last pulse meets or exceeds the specified interval.
name: CLK_PRG

input.name: PT
input.description: The time period for which the output pulse should remain HIGH. Default value is set to 10 milliseconds.

output.name: Q
output.description: A boolean output which is HIGH when the output pulse is generated.

title: Byte Reversal Function
description: This function takes a single byte input and performs bitwise rotations and shifts to output a modified byte that represents a reversed byte pattern. The function applies various logical operations to the input byte to achieve the reversal effect.
name: REVERSE

input.name: IN
input.description: The input byte value to be reversed.

output.name: REVERSE
output.description: The output byte value resulting from the bitwise operations on the input byte.

return_value.description: The return value represents the modified byte resulting from the function's operations.

title: Calculate Beginning of Month from a Given Date
description: This function calculates the start date of the month for a given date input. It adjusts the input date by subtracting the number of seconds corresponding to the days in that month.
name: MONTH_BEGIN

input.name: idate
input.description: The input date from which the beginning of the month is to be calculated.

output.name: MONTH_BEGIN
output.description: The calculated beginning date of the month derived from the input date.

return_value.description: The date representing the start of the month for the given input date.

title: Integrator Function Block
description: This function block performs integration on a given input value. It takes an input signal and integrates it over time, with optional parameters to specify the integration factor and to enable or disable the operation. It also allows for setting output limits to prevent the integrated value from exceeding predefined bounds.
name: FT_INT

input.name: IN
input.description: The input value to be integrated.

input.name: K
input.description: The integration factor, default is set to 1.

input.name: RUN
input.description: A boolean indicating whether the integration should run or not, default is TRUE.

input.name: RST
input.description: A reset flag that, when TRUE, resets the output to zero.

input.name: OUT_MIN
input.description: The minimum limit for the output, default is set to -1E+37.

input.name: OUT_MAX
input.description: The maximum limit for the output, default is set to 1E+37.

output.name: OUT
output.description: The result of the integration process.

output.name: LIM
output.description: A boolean indicating if the output has reached a limit.

title: 4-to-1 Multiplexer Function
description: This function implements a 4-to-1 multiplexer logic that selects one of four boolean inputs based on two select lines. The function returns a boolean value corresponding to the selected input.
name: MUX_4

input.name: D0
input.description: First data input for the multiplexer.

input.name: D1
input.description: Second data input for the multiplexer.

input.name: D2
input.description: Third data input for the multiplexer.

input.name: D3
input.description: Fourth data input for the multiplexer.

input.name: A0
input.description: First select line for selecting the input.

input.name: A1
input.description: Second select line for selecting the input.

return_value.description: The output of the multiplexer, representing the selected boolean input.

title: Multiply and Add Function
description: This function performs a multiplication of two input parameters and then adds a third input parameter to the result. The function takes three inputs: X, K, and O. It calculates the product of X and K and adds O to this product, returning the final result.
name: MUL_ADD

input.name: X
input.description: The first input value that will be multiplied.

input.name: K
input.description: The second input value that will multiply with X.

input.name: O
input.description: The value that will be added to the product of X and K.

return_value.description: The result of the operation, which is the value of X multiplied by K, plus O.

title: Proportional-Integral Controller
description: This function block implements a Proportional-Integral (PI) controller with the ability to limit the output of the integrator. The function block receives an input signal, applies proportional and integral gains, handles output limits, and indicates if the integrator has reached its limits.
name: FT_PI

input.name: IN
input.description: The input value to the PI controller.

input.name: KP
input.description: The proportional gain parameter, default is 1.0.

input.name: KI
input.description: The integral gain parameter, default is 1.0.

input.name: ILIM_L
input.description: The lower limit for the integrator output, default is -1E+38.

input.name: ILIM_H
input.description: The upper limit for the integrator output, default is 1E+38.

input.name: IEN
input.description: Indicator to enable or disable the integrator, default is TRUE.

input.name: RST
input.description: Reset signal for the integrator.

output.name: Y
output.description: The output value of the PI controller after applying the gains.

output.name: LIM
output.description: Indicator that shows if the integrator has reached its output limits.

title: Convert DateTime to Structured DateTime
description: This function converts a DateTime value to a Structured DateTime (SDT) format, which breaks down the DateTime into individual components such as year, month, day, weekday, hour, minute, and second.
name: DT_TO_SDT

input.name: DTI
input.description: The input DateTime value that needs to be converted into Structured DateTime.

output.name: DT_TO_SDT
output.description: The output Structured DateTime that contains the year, month, day, weekday, hour, minute, and second extracted from the input DateTime.

return_value.description: The return value is a Structured DateTime containing the detailed components of the input DateTime value.

fields.name: YEAR
fields.description: The year component extracted from the input DateTime.

fields.name: MONTH
fields.description: The month component extracted from the input DateTime.

fields.name: DAY
fields.description: The day component extracted from the input DateTime.

fields.name: WEEKDAY
fields.description: The weekday component extracted from the input DateTime, representing the day of the week.

fields.name: HOUR
fields.description: The hour component extracted from the input DateTime.

fields.name: MINUTE
fields.description: The minute component extracted from the input DateTime.

fields.name: SECOND
fields.description: The second component extracted from the input DateTime.

title: Decrement Function
description: This function, DEC1, takes an integer value X and returns a decremented value based on the condition of X. If X equals zero, the function will return N - 1. Otherwise, it will return X - 1. The function is designed to handle integer inputs.
name: DEC1

input.name: X
input.description: An integer input value that will be decremented.

input.name: N
input.description: An integer input value used for calculation when X is zero.

return_value.description: The decremented integer value based on the conditions provided. Returns N - 1 if X is 0, otherwise returns X - 1.

title: Calculate the Gold Value
description: This function calculates a value based on the input parameter X using the formula GOLD := (X + SQRT(X*X + 4.0)) * 0.5. The function returns the calculated Gold value as a REAL type.
name: GOLD

input.name: X
input.description: The input real number for which the Gold value will be calculated.

return_value.description: The calculated Gold value based on the input X.

title: Calculate Resistance Based on Temperature Differences
description: This function calculates the resistance based on the input temperature and resistance values, considering the effects of the temperature differences using predefined constants.
name: RES_SI

input.name: T
input.description: The current temperature value.

input.name: RS
input.description: The base resistance value.

input.name: TS
input.description: The reference temperature value.

return_value.description: The calculated resistance value based on the inputs and constants.

title: Sine Wave Generator Function Block
description: This function block generates a sine wave based on a specified period, amplitude, and offset. It takes time as an input and outputs the current value of the sine wave and a boolean indicating the signal's state.
name: GEN_SIN

input.name: PT
input.description: The period of the sine wave.

input.name: AM
input.description: The amplitude of the sine wave. Default is 1.0.

input.name: OS
input.description: The offset of the sine wave.

input.name: DL
input.description: The duty cycle of the sine wave, which affects the waveform shape.

output.name: Q
output.description: A boolean output indicating the signal state, true if the sine wave is positive.

output.name: Out
output.description: The current value of the generated sine wave.

title: SHR_4UDE Function Block
description: This function block implements a 4-bit shift register with control signals for setting, resetting, and clocking. It handles the shifting of data based on a digital clock and has an optional direct load feature controlled by the DN signal.
name: SHR_4UDE

input.name: SET

description: This FUNCTION_BLOCK processes input signals and generates an output signal Q based on the input boolean parameters IN1, IN2, IN3, and IN4. It also utilizes a timestamp and local signal patterns for processing.
name: SIGNAL_4

input.description: Boolean input representing the first signal.

input.name: IN2

input.name: IN3

output.name: Q
output.description: Output boolean indicating whether an alarm condition is present.

title: Calculate End of Month Date
description: This function calculates the last date of the month for a given date input. It does so by finding the first day of the next month and subtracting one day.
name: MONTH_END

input.name: IDATE
input.description: The input date for which the end of month is to be calculated.

return_value.description: The last date of the month corresponding to the provided input date.

title: Byte Swap Function
description: This function takes a DWORD input and swaps its bytes. Specifically, it rotates the input bits to the right and left to achieve the byte swapping effect, combining the results to produce the final output.
name: SWAP_BYTE2

input.name: IN
input.description: The DWORD value whose bytes are to be swapped.

return_value.description: The resulting DWORD after the bytes have been swapped.

title: Convert String to Week Representation
description: This function converts a comma-separated string representation of weekdays into a byte value that represents those weekdays. The conversion takes into account the specified language by using a language index.
name: FSTRING_TO_WEEK

input.name: WEEK
input.description: A string containing the weekdays separated by commas.

input.name: LANG
input.description: An integer representing the language index for weekday conversion.

output.name: FSTRING_TO_WEEK
output.description: A byte value representing the converted weekdays.

return_value.description: Returns a byte value that encodes the weekdays from the input string.

title: Length Conversion Function Block
description: This function block converts various length units inputted in real numbers into meters and computes the equivalent values for different units such as p, in, ft, yd, mile, sm, and fm based on defined conversion factors.
name: LENGTH

input.description: Length in meters (SI base unit).

input.name: p

input.name: yd

input.description: Length in miles.

input.name: sm

output.name: Yyd

output.name: Ymile
output.description: Converted length in miles.

output.name: Ysm
output.description: Converted length in international sea miles.

output.name: Yfm
output.description: Converted length in fathoms.

title: Cycle Time Measurement
description: This FUNCTION_BLOCK is responsible for tracking cycle times in a process. It initializes cycle time values, updates minimum and maximum cycle times based on elapsed cycles, and counts the number of cycles that have occurred. The block resets the cycle time when requested.
name: CYCLE_TIME

input.name: RST
input.description: A boolean flag to reset the cycle time measurements.

output.name: ct_min
output.description: The minimum cycle time recorded.

output.name: ct_max
output.description: The maximum cycle time recorded.

output.name: ct_last
output.description: The last cycle time measured.

output.name: systime
output.description: The accumulated system time.

output.name: sysdays
output.description: The number of days accounted for in system time.

output.name: cycles
output.description: The total count of cycles that have occurred.

title: Set Date Function
description: This function calculates and returns a date based on the provided year, month, and day inputs. It also accounts for leap years when necessary.
name: SET_DATE

input.name: YEAR
input.description: The year of the date to be set.

input.name: MONTH
input.description: The month of the date to be set.

input.name: DAY
input.description: The day of the date to be set.

return_value.description: The calculated date based on the provided year, month, and day.

title: Holiday Event Checker
description: This function block checks for holiday events based on a given date. It uses an input date, a boolean enable signal, and searches a list of holiday data to determine if the date falls within any holiday event period. If a holiday is detected, it outputs a boolean indicating the event's status and the name of the holiday.
name: EVENTS

input.name: DATE_IN
input.description: The date to check for holiday events.

input.name: ENA
input.description: Enable signal to determine if the holiday event check should be processed.

output.name: Y
output.description: Output indicating if a holiday event is active.

output.name: NAME
output.description: The name of the holiday if an event is active, otherwise an empty string.

in/out.name: ELIST
in/out.description: An array of holiday data structures to check against the input date.

title: FRMP_B Function
description: This function computes a byte value based on the input parameters START, DIR, TD, and TR. It conditions the output based on the comparison of TD and TR. If TD is less than TR, it calculates a shifted value based on TD and TR, modifies it based on the direction indicated by DIR, and adjusts it with START. If TD is not less than TR, it sets the output depending on the value of DIR.
name: FRMP_B

input.name: START
input.description: The starting byte value to be used in calculations.

input.name: DIR
input.description: Direction flag, where TRUE indicates an increment operation and FALSE indicates a decrement operation.

input.name: TD
input.description: The first time duration to be compared with TR.

input.name: TR
input.description: The second time duration used for comparison with TD.

output.name: FRMP_B
output.description: The resulting byte value calculated based on the input parameters.

return_value.description: This return value represents the calculated byte value based on the function logic.

title: 4-bit Latch Function Block
description: This function block implements a 4-bit latch, where the output reflects the state of the inputs as long as a control signal (L) is true. An asynchronous reset (RST) will clear the output regardless of inputs.
name: LTCH_4

input.name: D0
input.description: First data input for the latch.

input.name: D1
input.description: Second data input for the latch.

input.name: D2
input.description: Third data input for the latch.

input.name: D3
input.description: Fourth data input for the latch.

input.name: L
input.description: Control signal that determines if the latch is transparent.

input.name: RST
input.description: Asynchronous reset signal that resets the output.

output.name: Q0
output.description: Output corresponding to the first data input.

output.name: Q1
output.description: Output corresponding to the second data input.

output.name: Q2
output.description: Output corresponding to the third data input.

output.name: Q3
output.description: Output corresponding to the fourth data input.

title: Square Root to the Nth Power Calculation
description: This function computes the square root of a given number raised to the power of N. It returns 0 if N is less than or equal to 0 for compatibility reasons.
name: SQRTN

input.name: X
input.description: The base number for which the Nth root needs to be calculated.

input.name: N
input.description: The exponent indicating the degree of the root to compute. Must be greater than 0.

output.name: SQRTN
output.description: The computed Nth root of X, or 0 if N is less than or equal to 0.

return_value.description: The result of the Nth root calculation.

title: Array Sum Function
description: This function calculates the sum of elements in a given array of real numbers, using a pointer to the array and its size as input parameters.
name: ARRAY_SUM

input.name: pt
input.description: Pointer to the array of real numbers to be summed.

input.name: size
input.description: The size of the array. This indicates the number of elements in the array to be processed.

return_value.description: The sum of the elements of the array.

title: Multiply Time by a Real Number
description: This function computes the product of a TIME value and a REAL multiplier, returning the result as a TIME. It first converts the TIME to a REAL number, multiplies it by the REAL multiplier, and then converts the result back to TIME.
name: MULTIME

input.name: t
input.description: The TIME value to be multiplied.

input.name: M
input.description: The REAL multiplier to scale the TIME value.

return_value.description: The resulting TIME after multiplying the input TIME with the REAL multiplier.

title: Increment Function with Bounds
description: The function INC2 calculates the incremented value of an integer X by a specified increment D, constrained within the limits defined by L (lower limit) and U (upper limit). The function returns the incremented value, ensuring it wraps around if it exceeds the upper limit.
name: INC2

input.name: X
input.description: The integer value to be incremented.

input.name: D
input.description: The increment value to be added to X.

input.name: L
input.description: The lower boundary limit for the incremented value.

input.name: U
input.description: The upper boundary limit for the incremented value.

return_value.description: The incremented value of X after applying the increment D within the specified limits.

title: Calculate Angle from Z-Axis
description: This function calculates the angle in radians between a 3D vector and the Z-axis. It takes a 3D vector as input and returns the angle based on the Z component of the vector normalized by its magnitude, returning the angle only if the vector has a non-zero length.
name: V3_ZANG

input.name: A
input.description: A 3D vector containing the X, Y, and Z components.

return_value.description: The angle in radians between the vector and the Z-axis.

title: PI Controller Function Block
description: This function block implements a proportional-integral (PI) controller. It processes an input signal with a proportional gain (KP) and an integral gain (KI) while enforcing both upper and lower limits on the output signal. The block can be reset, which initializes internal variables.
name: FT_PIWL

input.name: IN
input.description: The input signal for the PI controller.

input.name: KP
input.description: The proportional gain coefficient (default is 1.0).

input.name: KI
input.description: The integral gain coefficient (default is 1.0).

input.name: LIM_L
input.description: The lower limit for the output signal (default is -1E+38).

input.name: LIM_H
input.description: The upper limit for the output signal (default is 1E+38).

input.name: RST
input.description: A boolean flag to reset the internal state.

output.name: Y
output.description: The output signal from the PI controller.

output.name: LIM
output.description: Indicates whether the output signal is within the defined limits.

title: Check Non-Containment of Substring
description: This function checks whether the specified substring (cmp) is contained within a given string (str). If the substring is found in any part of the string, the function will return FALSE. If the substring is not found at all, the function will return TRUE.
name: IS_NCC

input.name: str
input.description: The main string in which to search for the substring.

input.name: cmp
input.description: The substring that needs to be checked for containment in the main string.

return_value.description: Boolean value indicating whether the substring is not contained in the main string. TRUE if not found; FALSE if found.

title: 4-Bit Digital Decoder
description: This function block implements a 4-bit digital decoder based on the input control signals. It takes two address inputs (A0 and A1) and a data input (D) to produce four output signals (Q0, Q1, Q2, Q3) based on the combination of inputs.
name: DEC_4

input.name: D
input.description: Data input that controls the activation of the outputs.

input.name: A0
input.description: Address input bit 0.

input.name: A1
input.description: Address input bit 1.

output.name: Q0
output.description: Output signal 0, active when D is TRUE, A0 is FALSE, and A1 is FALSE.

output.name: Q1
output.description: Output signal 1, active when D is TRUE, A0 is TRUE, and A1 is FALSE.

output.name: Q2
output.description: Output signal 2, active when D is TRUE, A0 is FALSE, and A1 is TRUE.

output.name: Q3
output.description: Output signal 3, active when D is TRUE, A0 is TRUE, and A1 is TRUE.

title: Array Multiplication Function
description: This function multiplies each element of a real number array by a specified real number. The function takes a pointer to an array as input, along with the size of the array and the multiplier. The function processes half the elements of the array based on the size provided.
name: _ARRAY_MUL

input.name: pt
input.description: A pointer to the array of real numbers that will be modified.

input.name: size
input.description: The size of the array indicating how many elements are present.

input.name: X
input.description: The real number by which each element of the array will be multiplied.

return_value.description: Returns TRUE to indicate successful completion of the multiplication operation.

title: ESR Data Collection Function Block
description: This function block collects ESR data from multiple input arrays, processes them, and outputs a combined array of valid ESR data. It supports a reset functionality to initialize the output position.
name: ESR_COLLECT

input.name: ESR_0
