output.name: ESR_OUT
output.description: Output array containing up to 32 collected ESR data elements.

in/out.name: pos
in/out.description: Current position index for output storage, can be modified to determine where to place the next valid ESR data.

title: Quadratic Function Calculator
description: This function calculates the value of a quadratic equation given the coefficients A, B, and C, and the input variable X. The function applies the formula f(X) = A * X^2 + B * X + C to compute the result.
name: F_QUAD

input.name: X
input.description: The value of the variable X for which the quadratic function is calculated.

input.name: A
input.description: The coefficient A in the quadratic equation.

input.name: B
input.description: The coefficient B in the quadratic equation.

input.name: C
input.description: The coefficient C in the quadratic equation.

return_value.description: The computed value of the quadratic function based on the input parameters X, A, B, and C.

title: Sequencer Function Block
description: This function block implements a sequential control logic with multiple inputs and outputs, allowing the user to manage a sequence of operations determined by input signals and timed delays. The sequence can be started, reset, and controlled to handle errors as specified.

title: UML Character Replacement Function
description: The function REPLACE_UML is designed to replace umlaut characters in a given string with their corresponding representations. It ensures that non-umlaut characters are copied directly to the output string. The function handles pointer manipulation and ensures that the output does not exceed the defined string length.
name: REPLACE_UML

input.name: str
input.description: The input string that may contain umlaut characters which need to be replaced.

return_value.description: The output string after replacing umlaut characters, with appropriate handling for non-umlaut characters.

title: Tuning Function Block
description: This function block implements a tuning system for adjusting a value Y based on various input signals for setting, incrementing, decrementing, and resetting values. The block manages state changes and time-based ramps for gradual adjustments while ensuring that the output value remains within specified limits.
name: TUNE

input.name: SET
input.description: A boolean flag to set the value of Y to SET_val.

input.name: SU
input.description: A boolean flag indicating a request to increment the value of Y slowly.

input.name: SD
input.description: A boolean flag indicating a request to decrement the value of Y slowly.

input.name: RST
input.description: A boolean flag to reset the value of Y to RST_val.

input.name: SS
input.description: A real number representing the step size for slow adjustments, default value is 0.1.

input.name: Limit_L
input.description: The lower limit for the output value Y.

input.name: LIMIT_H
input.description: The upper limit for the output value Y, default value is 100.0.

input.name: RST_val
input.description: The value to set Y to when RST is true.

input.name: SET_val
input.description: The value to set Y to when SET is true, default value is 100.0.

input.name: T1
input.description: The duration for the slow ramp operation, default value is 500 ms.

input.name: T2
input.description: The duration for the fast ramp operation, default value is 2 s.

input.name: S1
input.description: The step size for the slow ramp up operation, default value is 2.0.

input.name: S2
input.description: The step size for the fast ramp up operation, default value is 10.0.

output.name: Y
output.description: The output value that is adjusted based on the input states and limits.

title: Complex Power Calculation
description: This function calculates the power of a complex number X raised to another complex number Y using the formula CPOW(X, Y) = CEXP(CMUL(Y, CLOG(X))).
name: CPOW

input.name: X
input.description: The base complex number that is to be raised to a power.

input.name: Y
input.description: The exponent complex number that indicates the power to which X is raised.

output.name: CPOW
output.description: The result of raising the complex number X to the power of the complex number Y.

return_value.description: The calculated complex power result of X raised to Y.

title: M_D Function Block
description: This function block manages the timing operations based on start and stop inputs while allowing for a reset condition. It tracks elapsed and preset time based on the provided inputs.
name: M_D

input.name: start
input.description: A boolean input to start the timer.

input.name: stop
input.description: A boolean input to stop the timer.

input.name: tmax
input.description: The maximum preset time for the timer, defaults to 14400 minutes.

input.name: rst
input.description: A boolean input to reset the timer.

output.name: PT
output.description: The preset time that has been set or retained when stopping.

output.name: ET
output.description: The elapsed time counted while the timer is running.

output.name: run
output.description: A boolean output indicating whether the timer is currently running.

title: Calculate Geometric Average of an Array
description: This function computes the geometric average of a given array of real numbers. It takes a pointer to an array and its size as inputs. If any element of the array is less than or equal to zero, the function returns a geometric average of zero. Otherwise, it computes the geometric average by multiplying all positive elements and taking the nth root, where n is the number of elements processed.
name: ARRAY_GAV

input.name: pt
input.description: A pointer to the array of real numbers whose geometric average is to be calculated.

input.name: size
input.description: The size of the array, indicating how many elements are present.

output.name: ARRAY_GAV
output.description: The computed geometric average of the array. Returns 0.0 if any array element is non-positive.

return_value.description: The geometric average of the input array computed from the positive elements.

title: Inverse Function
description: This function computes the inverse of the input value X. If X is not zero, it returns the result as 1.0 divided by X. If X equals zero, the function does not change the value of INV.
name: INV

input.name: X
input.description: The input value for which the inverse is to be calculated.

return_value.description: The computed inverse of the input value X.

title: Resistance Temperature Detector Calculation
description: This function calculates the resistance of a Pt100 temperature sensor based on the input temperature (T) and reference resistance (R0). The calculation takes into account the temperature coefficients A, B, and C to determine the resistance at different temperature ranges.
name: RES_PT

input.name: T
input.description: The temperature in degrees Celsius for which the resistance is to be calculated.

input.name: R0
input.description: The reference resistance of the Pt100 sensor at 0 degrees Celsius.

output.name: RES_PT
output.description: The calculated resistance of the Pt100 sensor based on the input temperature and reference resistance.

return_value.description: The resistance value computed from the input parameters for a Pt100 sensor.

title: Linear Interpolation Function
description: This function performs linear interpolation for a given value X based on predefined points defined in an array XY. It ensures that the input number of points (Pts) is bound within the array size and calculates the interpolated value according to the linear segment defined by the provided points.
name: LINEAR_INT

input.name: X
input.description: The input value for which the linear interpolation is to be calculated.

input.name: XY
input.description: A two-dimensional array containing the points for interpolation, where each row represents a point with X and Y coordinates.

input.name: Pts
input.description: The number of points defined in the XY array that should be used for interpolation.

output.name: LINEAR_INT
output.description: The result of the linear interpolation calculation for the given input X.

return_value.description: The real number result obtained from the linear interpolation.

title: Celsius to Fahrenheit Conversion Function
description: This function converts a temperature value from Celsius to Fahrenheit. The input is a temperature in Celsius, and the function calculates the corresponding temperature in Fahrenheit using the formula: Fahrenheit = Celsius * 1.8 + 32.0.
name: C_TO_F

input.name: celsius
input.description: The temperature value in degrees Celsius to be converted to Fahrenheit.

output.name: C_TO_F
output.description: The temperature value in degrees Fahrenheit obtained from the conversion.

return_value.description: The converted temperature value in degrees Fahrenheit.

title: A_TRIG Function Block
description: The A_TRIG function block detects a change in its input signal (IN) and indicates when the change exceeds a specified threshold (RES). It calculates the difference (D) between the current input and the last recorded input to determine if the output (Q) should be triggered. If the change exceeds the specified threshold, the output Q is set to TRUE, and the current input is recorded as the last input for future comparisons.
name: A_TRIG

input.name: IN
input.description: The current input value to be evaluated.

input.name: RES
input.description: The threshold value for the change detection.

output.name: Q
output.description: Output indicating whether a significant change has occurred.

output.name: D
output.description: The calculated difference between the current input and the last input.

title: Sensor Intensity Calculation
description: This function calculates the sensor intensity based on the provided voltage, current, and resistances. The calculation adjusts the sensor intensity by incorporating the values of RP and RS, as well as the resistance RG which is derived from voltage and current, if the current is not zero.
name: SENSOR_INT

input.name: Voltage
input.description: The voltage input to the function.

input.name: Current
input.description: The current input to the function.

input.name: RP
input.description: The parallel resistance value used in the calculation.

input.name: RS
input.description: The series resistance value used in the calculation.

return_value.description: The calculated sensor intensity value.

title: Calculate Day of the Week
description: This function calculates the day of the week for a given date. It takes a date as input and returns an integer representing the day of the week, with 1 for Sunday, 2 for Monday, and so on.
name: DAY_OF_WEEK

input.name: IDATE
input.description: The input date for which the day of the week is to be calculated.

output.name: DAY_OF_WEEK
output.description: An integer representing the day of the week, where 1 corresponds to Sunday.

return_value.description: The day of the week as an integer.

title: Compute Complex Hyperbolic Cosine
description: This function computes the hyperbolic cosine of a given complex number. The real part of the output is calculated using the hyperbolic cosine of the real part of the input, while the imaginary part is derived from the sine of the real and imaginary parts of the input.
name: CCOSH

input.name: X
input.description: A complex number for which the hyperbolic cosine is to be calculated.

return_value.description: The hyperbolic cosine of the input complex number.

fields.name: re
fields.description: The real part of the hyperbolic cosine.

fields.name: im
fields.description: The imaginary part of the hyperbolic cosine.

title: Real to String Formatting Function
description: This function converts a real number into a string representation with a specified number of decimal places and a specified decimal separator. The output string is formatted to ensure it has at least 8 characters, adding leading zeros if necessary, and includes a decimal point if the specified number of decimal places is greater than zero.
name: REAL_TO_STRF

input.name: IN
input.description: The real number to be converted to a string.

input.name: N
input.description: The number of decimal places to round the real number to. Must be limited to the range 0..7.

input.name: D
input.description: The character to be used as the decimal separator.

output.name: REAL_TO_STRF
output.description: The resulting string representation of the real number.

return_value.description: The string representation of the real number after conversion and formatting.

title: Toggle Function Block
description: This function block implements a toggle mechanism that changes the state of the output Q each time there is a rising edge detected on the CLK input, while also handling a reset functionality through the rst input.
name: TOGGLE

input.name: CLK
input.description: Clock input signal used for toggling the output state.

input.name: rst
input.description: Reset input signal that sets the output Q to false when high.

output.name: Q
output.description: Current state of the output signal, toggled based on the CLK input.

title: Cyclic Redundancy Check (CRC) Generator
description: This function generates the CRC for a given byte array. It processes the input array with a specified size and computes the CRC based on defined polynomial values and settings for endianness. Input bytes can be reversed, and the output CRC can also be reflected according to user-defined parameters.
name: CRC_GEN

input.name: PT
input.description: Pointer to the input byte array that needs CRC generation.

input.name: SIZE
input.description: Size of the input byte array, must be at least 4 bytes.

input.name: PL
input.description: Polynomial degree which defines the CRC configuration.

input.name: PN
input.description: Polynomial value used for CRC calculation.

input.name: INIT
input.description: Initial value for the CRC calculation.

input.name: REV_IN
input.description: Flag indicating whether to reverse the input bytes before processing.

input.name: REV_OUT
input.description: Flag indicating whether to reverse the output CRC value.

input.name: XOR_OUT
input.description: Value to XOR with the final CRC result.

output.name: CRC_GEN
output.description: The resulting CRC value after processing the input byte array.

return_value.description: Returns the calculated CRC value.

title: Convert Hours to Time
description: This function converts a given input in hours (as a REAL type) into a TIME type by multiplying the input by 3600000 (the number of milliseconds in an hour) and converting it to DWORD.
name: HOUR_TO_TIME

input.name: IN
input.description: The input value representing time in hours.

return_value.description: The converted time in the TIME format.

title: Random Number Generation Function
description: This function generates a random integer within a specified range defined by the parameters 'low' and 'high', based on a fractional part of the input 'last' multiplied by  (pi). The function truncates the random value before adding it to 'low' to ensure that the result remains within the specified bounds.
name: RDM2

input.name: last
input.description: An integer input used to generate the random number.

input.name: low
input.description: The lower bound of the range for the random number generation.

input.name: high
input.description: The upper bound of the range for the random number generation.

return_value.description: The generated random integer within the specified range from 'low' to 'high'.

title: SINC Function
description: This function calculates the sine of a given input value divided by the input itself, returning 1.0 when the input is zero to handle the singularity at that point.
name: SINC

input.name: X
input.description: The input value for which the sine calculation is to be performed.

return_value.description: The result of the sine calculation, or 1.0 if the input value is zero.

title: Complex Arc Sine Function
description: This function computes the arc sine of a complex number. It takes a complex input and produces a complex output that represents the arc sine of the input value, following the mathematical definition of the complex arc sine function.
name: CASIN

input.name: X
input.description: Input variable of type complex, representing the complex number for which the arc sine will be calculated.

output.name: CASIN
output.description: Output variable of type complex, representing the arc sine of the input complex number X.

return_value.description: The resulting complex number from the computation of the arc sine.

fields.name: re
fields.description: The real part of the resulting complex number.

fields.name: im
fields.description: The imaginary part of the resulting complex number.

title: Bit Load Function
description: This function modifies a specified bit of a BYTE input based on the provided boolean flag. If the flag is true, it sets the bit at the specified position to 1; if false, it clears the bit at that position to 0.
name: BIT_LOAD_B

input.name: IN
input.description: The input BYTE value that will be modified.

input.name: VAL
input.description: A boolean flag that determines whether to set or clear the bit at the specified position.

input.name: POS
input.description: The position of the bit in the BYTE that needs to be set or cleared.

output.name: BIT_LOAD_B
output.description: The modified BYTE after the bit operation.

return_value.description: The value of the modified BYTE after the operation.

title: CLK_PULSE Function Block
description: This function block generates a pulse output for a specified number of cycles based on a given time period. It can be reset and counts the number of pulses generated. The output, Q, is set to TRUE during the pulse generation cycle.
name: CLK_PULSE

input.name: PT
input.description: The time period for generating each pulse.

input.name: N
input.description: The number of pulses to generate. A value of 0 means continuous pulses.

input.name: RST
input.description: A reset flag to initialize the pulse generation process.

output.name: Q
output.description: Indicates when a pulse is generated (TRUE during a pulse).

output.name: CNT
output.description: Counts the number of pulses generated.

output.name: RUN
output.description: Indicates if pulse generation is currently running.

title: D_TRIG Function Block
description: This function block detects changes in the input signal and calculates the difference between the current and previous input values. It provides an output indicating whether a change has occurred and the amount of change.
name: D_TRIG

input.name: in
input.description: Current input value to be monitored.

output.name: Q
output.description: Output flag indicating whether the input has changed since the last scan.

output.name: X
output.description: Output value that represents the difference between the current input and the last input.

title: Binary to Byte Conversion
description: This function converts a binary string representation (up to 12 characters) into its corresponding byte value. The input binary string should consist only of '0's and '1's, and the function processes each character to compute the final byte value.
name: BIN_TO_BYTE

input.name: BIN
input.description: A binary string consisting of '0's and '1's with a maximum length of 12 characters.

output.name: BIN_TO_BYTE
output.description: The resulting byte value obtained from the binary string.

return_value.description: The byte value that represents the input binary string.

title: Convert Direction to Degrees
description: This function takes a direction represented as a string and returns its corresponding degree value. The direction is matched against predefined language settings, and the function ensures that the input length is respected to prevent errors.
name: DIR_TO_DEG

input.name: DIR
input.description: A string representation of the direction, limited to three characters.

input.name: L
input.description: An integer indicating the language option, used for direction localization.

return_value.description: The degree representation of the input direction calculated as per the language-specific mapping.

title: Character Replacement Function
description: This function replaces occurrences of a specified substring (SRC) in a given string (STR) with another substring (REP). It ensures that the lengths of SRC and REP are the same before proceeding with the replacement. If SRC is longer than REP, SRC will be trimmed to match the length of REP, and vice versa. The function then performs the replacement for each character in the original string.
name: REPLACE_CHARS

input.name: STR
input.description: The string in which the replacement will occur.

input.name: SRC
input.description: The substring to be replaced in STR.

input.name: REP
input.description: The substring that will replace occurrences of SRC.

output.name: REPLACE_CHARS
output.description: The resulting string after replacement operations.

return_value.description: The modified string after replacing characters according to the defined rules.

title: Filter Dynamics with Time Integration
description: This functional block implements a filter that integrates input over time using differential calculations. It takes an input value 'X' of type DWORD and a time interval 'T' of type TIME to compute an output 'Y' of type DWORD, representing the integrated value. The block initializes the integration process and continuously updates the integrated value based on the elapsed time and input changes.
name: FILTER_DW

input.name: X
input.description: Input value to be filtered.

input.name: T
input.description: Time interval over which the integration is computed.

output.name: Y
output.description: The filtered output value.

title: Input Control Function for ISC
description: This function evaluates whether the input byte IN is less than 32 or equal to 127, returning a boolean value indicating the result of this evaluation.
name: ISC_CTRL

input.name: IN
input.description: A byte input value that will be evaluated by the function.

return_value.description: Returns TRUE if the input IN is less than 32 or equal to 127; otherwise, returns FALSE.

title: First-order Transfer Function with Time Constant
description: This function block implements a first-order transfer function that uses a time constant T and a gain K to process an input signal. The output signal is adjusted based on the previous output and the elapsed time since the last computation. The block initializes on the first call or when the time parameter T is zero, setting the output equal to K times the input.
name: FT_PT1

input.name: in
input.description: The input signal for the transfer function.

input.name: T
input.description: The time constant for the transfer function.

input.name: K
input.description: The gain factor applied to the input signal. Default value is 1.0.

output.name: out
output.description: The output signal of the transfer function.

title: METER Function Block
description: This function block measures the current consumption based on the input parameters and maintains an output value that can be used for further processing. It accounts for execution timing and supports resetting of the measured values.
name: METER

input.name: M1
input.description: First measurement input.

input.name: M2
input.description: Second measurement input.

input.name: I1
input.description: Boolean indicator for the first measurement.

input.name: I2
input.description: Boolean indicator for the second measurement.

input.name: D
input.description: Divisor used for calculations, defaults to 1.0.

input.name: RST
input.description: Reset signal to initialize measured values.

output.name: MX
output.description: Current output value reflecting the consumption measurement.

title: Convert Degrees to Radians with Modulo Operation
description: This function converts an angle in degrees to radians while ensuring that the result is restricted to the range [0, 2PI]. The conversion follows the formula: radians = degrees * ( / 180). The output value is then limited using the MODR operation.
name: RAD

input.name: DEG
input.description: Degrees as input variable.

return_value.description: The calculated radians value, constrained to be within the range [0, 2PI].

title: Replace All Occurrences of a Substring
description: This function replaces all occurrences of a specified substring (src) within a given string (str) with a new substring (rep). It does this by iteratively finding and replacing each occurrence until none are left.
name: REPLACE_ALL

input.name: str
input.description: The original string in which occurrences of the source substring will be replaced.

input.name: src
input.description: The substring that needs to be replaced in the original string.

input.name: rep
input.description: The substring that will replace each occurrence of the source substring.

output.name: REPLACE_ALL
output.description: The modified string after all occurrences of the source substring have been replaced.

return_value.description: The final string resulting from the replacement of all occurrences.

title: Fractional Part Calculation
description: This function calculates the fractional part of a given real number. If the absolute value of the input number is less than 2 billion, the function returns the fractional part calculated by subtracting the truncated integer value from the original number. If the absolute value of the input number exceeds or equals 2 billion, the function returns 0.
name: FRACT

input.name: x
input.description: The real number from which the fractional part is to be calculated.

output.name: FRACT
output.description: The calculated fractional part of the input number, or 0 if the absolute value of the input number is greater than or equal to 2 billion.

return_value.description: Returns the fractional component of the input real number.

title: Complex Conjugate Function
description: This function calculates the complex conjugate of a given complex number by negating its imaginary part, while retaining its real part.
name: CCON

input.name: X
input.description: The input complex number for which the conjugate is to be calculated.

return_value.description: The complex conjugate of the input complex number.

fields.name: re
fields.description: The real part of the complex conjugate.

fields.name: im
fields.description: The imaginary part of the complex conjugate, which is the negation of the input's imaginary part.

title: Find First Non-Numeric Character
description: This function identifies the position of the first non-numeric character in a given string, starting from the end of the string and moving backwards. If all characters are numeric or if the string is empty, it returns 0.
name: FINDB_NONUM

input.name: str
input.description: The string in which to search for a non-numeric character.

return_value.description: The position of the first non-numeric character found in the string. Returns 0 if no non-numeric character is found.

title: Scale a Value between Two Ranges
description: This function scales a given input value from one range to another. The input value X is constrained by the low and high limits (I_LO and I_HI). If the input high limit is the same as the input low limit, the output will be set to the output low limit (O_LO). Otherwise, the function computes the scaled value based on the specified output range (O_LO to O_HI).
name: SCALE_D

input.name: X
input.description: The input value to be scaled.

input.name: I_LO
input.description: The lower limit of the input range.

input.name: I_HI
input.description: The upper limit of the input range.

input.name: O_LO
input.description: The lower limit of the output range.

input.name: O_HI
input.description: The upper limit of the output range.

output.name: SCALE_D
output.description: The scaled output value based on the input range and output range.

return_value.description: The function returns the scaled value.

title: 1D Timer Function Block
description: This function block implements a one-dimensional timer functionality, managing input and output states based on timing conditions. It resets when the RST input is true, times an input signal, and toggles output signals based on predefined time intervals.
name: TP_1D

input.name: IN
input.description: A boolean input signal that starts the timing process when true.

input.name: PT1
input.description: The time duration that determines how long the output Q remains true after the input IN is activated.

input.name: PTD
input.description: The delay time which controls when output W is activated after the input has been processed.

input.name: RST
input.description: A boolean reset input that, when true, resets the outputs and internal states.

output.name: Q
output.description: The boolean output indicating the active state based on the input and time conditions.

output.name: W
output.description: The boolean output indicating the delayed state which activates after the PTD time if conditions are met.

title: UTC to Local Time Conversion
description: This function converts a given UTC time to local time based on the specified time zone offset and daylight saving time (DST) considerations. The function takes into account whether DST is enabled and adjusts the time accordingly.
name: UTC_TO_LTIME

input.name: UTC
input.description: The UTC date and time to be converted.

input.name: DST_ENABLE
input.description: A boolean flag indicating whether daylight saving time adjustments should be applied.

input.name: TIME_ZONE_OFFSET
input.description: The time zone offset in minutes to be applied to the UTC time.

output.name: UTC_TO_LTIME
output.description: The converted local time in date and time format.

return_value.description: The function returns the local time corresponding to the input UTC time after applying the necessary adjustments for the time zone and DST.

title: Convert BCD to Integer
description: This function converts a Binary-Coded Decimal (BCD) represented as a BYTE into its corresponding INTEGER value. The conversion process masks the lower four bits of the BYTE and shifts the upper four bits to compute the integer representation.
name: BCDC_TO_INT

input.name: IN
input.description: A BYTE input representing the BCD value to be converted.

return_value.description: The resulting integer value derived from the given BCD input.

title: Temperature Conversion from Kelvin to Celsius
description: This function converts a temperature value from Kelvin to Celsius by adding the temperature constant T0. The implementation should ensure accuracy in the conversion process.
name: K_TO_C

input.name: Kelvin
input.description: The temperature value in Kelvin that needs to be converted to Celsius.

return_value.description: The converted temperature value in Celsius.

title: TONOF Function Block
description: The TONOF function block implements a timer functionality where it controls a boolean output based on input conditions and designated on/off timings. The block checks the input signals and manages the state of the output based on timing parameters provided.
name: TONOF

input.name: IN
input.description: The boolean input signal that triggers the timer.

input.name: T_ON
input.description: The time duration for which the output remains active when the input is true.

input.name: T_OFF
input.description: The time duration for which the output remains inactive when the input is false.

output.name: Q
output.description: The boolean output signal indicating the state after applying the timing logic.

title: AOUT1 Function Specification
description: The AOUT1 function calculates a DWORD output based on the provided input parameters. It applies bit shifting and scaling based on the specified range defined by low and high values. The input can also be limited based on specified criteria and can account for the sign of the input value.
name: AOUT1

input.name: in
input.description: The input real value that will be processed to compute the output.

input.name: Bit_0
input.description: The starting bit position for the output value. This is a constant input.

input.name: Bit_N
input.description: The ending bit position for the output value, defaulting to 31.

input.name: sign
input.description: The sign bit indicator, defaulting to 255.

input.name: low
input.description: The minimum value that input is limited to.

input.name: high
input.description: The maximum value available, defaulting to 10.0.

output.name: AOUT1
output.description: The calculated DWORD output value based on the processed input.

return_value.description: Returns the calculated DWORD output value.

title: Buffer to String Conversion
description: This function converts a specified range of bytes from a buffer into a string representation. The function takes a pointer to a byte array and parameters indicating the size of the buffer, the start, and stop indices for the conversion. It performs bounds checking and ensures the final string does not exceed the predefined maximum string length before terminating the string.
name: BUFFER_TO_STRING

input.name: PT
input.description: A pointer to the byte array that contains the data to be converted to a string.

input.name: SIZE
input.description: The total size of the byte array pointed to by PT.

input.name: START
input.description: The starting index in the byte array from which to begin the conversion.

input.name: STOP
input.description: The stopping index in the byte array at which to end the conversion.

output.name: string
output.description: The resulting string obtained from the specified range of the byte buffer.

return_value.description: The final string after converting the bytes from the buffer.

title: Find Last Numeric Character in String
description: This function, FINDB_NUM, aims to find the position of the last numeric character or a period in a given string. If a numeric character (0-9) or a period is found, the function returns the position (1-based index) of that character. If there are no numeric characters or periods in the string, it returns 0.
name: FINDB_NUM

input.name: str
input.description: Input variable of type STRING with a specified length.

output.name: FINDB_NUM
output.description: The position of the last numeric character or period in the input string, or 0 if none exists.

return_value.description: The return value indicates the position of the last numeric character or period found in the string.

title: STAIR2 Function Block
description: The STAIR2 function block performs a stair-step rounding operation on a given real number X based on a specified step size D. It outputs the rounded value Y based on the conditions defined. If the step size D is positive, Y is calculated based on the relation to X and adjusted according to D. If D is not positive, Y will simply be equal to X.
name: STAIR2

input.name: X
input.description: The input real value that needs to be rounded.

input.name: D
input.description: The step size for the rounding operation. Must be a positive real number to perform the stair-step calculation.

output.name: Y
output.description: The output real value after applying the stair-step rounding logic based on inputs X and D.

title: String to DWORD Conversion Function
description: This function converts a formatted string representation of a number into a DWORD. The function handles binary, octal, hexadecimal, and decimal formats based on specific prefixes in the input string.
name: FSTRING_TO_DWORD

input.name: IN
input.description: The input string which can represent a number in binary, octal, hexadecimal, or decimal format.

output.name: FSTRING_TO_DWORD
output.description: The DWORD representation of the input string after conversion from its specified format.

return_value.description: Returns the converted DWORD value from the input string.

title: Average Calculation Function Block
description: This function block calculates the average of incoming real values over a defined number of cycles, utilizing a delay mechanism for buffering the inputs. The block should reinitialize the buffer when reset is triggered and maintain control of the input flow with the enable signal.
name: FT_AVG

input.name: IN
input.description: The input real value to be averaged.

input.name: E
input.description: Enable signal to control the calculation of the average, defaults to TRUE.

input.name: N
input.description: The number of cycles for which the average is calculated, limited to a maximum of 32.

input.name: RST
input.description: Reset signal to initialize the buffer with the actual input value instead of zero.

output.name: AVG
output.description: The computed average of the input values over the specified cycles.

title: Calculation of Solar Times
description: This function block calculates the solar times for a given geographical location, providing the times for sunrise, sunset, and midday along with the sun's declination at midday. The user needs to provide the latitude and longitude of the location, the UTC date for the calculation, and an optional height adjustment for sunrise.
name: SUN_TIME

input.name: LATITUDE
input.description: Latitude of geographical position in degrees.

input.name: LONGITUDE
input.description: Longitude of geographical position in degrees.

input.name: UTC
input.description: World time in UTC format.

input.name: H
input.description: Height above horizon for sunrise, default value is -0.83333333333.

output.name: MIDDAY
output.description: Astrological midday in hours when sun stands at south direction.

output.name: SUN_RISE
output.description: Sunrise time for the current day in local time.

output.name: SUN_SET
output.description: Sunset time for the current day in local time.

output.name: SUN_DECLINATION
output.description: Sun declination above horizon at midday in degrees.

title: Convert Byte to UML Representation
description: This function converts a given BYTE input into its respective UML formatted string representation. Special German characters are transformed into their UML representations, while other BYTE values are handled using a character to string conversion.
name: TO_UML

input.name: IN
input.description: A BYTE input that represents a character in a specific encoding.

output.name: TO_UML
output.description: The UML representation of the input byte, transformed according to predefined rules.

return_value.description: The resulting UML string representation of the input BYTE.

title: Calculate Days in Year
description: This function calculates the number of days in a year based on the provided date. It checks if the date corresponds to a leap year and returns 366 if it does; otherwise, it returns 365.
name: DAYS_IN_YEAR

input.name: IDATE
input.description: The date for which the number of days in the year needs to be calculated.

return_value.description: The number of days in the year corresponding to the given date (365 or 366).

title: Scale Input Values with Offset
description: This function retrieves two input values based on boolean selection inputs, scales these values using a factor, and adds an offset. The function also considers minimum and maximum limits for the input values.
name: SCALE_X2

input.name: IN1
input.description: First boolean selector for input selection.

input.name: IN2
input.description: Second boolean selector for input selection.

input.name: K
input.description: Scaling factor applied to the selected inputs.

input.name: O
input.description: Offset added to the result after scaling.

input.name: IN1_MIN
input.description: Minimum value for input 1 when selected.

input.name: IN1_MAX
input.description: Maximum value for input 1 when selected. Default is 1000.0.

input.name: IN2_MIN
input.description: Minimum value for input 2 when selected.

input.name: IN2_MAX
input.description: Maximum value for input 2 when selected. Default is 1000.0.

output.name: SCALE_X2
output.description: The resultant value after scaling and applying the offset.

return_value.description: The final calculated value after processing the input parameters.

title: RMP Next Function Block
description: This function block determines the direction and state of a ramp based on the input values and conditions. It handles the ramping behavior and adjusts the output state UP, DN, and DIR based on the input conditions and the state of the timer.
name: _RMP_NEXT

input.name: E
input.description: Enable/disable input, with initial value set to TRUE.

input.name: IN
input.description: Current input value for the ramp control.

input.name: TR
input.description: Time duration for ramping state when moving upwards.

input.name: TF
input.description: Time duration for ramping state when moving downwards.

input.name: TL
input.description: Lock time duration for the ramp.

output.name: DIR
output.description: Indicates the direction of ramping; upwards if TRUE.

output.name: UP
output.description: Output indicating if the ramp is moving upwards.

output.name: DN
output.description: Output indicating if the ramp is moving downwards.

in/out.name: OUT
in/out.description: Current output value that can be modified by the function block.

title: FF_RSE Function Block
description: The FF_RSE function block is designed to implement a rising edge triggered flip-flop with an asynchronous reset capability. The block uses three input parameters: CS for the clock signal, CR for the reset signal, and RST for an external reset. The output Q indicates the current state of the flip-flop, which can be set to TRUE or FALSE based on the input signals.
name: FF_RSE

input.name: CS
input.description: Clock signal input, triggers a transition on the rising edge.

input.name: CR
input.description: Reset signal input, sets the output Q to FALSE on the rising edge.

input.name: RST
input.description: Asynchronous reset signal to set output Q to FALSE immediately.

output.name: Q
output.description: Output signal representing the state of the flip-flop (TRUE or FALSE).

title: Dead Band Calculation Function
description: This function calculates the dead band value based on the input value X and a specified limit L. If X exceeds L, the function returns the difference between X and L. If X is lower than -L, it returns the sum of X and L. If X is within the range of -L to L, it returns 0.0.
name: DEAD_BAND

input.name: X
input.description: The input value for which the dead band is calculated.

input.name: L
input.description: The limit value used to determine the dead band thresholds.

return_value.description: The calculated dead band value based on the input conditions.

title: Inverse Hyperbolic Cosine Calculation
description: This function calculates the inverse hyperbolic cosine (ACOSH) of a given real number input. The function uses the mathematical formula ACOSH(x) = ln(sqrt(x^2 - 1) + x) to compute the result.
name: ACOSH

input.name: X
input.description: The input value for which the inverse hyperbolic cosine is to be calculated. This value must be greater than or equal to 1.

return_value.description: The result of the inverse hyperbolic cosine calculation.

title: Ceiling Function
description: This function calculates the ceiling value of a given real number X. The ceiling value is the smallest integer that is greater than or equal to X. If the result of converting X to an integer is less than X, it increments the integer value by one to ensure the ceiling condition is satisfied.
name: CEIL

input.name: X
input.description: A real number input for which the ceiling value is to be calculated.

return_value.description: The ceiling value of the input real number X, representing the smallest integer greater than or equal to X.

title: Time to DWORD Conversion with Offset and Debugging
description: This function converts the current time to a DWORD value and applies an offset if debugging is enabled. The conversion process must account for the full range of time values, ensuring that an overflow correctly wraps around rather than resetting to zero. Additional considerations are provided for compatibility with specific hardware setups and debugging purposes.
name: T_PLC_US

input.name: debug
input.description: Flag indicating whether debug mode is active.

input.name: N
input.description: Number of bits to shift in the conversion process.

input.name: offset
input.description: Offset to apply to the converted time value.

output.name: T_PLC_US
output.description: The resulting DWORD value derived from the time conversion.

return_value.description: Returns the converted time value as a DWORD.

title: Beta Function Calculation
description: This function calculates the beta function value using the gamma function for two input real numbers, X and Y. The beta function is defined as the product of gamma of X and gamma of Y, divided by gamma of the sum of X and Y.
name: BETA

input.name: X
input.description: A real number input representing the first parameter for the beta function calculation.

input.name: Y
input.description: A real number input representing the second parameter for the beta function calculation.

return_value.description: The result of the beta function calculation, which is a real number.

title: Fibonacci Function

input.name: RD
input.description: Read signal, when TRUE initiates a read operation from the FIFO.

input.name: WD
input.description: Write signal, when TRUE initiates a write operation to the FIFO.

input.name: RST
input.description: Reset signal, when TRUE resets the FIFO state.

output.name: Dout
output.description: The data output read from the FIFO.

output.name: EMPTY
output.description: Status indicator, TRUE if the FIFO is empty.

output.name: FULL
output.description: Status indicator, TRUE if the FIFO is full.

title: Convert Frequency to Angular Frequency
description: This function converts a frequency value given in Hertz to angular frequency in radians per second by multiplying it with 2. The input parameter is the frequency (F), and the function returns the corresponding angular frequency as a real number.
name: F_TO_OM

input.name: F
input.description: The frequency value in Hertz to be converted to angular frequency.

return_value.description: The converted angular frequency in radians per second.

title: Moving Average Filter
description: This function block implements a moving average filter that calculates the average of the last N input values. It takes an input word value and produces an output word value representing the average. The block also includes a reset functionality.
name: FILTER_MAV_W

input.name: X
input.description: Input variable which is a word value to be averaged.

input.name: N
input.description: Input variable that specifies the number of samples to average. It is limited to a maximum of 32.

input.name: RST
input.description: Reset variable that initializes the moving average calculation when set to TRUE.

output.name: Y
output.description: Output variable which holds the current average value.

title: Polynomial Interpolation Calculation
description: This function calculates the value of a polynomial at a given point using interpolation based on provided data points. The function receives a value 'X' and an array of data points, 'XY', then computes the polynomial's value at 'X' using interpolation formulae derived from the inputs.
name: POLYNOM_INT

input.name: X
input.description: The point at which the polynomial value is to be calculated.

input.name: XY
input.description: A two-dimensional array containing the data points for polynomial interpolation, where each element corresponds to an (x, y) coordinate.

input.name: Pts
input.description: The number of data points provided in the 'XY' array, limited to a maximum of 5.

output.name: POLYNOM_INT
output.description: The calculated value of the polynomial at the point 'X'.

return_value.description: The result of the polynomial interpolation at the specified point 'X'.

title: Capitalize String
description: This function takes a string as input and returns a new string where the first character and any character following a space is converted to uppercase. The function processes each character of the input string sequentially.
name: CAPITALIZE

input.name: str
input.description: The input string that needs to be capitalized.

return_value.description: The capitalized version of the input string.

title: MESSAGE_4R Function Block
description: This function block, MESSAGE_4R, is designed to manage the selection of messages based on a rising edge trigger. It takes in several message strings and outputs the selected message alongside a counter and a trigger signal. The block uses a timer to regulate the message selection process.
name: MESSAGE_4R

input.name: M0
input.description: First message string.

input.name: M1
input.description: Second message string.

input.name: M2
input.description: Third message string.

input.name: M3
input.description: Fourth message string.

input.name: MM
input.description: Increment value for the message counter. Default is 3.

input.name: ENQ
input.description: Enable signal for the message selection process. Default is TRUE.

input.name: CLK
input.description: Clock signal used for timing the message selection process. Default is TRUE.

input.name: T1
input.description: Time interval for the timer. Default is 3 seconds.

output.name: MX
output.description: Selected message string based on the current counter value.

output.name: MN
output.description: Current message counter value.

output.name: TR
output.description: Trigger signal indicating that a new message has been selected.

title: Hysteresis Control Function Block
description: This function block implements a hysteresis control mechanism, determining the output states based on input values and defined ON/OFF thresholds. It evaluates the input against the ON and OFF parameters to set the output boolean values Q and win accordingly.
name: HYST

input.name: In
input.description: The input value to be evaluated against the hysteresis thresholds.

input.name: ON
input.description: The upper threshold value for the hysteresis control.

input.name: OFF
input.description: The lower threshold value for the hysteresis control.

output.name: Q
output.description: The output boolean indicating the active state based on hysteresis logic.

output.name: win
output.description: A boolean output that indicates if the input is within the hysteresis range.

title: Negation Function
description: This function takes a real number input and returns its negation. The output is the negative value of the input number.
name: NEGX

input.name: X
input.description: Input parameter which is a real number to be negated.

return_value.description: The negated value of the input X.

title: ONTIME Function Block
description: This function block, named ONTIME, is designed to keep track of elapsed time in seconds and cycles based on input signals. It utilizes the system clock to count milliseconds and updates the SECONDS and CYCLES outputs accordingly. The block can be reset using the RST input.
name: ONTIME

input.name: IN
input.description: This input signal indicates whether the timing should be active.

input.name: RST
input.description: This input signal resets the SECONDS and CYCLES outputs.

output.name: SECONDS
output.description: The total elapsed time in seconds.

output.name: CYCLES
output.description: The total count of active cycles.

title: Sign Function
description: This function determines the sign of the input integer value. It takes a 32-bit integer (DINT) as input and returns a boolean value indicating whether the sign bit is set (1) or not (0).
name: SIGN_I

input.name: IN
input.description: A 32-bit signed integer input whose sign is to be checked.

return_value.description: A boolean value indicating the sign of the input integer. Returns true if the sign bit is set (input is negative), otherwise returns false.

title: Alarm Monitoring Block
description: The ALARM_2 function block monitors two sets of thresholds (low and high) for the input value X. It uses hysteresis to determine when the alarms should trigger based on the defined low and high limits with respective hysteresis values. The outputs indicate whether the input value is above or below the defined thresholds.
name: ALARM_2

input.name: X
input.description: The input value that is being monitored.

input.name: LO_1
input.description: The lower threshold for the first alarm.

input.name: HI_1
input.description: The upper threshold for the first alarm.

input.name: LO_2
input.description: The lower threshold for the second alarm.

input.name: HI_2
input.description: The upper threshold for the second alarm.

input.name: HYS
input.description: The hysteresis value applied to determine alarm state changes.

output.name: Q1_LO
output.description: Output indicating if the first low alarm is triggered.

output.name: Q1_HI
output.description: Output indicating if the first high alarm is triggered.

output.name: Q2_LO
output.description: Output indicating if the second low alarm is triggered.

output.name: Q2_HI
output.description: Output indicating if the second high alarm is triggered.

title: Complex Inverse Function
description: This function calculates the inverse of a given complex number. The output is another complex number representing the inverse.
name: CINV

input.name: X
input.description: Input variable of type complex representing the complex number for which the inverse is to be calculated.

return_value.description: The inverse of the input complex number.

fields.name: re
fields.description: The real part of the inverse complex number.

fields.name: im
fields.description: The imaginary part of the inverse complex number.

title: Calculate Volume of a Cone
description: This function calculates the volume of a cone based on the radius and height provided as input parameters. The formula used for the calculation is V = (1/3) *  * r * h, simplified here as V = 1.047197551 * rx * rx * hx.
name: CONE_V

input.name: rx
input.description: The radius of the cone's base.

input.name: hx
input.description: The height of the cone.

return_value.description: The calculated volume of the cone.

title: Convert Hour to Time of Day
description: This function converts an input time in hours to a Time of Day (TOD) format. The input is a real number representing hours, which is multiplied by 3600000 to convert it into milliseconds before being converted into TOD format.
name: HOUR_TO_TOD

input.name: IN
input.description: The input time in hours that needs to be converted to Time of Day.

return_value.description: Returns the equivalent Time of Day representation of the input hours.

title: BYTE_To_STRH
description: This function converts a BYTE input variable into its corresponding hexadecimal string representation of two characters. The output is a string where each character represents a single digit of the hexadecimal value derived from the input BYTE.
name: BYTE_TO_STRH

input.name: IN
input.description: The BYTE input variable to be converted into a hexadecimal string.

return_value.description: The resulting string representation of the input BYTE in hexadecimal format.

title: Minute Calculation from Time of Day
description: This function calculates the minute component from a given Time of Day (TOD) input. The function takes a Time of Day input, processes it, and returns the integer minute value derived from the input time.
name: MINUTE

input.name: itod
input.description: The Time of Day input from which the minute value will be calculated.

return_value.description: The calculated minute value derived from the given Time of Day input.

title: ESR Monitoring Function Block
description: This function block monitors input status from multiple sources and updates the output array accordingly, while checking for conditions based on the mode provided. It initializes the output array and flags and updates them based on input changes.
name: ESR_MON_X8

input.name: s0
input.description: First status input byte.

input.name: s1
input.description: Second status input byte.

input.name: s2
input.description: Third status input byte.

input.name: s3
input.description: Fourth status input byte.

input.name: s4
input.description: Fifth status input byte.

input.name: s5
input.description: Sixth status input byte.

input.name: s6
input.description: Seventh status input byte.

input.name: s7
input.description: Eighth status input byte.

input.name: DT_in
input.description: DateTime input parameter.

input.name: Mode
input.description: Mode of operation, default is 3.

input.name: a0
input.description: Additional string input for status s0.

input.name: a1
input.description: Additional string input for status s1.

input.name: a2
input.description: Additional string input for status s2.

input.name: a3
input.description: Additional string input for status s3.

input.name: a6
input.description: Additional string input for status s6.

input.name: a7
input.description: Additional string input for status s7.

output.name: ESR_Flag
output.description: Flag indicating if any status input has changed and an output was updated.

in/out.name: ESR_Out
in/out.description: Output array that stores the converted status based on inputs.

title: Sigmoid Function
description: This function calculates the sigmoid of a given real number input. The function utilizes specific conditions to return 1.0 for inputs greater than 20.0 and 0.0 for inputs less than -85.0. For inputs within this range, the sigmoid function is computed using the standard mathematical formula.
name: SIGMOID

input.name: X
input.description: The input value for which the sigmoid function is to be calculated.

output.name: SIGMOID
output.description: The output of the sigmoid function calculated based on the input value X.

return_value.description: The calculated sigmoid value based on the input X, returning 1.0, 0.0, or the computed value based on the sigmoid formula.

title: String Mirror Function
description: This function takes an input string and returns its mirrored version. The function processes the input string character by character from the end to the beginning, constructing a new string that is effectively the reverse of the input.
name: MIRROR

input.name: str
input.description: The input string that needs to be mirrored.

return_value.description: The mirrored version of the input string.

title: Hexadecimal to DWORD Converter
description: This function converts a hexadecimal string into a DWORD value. It processes each character in the input string, interpreting valid hexadecimal digits and appropriately converting them to their decimal representation. The function ignores invalid characters and can handle both upper and lower case hexadecimal representations.
name: HEX_TO_DWORD

input.name: Hex
input.description: A hexadecimal string input with a maximum length of 20 characters.

return_value.description: The DWORD value that results from converting the hexadecimal input string.

title: TMAX Function Block
description: The TMAX function block processes a boolean input signal and a time duration. It outputs a boolean signal that indicates the occurrence of an event based on the input signal and the elapsed time since the last input change. If the input signal remains TRUE for the specified duration, the output signal is set to FALSE and a secondary output signal is set to TRUE indicating that the event has occurred.
name: TMAX

input.name: IN
input.description: Input boolean signal that triggers the function block.

input.name: PT
input.description: Time duration that the input signal must be TRUE for in order to reset the output.

output.name: Q
output.description: Output signal that indicates whether the function block is active or not.

output.name: Z
output.description: Output signal that indicates that the timing condition has been satisfied, i.e., the input was TRUE for the specified duration.

title: Convert BYTE to STRING Representation
description: This function converts a BYTE input into its string representation, producing an 8-character string where each character corresponds to a bit from the BYTE. The resulting string is NULL-terminated.
name: BYTE_TO_STRB

input.name: IN
input.description: The BYTE value to be converted into a string.

return_value.description: The string representation of the byte input, consisting of 8 characters representing each bit.

title: AGDF Function Implementation
description: The AGDF function computes the natural logarithm of the ratio of (1.0 + SIN(X)) to COS(X). The function is intended for real input values of X, but its accuracy diminishes near X = PI/2.
name: AGDF

input.name: X
input.description: The input real value for which the AGDF function will compute the result.

output.name: AGDF
output.description: The output result of the AGDF function, which is the computed natural logarithm value.

return_value.description: The return value of the AGDF function is a REAL number representing the natural logarithm of the specified computation.

title: PT1 Differentiator Function Block
description: This function block implements a PT1 filter and a differentiator. The block takes an input value and processes it using a differentiator followed by a PT1 filter. The final output is a combination of the filtered value and scaled input.
name: FT_PDT1

input.name: IN
input.description: The input signal to be processed.

input.name: KP
input.description: The proportional gain factor, default value is 1.0.

input.name: TV
input.description: The time constant for the differentiator, default value is 1.0.

input.name: T1
input.description: The time constant for the PT1 filter, default value is 1.0.

output.name: Y
output.description: The output of the function block, which is the combined result of the processed input.

title: OSCAT_VERSION Function
description: This function returns a DWORD value representing the OSCAT version. The value returned is based on the input parameter; if the input is TRUE, it will return a date converted to DWORD (specifically the date July 16, 2024); otherwise, it returns the integer 335.
name: OSCAT_VERSION

input.name: IN
input.description: A boolean input parameter that determines which version number to return.

return_value.description: The DWORD value representing the OSCAT version based on the input parameter.

title: Convert BYTE to Range
description: This function converts a BYTE value into a specified range defined by low and high real numbers. It scales the BYTE value, which ranges from 0 to 255, to the specified range.
name: BYTE_TO_RANGE

input.name: X
input.description: The BYTE value to be converted, which should be in the range of 0 to 255.

input.name: low
input.description: The lower boundary of the desired range.

input.name: high
input.description: The upper boundary of the desired range.

return_value.description: The scaled value in the range defined by low and high based on the input BYTE value.

title: String to Weekday Conversion
description: This function converts a given string representing a weekday into its corresponding integer value (1 to 7) based on the language specified. If the input string does not match any weekday in the specified language, the function will return the integer value derived from the input string using STRING_TO_INT.
name: FSTRING_TO_WEEKDAY

input.name: WDAY
input.description: A string representation of the weekday to be converted.

input.name: LANG
input.description: An integer representing the language index to be used for weekday conversion. 0 refers to the default language.

return_value.description: An integer representing the corresponding weekday (1 to 7) if a match is found, otherwise the result of STRING_TO_INT on WDAY.

title: Convert Two Words to a DWORD
description: This function takes two 16-bit WORD values and combines them into a single 32-bit DWORD value by shifting the first WORD to the left by 16 bits, and then performing a bitwise OR with the second WORD.
name: DWORD_OF_WORD

input.name: W1
input.description: The first 16-bit WORD value to be converted and shifted.

input.name: W0
input.description: The second 16-bit WORD value to be combined with the first.

return_value.description: The resulting 32-bit DWORD value formed by combining W1 and W0.

title: ESR Monitor Block
description: This function block monitors the state of 8 boolean inputs and generates output data based on changes in these inputs. It checks for changes in each of the inputs and fills an output structure with relevant data, which includes the input's type, address, timestamp, and data value.
name: ESR_MON_B8

input.name: s0
input.description: Boolean input 0 for state monitoring.

input.name: s1
input.description: Boolean input 1 for state monitoring.

input.name: s2
input.description: Boolean input 2 for state monitoring.

input.name: s3
input.description: Boolean input 3 for state monitoring.

input.name: s4
input.description: Boolean input 4 for state monitoring.

input.name: s5
input.description: Boolean input 5 for state monitoring.

input.name: s6
input.description: Boolean input 6 for state monitoring.

input.name: s7
input.description: Boolean input 7 for state monitoring.

input.name: DT_in
input.description: Data time input to be associated with the monitored states.

input.name: a0
input.description: String address for input 0.

input.name: a1
input.description: String address for input 1.

input.name: a2
input.description: String address for input 2.

input.name: a3
input.description: String address for input 3.

input.name: a4
input.description: String address for input 4.

input.name: a5
input.description: String address for input 5.

input.name: a6
input.description: String address for input 6.

input.name: a7
input.description: String address for input 7.

output.name: ESR_Flag
output.description: Flag indicating if any input state has changed.

in/out.name: ESR_Out
in/out.description: Array of output data structures that hold information about the changes in the inputs.

title: Click Edge Detection and Counting Function Block
description: This function block detects rising edges on the input signal and counts the number of falling edges that follow. It activates specific output signals based on the count of detected edges for a single cycle only. The block resets the output signals when the input is false.
name: CLICK_DEC

input.name: IN
input.description: Boolean input signal that triggers edge detection.

input.name: TC
input.description: Time constant used for timing operations within the block.

output.name: Q0
output.description: Output signal activated when the count is zero.

output.name: Q1
output.description: Output signal activated when the count is one.

output.name: Q2
output.description: Output signal activated when the count is two.

output.name: Q3
output.description: Output signal activated when the count is three.

title: Find Character in String
description: This function aims to find the index of the first character in a given string that meets specific criteria, starting from a specified position. It returns the index of the character if found, or 0 if no such character exists.
name: FIND_CHAR

input.name: str
input.description: The string in which to search for the character.

input.name: pos
input.description: The starting position in the string from which to begin the search.

return_value.description: The index of the found character if it meets the criteria; otherwise, 0.

title: Trend Detection Function Block
description: The TREND_DW function block monitors a DWORD input value 'X' and detects trends in its changes. It outputs boolean signals indicating whether there is an upward or downward trend, along with the difference in value from the last input. The function block also produces a boolean output 'Q' indicating a change has occurred.
name: TREND_DW

input.name: X
input.description: The input value to be monitored for trend detection.

output.name: Q
output.description: Indicates whether the input value 'X' has changed.

output.name: TU
output.description: True if an upward trend is detected (X has increased).

output.name: TD
output.description: True if a downward trend is detected (X has decreased).

output.name: D
output.description: The difference in value between the current and last input value.

title: PID Controller Function Block
description: This function block implements a Proportional-Integral-Derivative (PID) controller, processing input setpoint and actual value to generate a control output, while managing manual control and reset functions.
name: CTRL_PI

input.name: ACT
input.description: The actual value to be used in the PID control.

input.name: SET
input.description: The desired setpoint value for the PID control.

input.name: SUP
input.description: The reference value for supervision purposes.

input.name: OFS
input.description: Offset value to adjust the output signal.

input.name: M_I
input.description: Manual input value for the controller.

input.name: MAN
input.description: Manual mode switch; if true, the controller uses manual input.

input.name: RST
input.description: Reset signal to reset the controller operation.

input.name: KP
input.description: Proportional gain factor for the PID controller.

input.name: KI
input.description: Integral gain factor for the PID controller.

input.name: LL
input.description: Lower limit for the output value.

input.name: LH
input.description: Upper limit for the output value.

output.name: Y
output.description: The output value generated by the PID controller.

output.name: DIFF
output.description: The difference between the setpoint and actual value.

output.name: LIM
output.description: Flag indicating whether the output is within the limits.

title: Convert Byte to Uppercase
description: This function takes a BYTE input and converts it to its uppercase equivalent if applicable. It checks if the input is a lowercase letter in the standard ASCII range or an extended ASCII letter, and returns the corresponding uppercase letter. If the input does not fall within these criteria, it returns the input as is.
name: TO_UPPER

input.name: IN
input.description: The BYTE value to be converted to uppercase.

output.name: TO_UPPER
output.description: The uppercase equivalent of the input BYTE, or the original input if no conversion is applicable.

return_value.description: The result of the uppercase conversion for the input BYTE.

title: Mixing Two Real Values
description: This function takes two real values and a mixing factor and returns a mixed value based on the specified factor. The mixing is done by taking a weighted sum of the two input values, where the weight is determined by the mixing factor M.
name: MIX

input.name: A
input.description: The first real value to be mixed.

input.name: B
input.description: The second real value to be mixed.

input.name: M
input.description: The mixing factor, which determines the weight of each input value in the final result.

return_value.description: The result of the mixing operation, calculated as (1.0 - M) * A + M * B.

title: Convert DWORD to String
description: This function converts a DWORD input into a string representation consisting of 32 binary characters. Each bit of the DWORD is converted to its corresponding binary character ('0' or '1') and the resulting string is null-terminated.
name: DWORD_TO_STRB

input.name: IN
input.description: The input DWORD value that needs to be converted to a string.

output.name: DWORD_TO_STRB
output.description: The output string representation of the input DWORD value, containing binary characters.

return_value.description: The resulting binary string derived from the input DWORD.

title: Fahrenheit to Celsius Conversion
description: This function converts a temperature value from Fahrenheit to Celsius. It accepts a temperature in Fahrenheit as input and returns the corresponding temperature in Celsius.
name: F_TO_C

input.name: fahrenheit
input.description: The temperature value in Fahrenheit that needs to be converted to Celsius.

return_value.description: The converted temperature value in Celsius.

title: Hysteresis Control Logic
description: This FUNCTION_BLOCK implements a hysteresis control mechanism. The function determines output states based on an input value, a reference value with hysteresis, and the threshold for the hysteresis effect. The output indicates whether the input is within the hysteresis bounds and whether the condition is active.
name: HYST_2

input.name: IN
input.description: The input value to be evaluated against the hysteresis conditions.

input.name: VAL
input.description: The reference value from which hysteresis is calculated.

input.name: HYS
input.description: The amount of hysteresis used to determine the output states.

output.name: Q
output.description: The boolean output indicating if the input is above the upper hysteresis threshold.

output.name: WIN
output.description: The boolean output indicating if the input is within the hysteresis window.

title: Decimal String to Integer Conversion
description: This function takes a decimal string input and converts it to an integer. The function handles both positive and negative numbers based on the presence of the negative sign in the string. It processes each character of the string, converting it to its corresponding integer value and accumulating the result.
name: DEC_TO_INT

input.name: DEC
input.description: The input decimal string to be converted to an integer.

return_value.description: The integer value resulting from the conversion of the input decimal string.

title: Analog Input Processing
description: This function block processes an analog input value by interpreting various bits for error and overflow conditions, and converting the input value to a real output while considering the sign bit.
name: AIN1

input.description: The input value that needs to be processed.

input.name: sign_bit
input.description: The position of the sign bit in the input value, defaulting to 255.

input.name: error_bit
input.description: The position of the error bit in the input value, defaulting to 255.

input.name: error_code_en
input.description: A boolean flag enabling error code checking.

input.name: error_code
input.description: The error code to compare against the input value.

input.name: overflow_bit
input.description: The position of the overflow bit in the input value, defaulting to 255.

input.name: overflow_code_en
input.description: A boolean flag enabling overflow code checking.

input.name: overflow_code
input.description: The overflow code to compare against the input value.

input.name: Bit_0
input.description: The starting bit position for the processing.

input.name: Bit_N
input.description: The maximum bit position for processing, defaulting to 31.

input.name: out_min
input.description: The minimum output value after conversion.

input.name: out_max
input.description: The maximum output value after conversion, defaulting to 10.0.

input.name: code_min
input.description: The minimum allowable code value for valid input.

input.name: code_max
input.description: The maximum allowable code value for valid input, defaulting to 16#FFFFFFFF.

input.name: error_output
input.description: Output value when an error condition is detected.

input.name: overflow_output
input.description: Output value when an overflow condition is detected, defaulting to 10.0.

output.name: out
output.description: The processed output value after conversion.

output.name: sign
output.description: Indicator of the sign of the output value.

output.name: error
output.description: Flag indicating whether an error condition was detected.

output.name: overflow
output.description: Flag indicating whether an overflow condition was detected.

title: Find Position of Substring
description: This function, FINDP, searches for the position of a specified substring (src) within a given string (str), starting the search from a defined position (pos). If the substring is found, its position is returned; otherwise, the function returns 0.
name: FINDP

input.name: str
input.description: The string in which to search for the substring.

input.name: src
input.description: The substring that is being searched for in the main string.

input.name: pos
input.description: The position from which to start searching in the main string.

return_value.description: The position of the first occurrence of the substring; returns 0 if the substring is not found.

title: Scheduler Function Block
description: This function block schedules output signals based on input events and specified time intervals. The block monitors time elapsed since specific events represented by E0, E1, E2, and E3, and activates corresponding outputs Q0, Q1, Q2, and Q3 when the specified time conditions are met.
name: SCHEDULER

input.name: E0
input.description: Input event signal for output Q0.

input.name: E1
input.description: Input event signal for output Q1.

input.name: E2
input.description: Input event signal for output Q2.

input.name: E3
input.description: Input event signal for output Q3.

input.name: T0

description: The SHR_8PLE function block implements an 8-bit shift register that can shift the bits either up or down based on the UP input. It allows for loading a new byte value when the load signal is active and resets the register when the reset signal is received.

title: Convert WORD to Range
description: This function takes a WORD input and maps it to a specified range defined by the low and high REAL values. The output is a REAL number that scales the input based on the given range.

description: This function converts a value from BFT (an integer value) to MS (a real value) using the equation MS = BFT^1.5 * 0.836. The function accepts an integer input representing the BFT value and returns a real number representing the corresponding MS value.

description: This function calculates the period time based on a given frequency. description: This function converts a given integer input into a BCD (Binary-Coded Decimal) representation. The function takes an integer input, divides it by 10 to extract the higher nibble and uses the remainder to extract the lower nibble, ultimately combining both to produce a BCD byte output.

title: Astronomical Units Conversion
description: This function block performs conversions between different astronomical distance units including meters, astronomical units (AE), parsecs (PC), and light years (LJ). It takes input parameters related to these distances and calculates their corresponding values in meters as output.

title: Leap Year Calculation
description: This function determines whether a given date falls in a leap year. A leap year is defined as the year that is divisible by 4, but not every year divisible by 100 is a leap year unless it is also divisible by 400. The function accepts a date as input and returns a boolean value indicating if that date is in a leap year.

input.description: The date to check for leap year status.

return_value.description: True if the year of the given date is a leap year, otherwise false.
