title: Hyperbolic Arcsine Calculation
description: This function calculates the hyperbolic arcsine of a given real number using the formula LN(SQRT(X * X + 1.0) + X). The input parameter X is of type REAL, and the function returns a value of type REAL representing the hyperbolic arcsine of X. The function has undergone several revisions to enhance performance and ensure accuracy with real constants.
name: ASINH

input.name: X
input.description: A real number input for which the hyperbolic arcsine is to be calculated.

return_value.description: The computed hyperbolic arcsine of the input value X.

title: Cosh Function
description: This function computes the hyperbolic cosine of a given real number input. It utilizes the mathematical relationship between the hyperbolic cosine and the exponential function to perform the calculation efficiently.
name: COSH

input.name: X
input.description: The input value for which the hyperbolic cosine is to be calculated.

return_value.description: The hyperbolic cosine of the input value X, computed as (1.0 / T + T) * 0.5 where T is equal to EXP(X).

title: Mid Value Calculation
description: This function calculates the mid value among three given input real numbers. It compares the three inputs and determines the second largest value. If the first input is greater than the second, it swaps their values. It also checks if the second input is greater than the third and updates it accordingly.
name: MID3

input.name: IN1
input.description: The first input real number.

input.name: IN2
input.description: The second input real number.

input.name: IN3
input.description: The third input real number.

output.name: MID3
output.description: The calculated mid value, which is the second largest of the three input numbers.

return_value.description: The return value represents the mid value of the three inputs.

title: Absolute Value Function for REAL2
description: This function computes the absolute value of a given REAL2 input. The function checks the value of the RX component of the input REAL2 structure and returns its absolute value along with the absolute value of the R1 component. If the RX value is non-negative, it returns the input values as is. If it is negative, it negates both components.
name: R2_ABS

input.name: X
input.description: Input parameter of type REAL2 containing the values to compute the absolute value from.

return_value.description: The output result of type REAL2 that holds the absolute values of the input's components.

fields.name: RX
fields.description: The absolute value of the RX component of the input REAL2.

fields.name: R1
fields.description: The absolute value of the R1 component of the input REAL2.

title: Leap Year Determination Function
description: This function determines whether a given year is a leap year or not. A leap year is defined as any year that is divisible by 4, except for end-of-century years, which must be divisible by 400. The function leverages bit manipulation for performance improvements in version 1.2.
name: LEAP_YEAR

input.name: yr
input.description: The year for which the leap year status is to be determined.

output.name: LEAP_YEAR
output.description: Returns TRUE if the year is a leap year, FALSE otherwise.

return_value.description: Indicates whether the year is a leap year.

title: Convert Real to DWORD
description: This function takes a real number as input and converts it to a DWORD format. It utilizes a pointer to access the memory address of the input real value and subsequently retrieves the DWORD representation from that address.
name: REAL_TO_DW

input.name: X
input.description: Input variable of type REAL that needs to be converted to DWORD.

output.name: REAL_TO_DW
output.description: The DWORD representation of the input REAL value.

return_value.description: The result of the conversion from REAL to DWORD.

title: B_TRIG Function Block
description: The B_TRIG function block generates a triggered output based on the rising edge of the input clock signal. Whenever a transition occurs on the input clock, the output variable is toggled.
name: B_TRIG

input.name: CLK
input.description: Input variable that represents the clock signal.

output.name: Q
output.description: Output variable that reflects the state triggered by the input clock signal.

title: Gauss cumulative distribution function
description: This function calculates the cumulative distribution function (CDF) of the Gaussian distribution based on the input parameters. It uses the error function to compute the value and returns a real number representing the CDF for the provided inputs.
name: GAUSSCD

input.name: X
input.description: The value at which to evaluate the cumulative distribution function.

input.name: U
input.description: The mean value of the Gaussian distribution.

input.name: SI
input.description: The standard deviation of the Gaussian distribution.

return_value.description: The cumulative probability for the Gaussian distribution at the given value X.

title: Find Non-Numeric Character
description: This function searches for the first non-numeric character in a given string, starting from a specified position. It returns the index of the first non-numeric character found or 0 if all characters from the specified position are numeric.
name: FIND_NONUM

input.name: str
input.description: The input string to be searched for non-numeric characters.

input.name: pos
input.description: The position in the string from which to start the search.

return_value.description: The index of the first non-numeric character found in the string, or 0 if there are no non-numeric characters.

title: Float to Real Conversion Function
description: This function converts a string representation of a floating-point number into its real number equivalent. It handles the detection of sign, digits, and optional exponent in the input string.
name: FLOAT_TO_REAL

input.name: FLT
input.description: The string input representing a floating-point number to be converted.

return_value.description: The converted real number value from the input string.

title: Conversion from SDT to TOD
description: This function converts a time represented in the SDT (Structured Date Time) format to the TOD (Time of Day) format. It takes the HOUR, MINUTE, SECOND, and MS (milliseconds) from the SDT structure, performs necessary conversions and calculations, and returns the total time in milliseconds as a DWORD value.
name: SDT_TO_TOD

input.name: DTI
input.description: The input parameter of type SDT that contains the hours, minutes, seconds, and milliseconds to be converted.

return_value.description: The converted time of day in milliseconds as a DWORD.

title: First-Order Proportional-Derivative Controller
description: This function block implements a first-order proportional-derivative (PD) controller. It takes an input signal and applies proportional gain and differentiator characteristics to produce an output signal. The user can configure the proportional gain (KP) and the time constant for the derivative (TV). The output of the controller (Y) is calculated based on the difference of the input signal and the proportional gain.
name: FT_PD

input.name: IN
input.description: The input signal to be controlled.

input.name: KP
input.description: The proportional gain constant, default value is 1.0.

input.name: TV
input.description: The time constant for the derivative action, default value is 1.0.

output.name: Y
output.description: The output of the PD controller based on the input signal and its derivative.

title: Hexadecimal to Byte Conversion
description: This function converts a hexadecimal string (up to 5 characters) into its corresponding byte value. The input hexadecimal string can consist of digits (0-9) and letters (A-F, a-f). The function reads each character of the input string, calculates its decimal value based on its position, and accumulates the result into a single byte output.
name: HEX_TO_BYTE

input.name: HEX
input.description: A string representing the hexadecimal value to be converted to a byte.

output.name: HEX_TO_BYTE
output.description: The resulting byte value obtained from the conversion of the hexadecimal string.

return_value.description: The output byte value derived from the hexadecimal input string.

title: Fade Function Block
description: This function block implements a fade effect based on input parameters. It takes two input values and uses a ramp module to generate a fading output based on a boolean trigger, a time parameter, and reset signal.
name: FADE

input.name: IN1
input.description: The starting value for the fade effect.

input.name: IN2
input.description: The target value for the fade effect.

input.name: F
input.description: A boolean flag that indicates whether the fade operation should be active.

input.name: TF
input.description: The duration of the fade effect.

input.name: rst
input.description: A reset signal that initializes the ramp module and stops the fade effect.

output.name: Y
output.description: The output value after applying the fade effect between IN1 and IN2.

title: Decimal Rounding Function
description: This function rounds a given real number to a specified number of decimal places using pre-defined constants for decimal scaling. The function takes a real number and an integer specifying the number of decimal places, applies the rounding logic, and returns the rounded value. This implementation ensures robust handling of negative numbers and optimal performance.
name: ROUND

input.name: in
input.description: The real number to be rounded.

input.name: N
input.description: The number of decimal places to round to, limited between 0 and 8.

output.name: ROUND
output.description: The rounded real number.

return_value.description: The result of the rounding operation.

title: Pulse Width Modulation Control
description: This function block implements pulse width modulation (PWM) based on frequency and pulse width time inputs. It generates a PWM signal output that can be used to control various devices.
name: PWM_PW

input.name: F
input.description: The frequency of the PWM signal in Hertz.

input.name: PW
input.description: The duration of the pulse width.

output.name: Q
output.description: The output Boolean signal representing the PWM signal.

title: Calculate Days Delta
description: This function calculates the difference in days between two date values, returning a positive or negative integer depending on the order of the dates. If date_1 is later than date_2, the result will be negative, otherwise it will be positive.
name: DAYS_DELTA

input.name: date_1
input.description: The first date for comparison.

input.name: date_2
input.description: The second date for comparison.

return_value.description: The difference in days between date_1 and date_2.

title: Calculate the Absolute Value of a Complex Number
description: This function calculates the absolute value (or modulus) of a complex number represented in rectangular form. The function takes a complex number as input and returns its absolute value as a real number.
name: CABS

input.name: X
input.description: A complex number whose absolute value is to be calculated.

return_value.description: The absolute value of the complex number X.

title: Calculate Angle in 3D Space
description: This function calculates the angle in 3D space based on a given 3D vector. It computes the angle using the X component of the vector and its magnitude. If the magnitude is greater than zero, it uses the arccosine function to determine the angle.
name: V3_XANG

input.name: A
input.description: A 3D vector from which the angle is to be calculated.

fields.name: X
fields.description: The X component of the vector.

fields.name: Y
fields.description: The Y component of the vector.

fields.name: Z
fields.description: The Z component of the vector.

return_value.description: The angle in radians calculated from the 3D vector.

title: Cauchy Distribution Calculation
description: This function calculates the Cauchy distribution value based on the provided input parameters. The calculation uses the formula: 0.5 + (/2) * arctan((X - T) / U), where X, T, and U are real numbers representing the specific values for the calculation.
name: CAUCHYCD

input.name: X
input.description: A real number representing the first parameter of the Cauchy distribution.

input.name: T
input.description: A real number representing the second parameter of the Cauchy distribution.

input.name: U
input.description: A real number representing the scale parameter of the Cauchy distribution.

return_value.description: The calculated value of the Cauchy distribution based on the inputs X, T, and U.

title: Compute Inverse Hyperbolic Cosine of a Complex Number
description: This function calculates the inverse hyperbolic cosine (CACOSH) of a given complex number. The input is a complex number, and the output is also a complex number representing the result of the calculation.
name: CACOSH

input.name: X
input.description: Input variable representing a complex number for which the inverse hyperbolic cosine will be calculated.

output.name: CACOSH
output.description: The result of the inverse hyperbolic cosine of the input complex number.

return_value.description: Returns the complex result of the inverse hyperbolic cosine function.

title: Calculate Days in Month
description: This function calculates the number of days in a given month based on a specific date, considering if the year is a leap year or not.
name: DAYS_IN_MONTH

input.name: IDATE
input.description: The input date for which the number of days in the month needs to be calculated.

return_value.description: The number of days in the month corresponding to the provided date.

title: Control Output Function Block
description: This function block controls an output value based on various input parameters, applying an offset and considering manual input if specified. The output is conditioned within defined limits, and a flag indicates whether the output is within these limits.
name: CTRL_OUT

input.name: CI
input.description: Input signal value used for output calculation.

input.name: OFFSET
input.description: Value to be added to the output signal.

input.name: MAN_IN
input.description: Manual input value to be used if manual mode is activated.

input.name: LIM_L
input.description: Lower limit for the output signal.

input.name: LIM_H
input.description: Upper limit for the output signal.

input.name: MANUAL
input.description: Flag to indicate whether to use manual input.

output.name: Y
output.description: The calculated output value after applying offset and limits.

output.name: LIM
output.description: Flag indicating if the output is within the defined limits.

title: Sequence Control Block
description: This function block manages a sequential process based on input signals. It initializes a state sequence controlled by a start signal, a reset signal, and an array of timing intervals. The block updates its internal state and triggers an output signal based on the defined program.
name: SEQUENCE_64

input.name: START
input.description: A boolean signal to start the sequence.

input.name: SMAX
input.description: The maximum state index for the sequence.

input.name: PROG
input.description: An array containing timing intervals for each state in the sequence.

input.name: RST
input.description: A boolean signal to reset the sequence state.

output.name: STATE
output.description: The current state of the sequence, initialized to -1.

output.name: TRIG
output.description: A trigger signal that indicates when a state transition has occurred.

title: Ramp Function Block (RMP_B)
description: This function block implements a ramp functionality, allowing for an adjustable output based on set conditions, timing, and the direction of ramping. It generates an output value that ramps up or down based on input parameters and maintains the state of the busy flag to indicate processing status.
name: RMP_B

input.name: SET
input.description: A boolean indicating if the ramp should be set to its maximum value.

input.name: PT
input.description: The time duration over which the ramp should occur.

input.name: E

input.name: UP
input.description: A boolean that determines the direction of the ramp; if TRUE, the ramp will increase, if FALSE, it will decrease.

input.name: RST
input.description: A boolean that, when set, resets the output value to zero.

output.name: OUT
output.description: The current value of the ramp output.

output.description: Indicates if the function block is currently busy processing the ramp operation.

output.name: HIGH
output.description: Indicates if the output is currently at its maximum value (255).

output.name: LOW
output.description: Indicates if the output is currently at its minimum value (0).

title: FindB Function
description: This function is designed to find the last occurrence of the substring 'str2' within the string 'str1'. It returns the position of the found substring from the end of 'str1'. If 'str2' is not found, the function returns 0.
name: FindB

input.name: str1
input.description: The main string in which the search for the substring will be conducted.

input.name: str2
input.description: The substring that is being searched for in 'str1'.

return_value.description: The position of the last occurrence of 'str2' in 'str1'. Returns 0 if 'str2' is not found.

title: Determine Daylight Saving Time
description: This function calculates whether the given UTC date and time falls within the period of Daylight Saving Time (DST) in Europe. It specifically checks if the provided date corresponds to the period when clocks are set forward in March and when they are set back in October. The function utilizes specific equations based on the year to determine the transition dates for DST.
name: DST

input.name: UTC
input.description: The date and time in UTC format that needs to be evaluated for Daylight Saving Time.

output.name: DST
output.description: Returns TRUE if the given UTC date and time is within the Daylight Saving Time period, otherwise FALSE.

return_value.description: Indicates whether the input date is within Daylight Saving Time.

title: FF_D4E Function Block
description: This function block implements a flip-flop behavior, setting output boolean values Q0 to Q3 based on the corresponding input boolean values D0 to D3 when a clock signal (CLK) is received, and resetting all outputs to FALSE when the reset signal (RST) is activated.

input.name: D3
input.description: Input boolean signal that sets output Q3.

input.description: Clock signal that triggers the setting of outputs.

input.description: Reset signal that clears all outputs.

output.name: Q1

output.name: Q2
output.description: Output boolean signal representing the state set by D2.

output.name: Q3
output.description: Output boolean signal representing the state set by D3.

title: Calculate Angle from Vector
description: This function calculates the angle of a 3D vector in relation to its Y component, returning the angle in radians. It takes a vector input and processes it to determine the angle only if the vector's magnitude is greater than zero.
name: V3_YANG

input.name: A
input.description: A 3-dimensional vector for which the angle will be calculated.

return_value.description: The computed angle in radians based on the Y component of the vector.

title: Convert Minutes to Time
description: This function converts a given input in minutes to a corresponding time format. The input is multiplied by 60000 to convert minutes to milliseconds and then converted to the TIME datatype.
name: MINUTE_TO_TIME

input.name: IN
input.description: The input parameter representing the time in minutes to be converted.

output.name: MINUTE_TO_TIME
output.description: The output time value calculated from the input minutes.

return_value.description: The resulting time value after conversion from minutes.

title: Complex Cosine Function
description: The CCOS function calculates the cosine of a complex number using the hyperbolic cosine function. It takes a complex number as input and returns its cosine value as a complex number.
name: CCOS

input.name: X
input.description: A complex number for which the cosine is to be calculated.

output.name: CCOS
output.description: The cosine of the input complex number.

return_value.description: The result of the cosine calculation.

description: This function receives four input values and two boolean selection inputs to determine which input value to output. The selection of input values is based on the boolean values provided. If the first boolean (A1) is true, the function selects between IN2 and IN3 using A0; otherwise, it selects between IN0 and IN1.

input.description: The third input value.

input.description: The fourth input value.

input.description: The second boolean selection input.

output.name: MUX_R4
output.description: The output value selected based on the input and selection parameters.

return_value.description: The selected output value based on the multiplexer logic.

title: IS_ALPHA Function
description: This function checks if all characters in the given string are alphabetic. It returns TRUE if the string contains only alphabet characters and FALSE otherwise. The function also ensures that the string is not empty.
name: IS_ALPHA

input.name: str
input.description: The input string to be checked for alphabetic characters. It is defined with a specified maximum length.

output.name: IS_ALPHA
output.description: A boolean value indicating whether the string consists solely of alphabetic characters.

return_value.description: The return value of the function, indicating the result of the alphabet check.

title: SRAMP Function Block
description: The SRAMP function block is designed to perform a ramping operation based on the input value 'X'. It controls the output 'Y' to reach the target value 'X' gradually, using specified acceleration and deceleration rates while respecting specified limits.
name: SRAMP

input.description: The target value that the output 'Y' should reach.

input.description: The deceleration rate when ramping down away from the target value.

input.name: VU_MAX
input.description: The maximum speed limit when ramping up.

input.name: VD_MAX
input.description: The maximum speed limit when ramping down.

input.name: LIMIT_HIGH
input.description: The upper limit for the output 'Y'.

input.name: LIMIT_LOW
input.description: The lower limit for the output 'Y'.

input.name: RST
input.description: A boolean reset signal. If true, it resets the internal states.

output.name: Y
output.description: The current output value of the function block, which is ramped towards 'X'.

output.name: V
output.description: The current speed of the ramping operation, determining how quickly 'Y' approaches 'X'.

title: Mathematical Expression Evaluator
description: This function parses a mathematical expression provided as a string, extracts numbers and an operator, performs the corresponding mathematical operation, and returns the result as a string. It handles various mathematical operations such as addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division while ensuring proper formatting of the return value.
name: EXEC

input.name: str
input.description: The input string representing the mathematical expression to be evaluated.

output.name: EXEC
output.description: The result of the evaluated mathematical expression as a string.

return_value.description: The result or error message returned after evaluating the expression.

title: Calculate Ellipse Circumference
description: This function computes the circumference of an ellipse given its semi-major axis (R1) and semi-minor axis (R2). The formula used is derived from Ramanujan's approximation for the circumference of an ellipse.
name: ELLIPSE_C

input.name: R1
input.description: The length of the semi-major axis of the ellipse.

input.name: R2
input.description: The length of the semi-minor axis of the ellipse.

return_value.description: The computed circumference of the ellipse.

title: Speed Conversion Function Block
description: This function block performs conversions between various speed units: meters per second (m/s), kilometers per hour (km/h), knots (kn), and miles per hour (mh). The function block takes input values in each of these units and calculates their equivalent values.

title: Exponential Function Base 10 Calculation
description: This function computes the base 10 exponential of a given real number input X. It leverages the natural exponential function by converting the base 10 exponent into a natural logarithm calculation.

input.description: A real number input for which the base 10 exponential is to be calculated.

return_value.description: The output is the result of the base 10 exponential function for the input X.

title: Integral Function Block
description: This function block implements an integration functionality with inputs for real numbers, control signals, and output limits. The block integrates the input value over time and maintains the output within specified limits.
name: FT_INT2

input.name: IN
input.description: The real input value to be integrated.

output.description: The result of the integration process.

description: This function block implements a latch that holds a boolean state based on input conditions. The latch remains transparent while the L input is TRUE, allowing the D input value to be transferred to the output Q. An asynchronous reset input (RST) forces the output Q to FALSE regardless of the inputs.
name: LTCH

input.description: The asynchronous reset input that forces the output Q to FALSE.

output.name: Q
output.description: The output of the latch that reflects the state based on the inputs D and L.

title: Binary to DWORD Conversion
description: This function takes a binary string as input and converts it to a DWORD (32-bit unsigned integer) value. The function reads each character of the binary string, interpreting '0' as a zero bit and '1' as a one bit, and constructs the DWORD value accordingly.
name: BIN_TO_DWORD

input.name: BIN
input.description: A binary string of length up to 40 characters, consisting of '0's and '1's, representing the binary number to be converted.

return_value.description: The resulting DWORD value obtained from the binary string conversion.

title: Timed Pulse Generator
description: This function block generates a pulse output based on an input signal with a specified time duration. It provides a true output for the duration defined by the time parameter PT when a rising edge is detected on the input signal IN. After the duration elapses, the output is set to false.

title: Timing Function Block

input.description: A boolean input that, when true, starts the timing measurement.

input.description: A boolean input to reset the elapsed time measurements.

output.name: PT
output.description: The previous time value recorded before the reset or input changes.

output.name: ET
output.description: The elapsed time measured from the rising edge of the input signal.

title: Buffer Search Function
description: The BUFFER_SEARCH function is designed to search for a specified string within a buffer of data, returning the position of the substring if found. description: This function inserts a specified string into a buffer at a given position, shifting existing data to create space. It returns the next position after the inserted string.

input.description: The string to be inserted into the buffer.

input.name: POS

input.name: PT
input.description: A pointer to the buffer array where the string will be inserted.

input.name: SIZE
input.description: The size of the buffer.

return_value.description: The next position in the buffer after the inserted string.

input.name: low

input.name: high

output.name: Aout
output.description: The calculated 32-bit output value based on the processed input.

return_value.description: The final computed output value.

title: Check if a String is Alphanumeric
description: This function checks whether a given string is alphanumeric, meaning it contains only letters and numbers. If the string is empty or contains any non-alphanumeric characters, the function returns false; otherwise, it returns true.
name: IS_ALNUM

input.name: str
input.description: The input string to be checked for alphanumeric characters.

return_value.description: Returns true if the string is alphanumeric and not empty; otherwise returns false.

title: Extract Byte from String at Position
description: This function extracts a single byte from a provided string at a specified position. The position must be within the valid range of the string, or a default value of 0 will be returned indicating an invalid operation.
name: ExtractByteFromString

input.name: STR
input.description: The input string from which the byte will be extracted.

input.name: POS
input.description: The position in the string from which to extract the byte. Must be between 1 and the length of the string.

output.name: CODE
output.description: The byte extracted from the string at the specified position, or 0 if the position is invalid.

return_value.description: Returns the byte extracted from the string at the specified position, or 0 if the position is out of bounds.

title: GEN_SQR Function Block
description: This function block generates a square wave signal based on the input parameters. It uses duty cycle (DC), amplitude (AM), and offset (OS) to determine the output signal. The block takes time parameters to control the frequency and timing of the generated signal.
name: GEN_SQR

input.name: PT
input.description: The period time for the square wave generation.

input.name: AM
input.description: The amplitude of the output signal. Default is 1.0.

input.name: OS
input.description: The offset value added to the output signal.

input.name: DC
input.description: The duty cycle of the square wave. Default is 0.5.

input.name: DL
input.description: The dead time. This is used to control the timing of the edges in the output signal.

output.name: Q
output.description: A boolean output indicating the current state of the square wave signal.

output.name: Out
output.description: The generated output value of the square wave signal.

title: Bar Graph Function Block
description: The BAR_GRAPH function block processes input data to generate a bar graph representation based on specified trigger thresholds, alarm conditions, and scaling options. It outputs the status of various graphic elements indicating levels and alarms based on the input value.
name: BAR_GRAPH

input.name: X
input.description: The current value to be evaluated against the trigger thresholds.

input.name: rst
input.description: Reset signal to clear alarms and output states.

input.name: trigger_Low
input.description: The lower threshold for triggering the alarm and bar graph outputs.

input.name: trigger_High
input.description: The upper threshold for triggering the alarm and bar graph outputs.

input.name: Alarm_low
input.description: Indicates if a low alarm is enabled.

input.name: Alarm_high
input.description: Indicates if a high alarm is enabled.

input.name: log_scale
input.description: Indicates if a logarithmic scale should be applied to the graph representation.

output.name: LOW
output.description: Indicates if the value is below the low trigger threshold.

output.name: Q1
output.description: Status of the first bar in the graph.

output.name: Q2
output.description: Status of the second bar in the graph.

output.name: Q3
output.description: Status of the third bar in the graph.

output.name: Q4
output.description: Status of the fourth bar in the graph.

output.name: Q5
output.description: Status of the fifth bar in the graph.

output.name: Q6
output.description: Status of the sixth bar in the graph.

output.name: HIGH
output.description: Indicates if the value is above the high trigger threshold.

output.name: Alarm
output.description: Indicates if any alarm condition has been triggered.

output.name: Status
output.description: Current status code indicating the state of the evaluation.

title: Leap Year Day Check
description: This function checks whether a given date falls on a leap day (February 29th) by converting the date to its corresponding unsigned integer representation and using modular arithmetic.
name: LEAP_DAY

input.name: IDATE
input.description: The date to be checked for leap day.

output.name: LEAP_DAY
output.description: A boolean value indicating whether the input date is a leap day.

return_value.description: Returns true if the date is February 29th, otherwise false.

title: JD2000 Function
description: The JD2000 function converts a given TIME input to a Julian Date format by calculating the number of days since the Julian epoch, which starts on January 1, 2000. The function takes a TIME input representing the date and time, converts it to DWORD, calculates the offset from the Julian epoch, and finally returns the result as a REAL number representing the Julian Date.
name: JD2000

input.name: DTI
input.description: The input time value to be converted to Julian Date format.

return_value.description: The computed Julian Date corresponding to the input TIME value.

title: Filter Function Block
description: This FUNCTION_BLOCK implements a filtering mechanism that processes an integer input (X) and a time duration (T) to produce a filtered output (Y). The block initializes on startup and updates its internal state based on the system time and input value for enhanced filtering accuracy.
name: FILTER_I

input.name: X
input.description: An integer input value to be filtered.

input.name: T
input.description: A time duration used to control the filtering process.

output.name: Y
output.description: The filtered output value computed from the input.

title: Complex Hyperbolic Cotangent Function
description: This function computes the hyperbolic cotangent (CATANH) of a complex number. It takes a complex input and returns the complex result of the hyperbolic cotangent operation applied to that input. The algorithm utilizes the natural logarithm and arctangent functions to derive the real and imaginary parts of the result.
name: CATANH

input.name: X
input.description: A complex number for which the hyperbolic cotangent is to be calculated.

return_value.description: The result of the hyperbolic cotangent operation, returned as a complex number.

fields.name: re
fields.description: The real part of the hyperbolic cotangent result.

fields.name: im
fields.description: The imaginary part of the hyperbolic cotangent result.

title: Character to String Conversion
description: This function converts a single BYTE character input into a string. The function takes a BYTE value and stores it as the first character of a string, ensuring that the string is properly null-terminated.
name: CHR_TO_STRING

input.name: C
input.description: The byte value representing a character that needs to be converted to a string.

return_value.description: Returns the string representation of the input character, properly null-terminated.

title: String to Byte Conversion
description: This function converts a string representation of a number to a byte value. The string can represent the number in various formats including binary, octal, hexadecimal, or decimal. The function identifies the format based on specific prefixes ('2#' for binary, '8#' for octal, '16#' for hexadecimal) and processes the string accordingly.
name: FSTRING_TO_BYTE

input.name: IN
input.description: A string representation of a number, which can be in binary, octal, hexadecimal, or decimal format.

output.name: FSTRING_TO_BYTE
output.description: The byte value converted from the input string representation.

return_value.description: The byte result of the conversion based on the provided input string.

title: PWM_DC Function Block
description: This function block generates a pulse width modulation (PWM) signal based on a defined frequency (F) and duty cycle (DC). It calculates the time period for a given frequency and uses it to configure and control a clock signal, which is then used to create a pulse signal. The output signal indicates the state of the pulse.
name: PWM_DC

input.name: F
input.description: The frequency of the PWM signal in Hz.

input.name: DC
input.description: The duty cycle of the PWM signal, specified as a fraction (0.0 to 1.0).

output.name: Q
output.description: The output state of the PWM signal, where TRUE indicates the pulse is active.

title: Set Date and Time
description: This function sets the date and time based on the provided year, month, day, hour, minute, and second inputs. It converts the provided parameters into a DWORD format for proper date and time representation.
name: SET_DT

input.name: year
input.description: The year to be set.

input.name: month
input.description: The month to be set, ranging from 1 to 12.

input.name: day
input.description: The day of the month to be set.

input.name: hour
input.description: The hour of the day to be set, ranging from 0 to 23.

input.name: minute
input.description: The minute of the hour to be set, ranging from 0 to 59.

input.name: second
input.description: The second of the minute to be set, ranging from 0 to 59.

return_value.description: The date and time represented as a DWORD.

title: Clock Divider Function Block
description: This function block implements a clock divider that generates multiple output signals based on a clock input signal. It also includes a reset feature that initializes the outputs and the internal counter.
name: CLK_DIV

input.name: clk
input.description: The clock input signal used to increment the counter.

input.name: rst
input.description: The reset input signal that initializes the counter and output states.

output.name: Q0
output.description: The first output bit representing the least significant bit of the counter.

output.name: Q1
output.description: The second output bit of the counter.

output.name: Q2
output.description: The third output bit of the counter.

output.name: Q3
output.description: The fourth output bit of the counter.

output.name: Q4
output.description: The fifth output bit of the counter.

output.name: Q5
output.description: The sixth output bit of the counter.

output.name: Q6
output.description: The seventh output bit of the counter.

output.name: Q7
output.description: The eighth output bit representing the most significant bit of the counter.

title: Buffer Initialization Function
description: This function initializes a buffer with a specified byte value. It ensures that the buffer is properly aligned for 32-bit access, filling in the required number of bytes either individually or in blocks of 32 bits until the entire specified size is initialized.
name: _BUFFER_INIT

input.name: PT
input.description: Pointer to the buffer that needs to be initialized.

input.name: SIZE
input.description: The size in bytes of the buffer to be initialized.

input.name: INIT
input.description: The byte value with which to initialize the buffer.

return_value.description: Returns TRUE upon successful initialization of the buffer.

title: Real2 Addition Function
description: This function performs addition operations involving a Real2 derived type and a REAL type. It updates the Real2 output structure based on the provided inputs.
name: R2_ADD

input.name: X
input.description: A derived type that contains two real numbers, RX and R1.

input.name: Y
input.description: A real number that will be added to the components of the Real2 input.

output.name: R2_ADD
output.description: The output structure of type Real2 containing the results of the addition operations.

return_value.description: The resulting Real2 structure after performing the addition.

fields.name: RX
fields.description: The result of adding Y, X.R1, and X.RX.

fields.name: R1
fields.description: The result of computing temp minus RX, plus Y, and X.R1.

title: Langevin Function
description: The function calculates the Langevin value based on the input parameter X. If X is 0, the function returns 0.0. Otherwise, it computes the Langevin value using the formula COTH(X) - 1.0 / X.
name: LANGEVIN

input.name: X
input.description: Input parameter representing a real number.

output.name: LANGEVIN
output.description: The calculated Langevin value based on the input parameter X.

return_value.description: Returns the Langevin value, which is a real number calculated based on the input X.

title: Find Maximum Value in an Array
description: This function is designed to find and return the maximum value from a specified array of real numbers. It takes a pointer to an array and its size as inputs, iterates through the array, and identifies the largest value.
name: ARRAY_MAX

input.name: pt
input.description: A pointer to an array of real numbers from which the maximum value is to be found.

input.name: size
input.description: The number of elements in the array.

return_value.description: The maximum value found in the array.

title: Selective Output Block for Three Inputs
description: This function block processes three boolean inputs to generate two boolean outputs based on logical conditions and a time delay. The output Q is determined by the logical OR of combinations of the inputs, while the output W is influenced by the elapsed time from a timer dependent on the XOR condition of the inputs.
name: SEL2_OF_3B

input.name: IN1
input.description: First boolean input.

input.name: IN2
input.description: Second boolean input.

input.name: IN3
input.description: Third boolean input.

input.name: TD
input.description: Time duration for the delay timer.

output.name: Q
output.description: Output boolean indicating the result of the OR logic on the inputs.

output.name: W
output.description: Output boolean representing the state of the timer output.

title: Insert into List Function
description: This function inserts a given string into a list at a specified position, using a separator byte. It checks for space in the list before proceeding with the insertion and returns a boolean indicating the success of the operation.
name: LIST_INSERT

input.name: SEP
input.description: The separator byte used to tokenize the list.

input.name: POS
input.description: The position in the list where the new string should be inserted.

input.name: INS
input.description: The string that will be inserted into the list.

in/out.name: LIST
in/out.description: The list into which the string will be inserted.

return_value.description: Returns TRUE if the string was successfully inserted, otherwise FALSE.

title: Convert Octal String to Byte
description: This function converts an octal string (up to 10 characters long) into its corresponding byte value. Each character in the octal string should represent a digit from 0 to 7. The function processes each character by converting it from its ASCII value to the corresponding decimal value and combines them to form the final byte value.
name: OCT_TO_BYTE

input.name: OCT
input.description: An octal string consisting of up to 10 characters representing values in the octal numeral system.

return_value.description: The resulting byte value obtained from converting the octal string.

title: AIN Function for Analog Input Conversion
description: The AIN function converts a digital input value to a real value based on given parameters including sign bit, low/high range, and bit length. The function correctly handles both signed and unsigned values.
name: AIN

input.name: in
input.description: The digital input value to be converted.

input.name: Bits
input.description: The number of bits that represent the valid portion of the digital input.

input.name: sign
input.description: The position of the sign bit in the input value; defaults to 255 indicating no sign bit.

input.name: low
input.description: The lower limit of the output range.

input.name: high
input.description: The upper limit of the output range; defaults to 10.0.

output.name: AIN
output.description: The converted real value based on the input and specified parameters.

return_value.description: The resulting real value after conversion from the digital input.

title: Calculate Sun Midday Time
description: This function calculates the local noon time (sun midday) for a given longitude and UTC date. The calculation takes into account the offset derived from the day of the year and applies it to a standard noon time.
name: SUN_MIDDAY

input.name: LON
input.description: The longitude in degrees for which the noon time is to be calculated.

input.name: UTC
input.description: The UTC date based on which the midday time will be computed.

output.name: SUN_MIDDAY
output.description: The calculated time of day representing the sun midday for the specified location.

return_value.description: The resulting time of day after adjusting for the calculated offset from standard noon.

title: Sign Function (SGN)
description: This function calculates the sign of a given real number. It returns 1 if the input number is greater than zero, -1 if the input number is less than zero, and 0 if the input number is exactly zero.
name: SGN

input.name: X
input.description: The real number for which the sign is to be determined.

output.name: SGN
output.description: The sign of the input number, which will be 1, -1, or 0.

return_value.description: Returns the sign of the input number as an integer value.

title: Scalar Multiplication of a 3D Vector
description: This function takes a 3-dimensional vector and a scalar (real number) as input, multiplies each component of the vector by the scalar, and returns the resulting vector.
name: V3_SMUL

input.name: A
input.description: The 3-dimensional vector that is to be multiplied by the scalar.

fields.name: X
fields.description: The x-component of the vector.

fields.name: Y
fields.description: The y-component of the vector.

fields.name: Z
fields.description: The z-component of the vector.

input.name: M
input.description: The scalar multiplier to be applied to each component of the vector.

output.name: V3_SMUL
output.description: The resulting vector after multiplication by the scalar.

fields.name: X
fields.description: The x-component of the resulting vector.

fields.name: Y
fields.description: The y-component of the resulting vector.

fields.name: Z
fields.description: The z-component of the resulting vector.

return_value.description: The resulting vector formed by multiplying each component of the input vector by the scalar.

fields.name: X
fields.description: The x-component of the resulting vector.

fields.name: Y
fields.description: The y-component of the resulting vector.

fields.name: Z
fields.description: The z-component of the resulting vector.

title: Convert Omega to Frequency
description: This function takes an input represented as 'OM' (Omega) and converts it into a frequency value by dividing it by the constant value of 2 times pi. The output of the function is a real number that represents the frequency.
name: OM_TO_F

input.name: OM
input.description: The input value representing Omega (angular velocity) in real number format.

return_value.description: The function returns the computed frequency as a real number value.

title: DT Simulation Function Block
description: This function block simulates a time-based increment based on an input start time and a speed factor. It calculates the elapsed time using the PLC system timer, modifies the time according to the speed, and updates the output with the new time value.
name: DT_SIMU

input.name: START
input.description: The starting date and time value for the simulation.

input.name: SPEED
input.description: The speed factor that modifies the time increment, with a default value of 1.0.

output.name: DTS
output.description: The updated date and time value after applying the simulation logic.

title: Standard Deviation Calculation
description: This function calculates the standard deviation of an array of real numbers. It takes as input a pointer to an array of real numbers and the size of the array. The standard deviation is calculated as the square root of the variance of the given array.
name: ARRAY_SDV

input.name: pt
input.description: A pointer to an array of real numbers whose standard deviation is to be calculated.

input.name: size
input.description: The size of the array, indicating the number of elements in the input array.

return_value.description: The calculated standard deviation of the input array of real numbers.

title: Temperature Conversion
description: This function block performs temperature conversions from Kelvin to Celsius, Fahrenheit, Rankine, and Raumur. The block takes an input temperature in Kelvin and converts it to other temperature scales using specified conversion formulas.
name: TEMPERATURE

input.name: K
input.description: Input temperature in Kelvin.

input.name: C
input.description: Celsius conversion base value, initialized to -273.15.

input.name: F
input.description: Fahrenheit conversion base value, initialized to -459.67.

input.name: Re
input.description: Raumur conversion base value, initialized to -218.52.

input.name: Ra
input.description: Rankine value to be converted.

output.name: YK
output.description: Converted temperature in Kelvin.

output.name: YC
output.description: Converted temperature in Celsius.

output.name: YF
output.description: Converted temperature in Fahrenheit.

output.name: YRe
output.description: Converted temperature in Raumur.

output.name: YRa
output.description: Converted temperature in Rankine.

title: Calculate the Inverse Hyperbolic Cotangent
description: This function computes the inverse hyperbolic cotangent (ACOTH) of a given real number X. The result is calculated using the natural logarithm of the expression (X + 1) divided by (X - 1), scaled by 0.5. It takes a single real number as input and returns a real number as output.
name: ACOTH

input.name: X
input.description: The input value for which the inverse hyperbolic cotangent is to be calculated.

return_value.description: The calculated inverse hyperbolic cotangent of the input value X.

title: Extract Specific Word from DWORD
description: This function takes a 32-bit unsigned integer (DWORD) and an 8-bit unsigned integer (BYTE) as inputs. It extracts a specific 16-bit unsigned integer (WORD) from the input DWORD. The extraction is based on shifting operations, where the BYTE parameter determines which word to extract from the DWORD by shifting left and right accordingly.
name: WORD_OF_DWORD

input.name: in
input.description: The input DWORD from which the WORD will be extracted.

input.name: N
input.description: The index of the WORD to extract from the DWORD, where N specifies which 16-bit segment to retrieve.

output.name: WORD_OF_DWORD
output.description: The output WORD extracted from the input DWORD at the specified index N.

return_value.description: The extracted 16-bit unsigned integer (WORD) from the input DWORD.

title: Interlock Function Block
description: This function block implements an interlock mechanism where two input signals are processed with a specified time delay before affecting the output signals. The outputs will be enabled based on the current state of the inputs and the delay condition.
name: INTERLOCK

input.name: I1
input.description: First input signal.

input.name: I2
input.description: Second input signal.

input.name: TL
input.description: Time delay for the interlock mechanism.

output.name: Q1
output.description: Output signal 1, reflects the state of I1 considering the delay of I2.

output.name: Q2
output.description: Output signal 2, reflects the state of I2 considering the delay of I1.

title: PID Controller Function Block
description: This function block implements a PID (Proportional, Integral, Derivative) controller. It takes a process variable input and calculates a control output based on defined PID parameters. It also incorporates limits to the output and reset functionality.
name: FT_PIDW

input.name: IN
input.description: The input process variable that the PID controller will process.

input.name: KP
input.description: The proportional gain of the PID controller, defaults to 1.0.

input.name: TN
input.description: The integral time constant of the PID controller, defaults to 1.0.

input.name: TV
input.description: The derivative time constant of the PID controller, defaults to 1.0.

input.name: LIM_L
input.description: The lower limit for the output, defaults to -1E+38.

input.name: LIM_H
input.description: The upper limit for the output, defaults to 1E+38.

input.name: RST
input.description: A reset flag that when true resets the integral component of the controller.

output.name: Y
output.description: The calculated control output of the PID controller.

output.name: LIM
output.description: A flag indicating whether the output is within the defined limits.

title: Date and Time Formatting Function
description: This function takes a DateTime input and produces a formatted string representation based on the specified format and language settings. It decodes the DateTime input to extract date and time components and applies the formatting rules defined in the format string.
name: DT_TO_STRF

input.name: DTI
input.description: Date and Time Input representing the DateTime value to format.

input.name: MS
input.description: Additional Integer Input specifying milliseconds.

input.name: FMT
input.description: Format String Input that defines the desired output format for the DateTime.

input.name: LANG
input.description: Language Input that specifies the language for formatting the output.

output.name: DT_TO_STRF
output.description: Formatted string representation of the DateTime based on the input format and language.

return_value.description: The formatted string output of the function.

title: Random Duty Cycle Generator
description: This function block generates a random duty cycle signal based on a specified period (PT) and modulation parameters (AM for amplitude and OS for offset). The output signal can be used for various automation and control applications.
name: GEN_RDM

input.name: PT
input.description: The time period for the duty cycle generation.

input.name: AM
input.description: The amplitude factor that scales the random signal, default value is 1.

input.name: OS
input.description: The offset added to the generated random signal.

output.name: Q
output.description: A boolean output indicating whether the output signal is active.

output.name: Out
output.description: The generated output signal based on the random duty cycle.

title: String Truncation and Padding Function
description: This function modifies a given string based on specified length and fill character settings. It allows truncating, padding, or centering the string with fill characters depending on the input parameters.
name: FIX

input.name: str
input.description: The input string that needs to be modified.

input.name: L
input.description: The length to which the string should be truncated or padded.

input.name: C
input.description: The character used for padding the string.

input.name: M
input.description: The mode for string modification: 1 for left truncate/pad, 2 for center pad.

output.name: FIX
output.description: The modified string after truncation and/or padding.

return_value.description: Returns the modified string after performing the specified operations.

title: Hour Extraction from DateTime
description: This function extracts the hour part from a given DateTime value. The input is a DateTime variable, and the function performs a calculation to convert it to an integer representing the hour of the day.
name: HOUR_OF_DT

input.name: XDT
input.description: A DateTime value from which the hour will be extracted.

return_value.description: An integer representing the hour part of the given DateTime value, in the range of 0 to 23.

title: Bit Load Function
description: This function manipulates bits of a BYTE input based on specified parameters. It performs bitwise operations and shifts to output a modified BYTE value. The operation differs based on the state of a boolean input.
name: BIT_LOAD_B2

input.name: I
input.description: The BYTE value to manipulate.

input.name: D
input.description: Condition to determine which operation to perform.

input.name: P
input.description: The number of bit positions to shift in the operations.

input.name: N
input.description: The number of bits to be loaded or shifted.

output.name: BIT_LOAD_B2
output.description: The resulting BYTE value after performing the bitwise operations.

return_value.description: Computed BYTE value after bit manipulation based on inputs.

title: Finite Time Derivative Calculation
description: This function block calculates the finite time derivative of an input signal over time, with a configurable scaling factor. It takes the current input value, the time since the last update, and computes the rate of change, while preventing division by zero. The block initializes on the first startup and computes the derivative only when the system is running and the time delta is greater than zero.
name: FT_DERIV

input.name: in
input.description: Current input value to be differentiated.

input.name: K
input.description: Scaling factor for the derivative calculation, default is 1.0.

input.name: run
input.description: Boolean to indicate if the calculation should be performed, default is TRUE.

output.name: out
output.description: Calculated derivative value based on the input.

title: Calculate Volume of a Sphere
description: This function calculates the volume of a sphere given its radius. The volume is computed using the formula V = (4/3) *  * r^3. The function takes the radius of the sphere as an input and returns the computed volume as a real number.
name: SPHERE_V

input.name: rx
input.description: The radius of the sphere.

return_value.description: The calculated volume of the sphere.

title: Sample High-Low Average Calculation
description: This function block calculates the average, high, and low values from a set of sampled inputs. It uses a specified time parameter to trigger the sampling and processes a defined number of samples to compute the required statistics.
name: SH_2

input.name: in
input.description: The input value to be sampled for calculations.

input.name: PT
input.description: The time period for triggering the sample calculations.

input.name: N
input.description: The number of samples to consider for the average and high/low calculations. Default value is 16.

input.name: disc
input.description: The disc value used in determining the sampling range.

output.name: out
output.description: The most recent input value that has been sampled.

output.name: trig
output.description: Indicates whether the sampling trigger has occurred.

output.name: avg
output.description: The average value computed from the sampled inputs.

output.name: high
output.description: The highest value among the sampled inputs.

output.name: low
output.description: The lowest value among the sampled inputs.

title: SH_T Function Block
description: The SH_T function block takes a real number input and a boolean enable signal. If the enable signal (E) is true, it passes the input value (IN) to the output (OUT). If E is false, the output remains unchanged.
name: SH_T

input.name: IN
input.description: The input value that will be passed to the output when enabled.

input.name: E
input.description: The enable signal that determines whether the input is passed to the output.

output.name: OUT
output.description: The output value that reflects the input value when enabled.

title: Bitwise Load with Rotation
description: This function performs a bitwise load operation with a rotation based on the input parameters. It uses conditional logic to determine whether to rotate left or apply a mask, depending on the boolean input parameter.
name: BIT_LOAD_DW2

input.name: I
input.description: The input DWORD value to be manipulated.

input.name: D
input.description: A boolean flag to determine the operation mode: TRUE for rotation left, FALSE for mask application.

input.name: P
input.description: The number of bit positions to rotate or shift.

input.name: N
input.description: The number of bits to be shifted left or right from the maximum DWORD value.

output.name: BIT_LOAD_DW2
output.description: The resulting DWORD value after the bitwise load operation.

return_value.description: The value obtained from the bit manipulation operations, as specified by the input parameters.

title: Dead Zone Function
description: This function calculates the dead zone effect based on the input value X and a threshold L. If the absolute value of X exceeds L, the function returns X; otherwise, it returns 0.0.
name: DEAD_ZONE

input.name: X
input.description: Input variable X of type REAL which is evaluated against the threshold L.

input.name: L
input.description: Input variable L of type REAL which serves as the threshold for the dead zone.

return_value.description: The result of the dead zone calculation, which is either the value of X if |X| > L or 0.0 if |X| <= L.

title: Time Check Function
description: The TIMECHECK function determines whether a given time (TD) falls within a specified time range defined by START and STOP. It handles two cases: when the STOP time is less than the START time (indicating a time range that spans midnight) and when the STOP time is greater than or equal to the START time.
name: TIMECHECK

input.name: TD
input.description: The time of day to check against the range.

input.name: START
input.description: The start time of the range.

input.name: STOP
input.description: The stop time of the range.

output.name: TIMECHECK
output.description: Returns TRUE if TD falls within the time range; otherwise, returns FALSE.

return_value.description: Indicates the result of the time check operation.

title: GDF Function Calculation
description: This function calculates a value based on the input X, which is a real number. The behavior of the function is determined by the value of X and follows specific conditional rules. If X is zero, the output is zero. If X is greater than 15.0, the output is a predefined mathematical constant (math.PI05). If X is less than -15.0, the output is the negative of that constant. For values of X between -15.0 and 15.0, the output is calculated using the ATAN and EXP functions.
name: GDF

input.name: X
input.description: Input parameter representing a real number which will influence the output based on defined conditions.

output.name: GDF
output.description: Output parameter which is a real number calculated based on the value of the input parameter X.

return_value.description: The calculated result based on the input parameter X according to specific conditional logic.

title: Flow Meter Function Block
description: This function block computes the flow measurement based on the input velocity (VX) and maintains the state of measurement through various parameters. It handles initialization, pulse operation, integration, and calculates the current flow rate based on the update time.
name: FLOW_METER

input.name: VX
input.description: Input velocity for flow calculation.

input.name: E
input.description: Enable signal for the flow measurement.

input.name: RST
input.description: Reset signal to initialize flow measurement parameters.

input.name: PULSE_MODE
input.description: Flag to indicate if the flow meter is operating in pulse mode.

input.name: UPDATE_TIME
input.description: Time interval for updating flow calculation. Default is 1 second.

output.name: F
output.description: Calculated flow rate based on input parameters.

in/out.name: X
in/out.description: Current flow measurement value.

in/out.name: Y
in/out.description: Counter for flow measurements, incremented based on calculated results.

title: Complex Addition Function
description: This function takes two complex numbers as input and returns their sum as a complex number. The operation is performed by adding the real parts and the imaginary parts of the input complex numbers separately.
name: CADD

input.name: X
input.description: The first complex number to be added.

input.name: Y
input.description: The second complex number to be added.

return_value.description: The resulting complex number obtained from the addition of X and Y.

fields.name: re
fields.description: The real part of the resulting complex number.

fields.name: im
fields.description: The imaginary part of the resulting complex number.

title: Calculate Circle Segment Area
description: This function calculates the area of a circle segment given the radius (RX) and height (HX) of the segment. The function first checks if the radius is greater than zero. If it is, it proceeds to compute the angle of the segment and then calculates the area using the formula for a circle segment.
name: CIRCLE_SEG

input.name: RX
input.description: The radius of the circle.

input.name: HX
input.description: The height of the circle segment.

return_value.description: The area of the circle segment calculated using the provided radius and height.

title: Power Calculation Function
description: This function computes the power of a given base raised to a specified exponent and multiplies it by a coefficient.
name: F_POWER

input.name: a
input.description: The coefficient to multiply with the result of the exponentiation.

input.name: x
input.description: The base value which will be raised to the power of n.

input.name: n
input.description: The exponent value to which the base x will be raised.

return_value.description: The result of the calculation, which is the coefficient multiplied by the base raised to the exponent.

title: Polynomial Evaluation Function
description: This function computes the value of a polynomial at a given point X using an array of coefficients C. The polynomial is represented in the form P(X) = c[0] + c[1]*X + c[2]*X^2 + ... + c[7]*X^7. The function should return the computed polynomial value as a REAL number.
name: F_POLY

input.name: X
input.description: The input value at which the polynomial is to be evaluated.

input.name: C
input.description: An array of coefficients for the polynomial, where each index corresponds to the coefficient for X to the power of the index.

return_value.description: The resulting value of the polynomial evaluated at X.

title: Calculate Beginning of Year Date
description: This function calculates the beginning date of a given year in the format of a DATE type. The year is provided as an integer input, which is then processed to return the corresponding date.
name: YEAR_BEGIN

input.name: y
input.description: The year for which to calculate the beginning date.

output.name: YEAR_BEGIN
output.description: The date representing the beginning of the specified year.

return_value.description: The calculated beginning date of the year based on the provided input year.

title: Easter Date Calculation
description: This function calculates the date of Easter Sunday for a given year using algorithms to determine the date based on the Gregorian calendar. It should return a DATE type that represents Easter Sunday for the specified year.
name: EASTER

input.name: year
input.description: The year for which the Easter date should be calculated, provided as an integer.

output.name: EASTER
output.description: The calculated date of Easter Sunday for the specified year.

return_value.description: The calculated date of Easter Sunday for the year input.

title: Multiplexer Function
description: This function implements a multiplexer that selects one of two input values based on a boolean condition. If the boolean input 'A' is true, the function returns 'IN0'; otherwise, it returns 'IN1'.
name: MUX_R2

input.name: IN0
input.description: First input value to be selected from.

input.name: IN1
input.description: Second input value to be selected from.

input.name: A
input.description: Boolean selector that determines which input value to return.

return_value.description: The selected input value based on the condition provided by 'A'.

title: Toggle Bit in Word
description: This function toggles a specific bit in a given WORD input. The bit position to toggle is specified by the POS parameter. The output is the modified WORD with the specified bit changed from 0 to 1 or from 1 to 0.
name: BIT_TOGGLE_W

input.name: IN
input.description: The WORD input value whose specific bit is to be toggled.

input.name: POS
input.description: The position of the bit to be toggled, where 0 represents the least significant bit.

return_value.description: The resulting WORD after toggling the specified bit.

title: Read and Compute Data with Bit Manipulation
description: This function takes a DWORD input, processes it to compute a DWORD output by performing bit counting and mathematical operations, including multiplication with constants PI and E, as well as bitwise shifting and logical OR operations.
name: RDMDW

input.name: last
input.description: The DWORD value used for bit counting and subsequent mathematical operations.

output.name: RDMDW
output.description: The resulting DWORD after applying bit manipulation and mathematical computations based on the input value.

return_value.description: The final computed DWORD value returned from the function.
